front.gametext: USED: Cancel Limited Resources.  LOST: Use 2 Force (free if Lobot on table) to examine the top card of your Reserve Deck, Force Pile and Used Pile. Return one of those three cards to the top of each deck or pile."
front.lore: Lobot's direct link with the Cloud City central computer allowed him to efficiently manipulate the floating city's resources.

front.title: Computer Interface (V)
front.gametext: Twice per turn, if your Lobot on Cloud City or you occupy three Cloud City sites with aliens, peek at the top three cards of your Reserve Deck. Take any of them into hand and replace the others in any order.
front.lore: Lobot's direct link with the Cloud City central computer allowed him to efficiently manipulate the floating city's resources.

front.title: •Concentrate All Fire
front.gametext: Each starfighter that fires a weapon in battle is power +3 for the remainder of battle. Once per turn you may cancel and redraw your starship weapon destiny just drawn. At sites related to systems you occupy, your characters who have immunity to attrition each add 2 to immunity and 1 to each of that character's weapon destiny draws.

cancels: Your starship weapon destiny draw to cause a redraw

front.title: Concussion Grenade
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your warrior. May 'throw' at same or adjacent site. Draw destiny. All characters, weapons and devices with that destiny number present at that site are lost. (Only your warrior is lost if destiny = 0.) Concussion Grenade also lost.
front.lore: Mier-Lan V-59 grenade. Blows stuff up.

combo: Concussion Grenade + Under Attack

front.title: Concussion Missiles
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your bomber, A-wing, freighter, or transport. May target a starship for free. Draw destiny. Add 1 if targetting a starfighter or squadron. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Used by veteran smugglers. Defend transports from maneuverable TIE fighters. Frequently used to arm Rebellion transports and freighters.

pulledBy: Lieutenant s'Too Vees (when at a docking bay)

front.title: Control
front.gametext: Cancel Sense or Alter. (Immune to Sense.) OR Cancel an Immediate or Mobile Effect (even if just deployed), or Force drain.
front.lore: Qui-Gon's sense of control assisted him in his final confrontation with Darth Maul. The ability to heal oneself in battle, mentally and physically, can be a huge advantage.

front.title: Control
front.gametext: Cancel one Sense or Alter card. (Immune to Sense.) OR Cancel one Immediate Effect, Mobile Effect or Force drain.
front.lore: Mystical Jedi power. Covers power of inner mind and body. Allows Jedi to exist in harmony with nature. You must learn this.

front.title: Control & Tunnel Vision
front.gametext: Cancel one Sense or Alter card. (Immune to Sense.) OR Cancel one Immediate Effect, Mobile Effect, or Force drain. OR Take one card into hand from Force Pile; reshuffle.

front.title: •Corellia
front.gametext: Light: : Your Falcon and your Corellian corvettes may deploy here as a 'react.'

combo: Corellia + Kessel Run Because of its low parsec number, Corellia makes an ideal planet to begin a Kessel Run from.

front.title: •Corellia (V)
front.gametext: Light: : Once per turn, if you occupy with a Corellian, may activate 1 Force.

front.title: Corellia Operative
front.gametext: While at a Corellia site: adds 1 to your Force drains there, is forfeit +1 (and power +1 if your Corellian is on Corellia) and, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one site to Corellia from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Many of the Alliance's best engineers are sent to Corellia. The Rebellion maintains a presence on Corellia to ensure and assist in the production of the Alliance's starships.

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

front.title: •••Corellian
front.gametext: Once per turn, one weapon or device is deploy -1 onto a Rebel at same site.
front.lore: Brindy Truchong is a typical female Corellian smuggler. Her goal in Mos Eisley is to find a quick means of providing supplies to the Rebellion.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: Corellian Corvette
front.gametext: May add 3 pilots, 4 passengers and 1 vehicle. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.
front.lore: Multi-purpose Rebel Blockade Runner. Modular interior designed for troop or cargo transport. 150 meters long. Used by Rebels, pirates, corporations and the Empire.

front.title: •Corellian Engineering Corporation
front.gametext: Deploy on Corellia system. All your freighters are deploy -1 and hyperspeed +1. Also, all your Quad Laser Cannons deploy free and add 2 to each of their weapon destiny draws. Suspended while opponent controls Corellia. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Only one of the 'Big Three' starship manufacturers to sell primarily to civilians. CEC employees take great delight in calling their highly modifiable designs 'stock'.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Corellian Engineering Corporation (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table if [Virtual Block 4] Watch Your Step on table.  X = number of spaceport sites controlled by Corellians.  While you control Corellia, your total battle destiny is +X, and once per turn, if you are about to lose Force (except from your card), may reduce loss by X. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Only one of the 'Big Three' starship manufacturers to sell primarily to civilians. CEC employees take great delight in calling their highly modifiable designs 'stock'.

front.title: •Corellian Retort
front.gametext: USED: Search your Reserve Deck, take one Captive Fury or Captive Pursuit into hand and reshuffle.  LOST: If a bounty hunter (or gangster) and Han are involved in the same battle, you may add one battle destiny (add two if gangster is Jabba)."
front.lore: 'Threepio, you tell that slimy piece of worm-ridden filth he'll get no such pleasure from us!'

combo: Corellian Retort + Han Solo + Solo Han + Warrior's Courage

front.title: •Corellian Retort (V)
front.gametext: USED: Cancel an attempt to target your Corellian (or your starship piloted by a Corellian) with a weapon.  LOST: Retrieve your just lost Corellian (or your just lost character of ability < 4) into hand.
front.lore: 'Threepio, you tell that slimy piece of worm-ridden filth he'll get no such pleasure from us!'

front.title: Corellian Slip
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a Tallon Roll, add your maneuver + ability of one pilot on you targeted starfighter to your total. OR Decrease the maneuver of an opponent's starfighter by 1 for remainder of this turn.
front.lore: First perfected by Corellian starship battle tacticians, this dangerous counter-maneuver has saved numerous hot-shot pilots in life-or-death situations.

front.title: Corellian Slip (V)
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to take an Interrupt from your Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Cancel an attempt to target your starfighter with Tallon Roll (or a weapon) Starfighter is protected from further attempts for remainder of turn. OR Cancel [Coruscant Icon] Watch Your Back! OR Exchange a card from hand for any 'spice' card you own. (Immune to Sense).
front.lore: First perfected by Corellian starship battle tacticians, this dangerous counter-maneuver has saved numerous hot-shot pilots in life-or-death situations.

front.title: Corellian Slip (V)
front.gametext: During battle, target opponent's starfighter with your snub fighter. Starfighter's gametext (except related to any capacity and the ability and identity of any permanent pilots) is canceled. OR If your pilot of ability < 3 was just lost from aboard a snub fighter, take pilot into hand.
front.lore: First perfected by Corellian starship battle tacticians, this dangerous counter-maneuver has saved numerous hot-shot pilots in life-or-death situations.

front.title: •Corporal Beezer
front.gametext: Prevents opponent from 'reacting' to same site. Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one device to same location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Rebels of ability < 3 and [Endor] Rebels are immune to Scanning Crew.
front.lore: Alderaanian slicer and technician. Trained by Brooks Carlson to serve as a Scout for Alliance commandos. She gets nervous when General Solo tries to hotwire something.

front.title: •Corporal Beezer (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to anything she pilots. (3 if a speeder bike.) Once per turn, while piloting at a battleground site, may lose 1 Force to cancel a Force drain at opponent's interior site.
front.lore: Alderaanian slicer and technician. Trained by Brooks Carlson to serve as a Scout for Alliance commandos. She gets nervous when General Solo tries to hotwire something.

front.title: •Corporal Delevar
front.gametext: Prevents your characters from having their forfeit reduced at same location (and at Hoth sites if Delevar is at Echo Med Lab). When with your FX droid, once per turn allows your character just forfeited from same site to be placed in Used Pile.
front.lore: Veteran of Battle of Hoth. Medic and Scout assigned to General Solo's assault force. Prides himself on being an efficient soldier in General Madine's commando organization.

front.title: •Corporal Delevar (V)
front.gametext: Once per game, may deploy 2-1B here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per turn, if present at a site, may 'operate' on your Disarmed character (or your just 'hit' non-droid character of ability < 4) present here; character is restored to normal.
front.lore: Veteran of Battle of Hoth. Medic and Scout assigned to General Solo's assault force. Prides himself on being an efficient soldier in General Madine's commando organization.

front.title: •Corporal Janse
front.gametext: When firing a character weapon, adds 1 to each weapon destiny draw. When Janse fires an A280 Sharpshooter Rifle at a character at an adjacent site and is using Sorry About The Mess, it is a Used Interrupt.
front.lore: Sharpshooter from Ukio. Recently joined the Alliance. Former BlasTech employee who evaluated new weapon designs. Served as a Scout on hunting expeditions.

combo: Corporal Janse + A280 Sharpshooter Rifle + Firefight
Corporal Janse + A280 Sharpshooter Rifle + Sorry About The Mess

front.title: •Corporal Kensaric
front.gametext: When present at an exterior site battleground site with your other scout, adds 2 (or 1 if Goo Nee Tay on table) to deploy cost of opponent's characters, vehicles and starships to same site.
front.lore: Scout responsible for covering the tracks of General Solo's strike team. Served under Bren Derlin during the Battle of Hoth.

combo: Corporal Kensaric + Goo Nee Tay

front.title: •Corporal Marmor
front.gametext: Reduces X by 3 on Docking And Repair Facilities when a Star Cruiser is held there. When he is at a docking bay where you have just deployed a starfighter, once per turn you may retrieve 1 Force.
front.lore: Corellian dock mechanic. Defected to the Alliance with General Madine. Manages staff of 75 starfighter and 12 star cuiser mechanics in Home One's rear quadrant.

combo: Corporal Marmor + Docking And Repair Facilities

front.title: •Corporal Midge
front.gametext: Adds 1 to each of his character weapon destiny draws (2 when firing a rifle and all your ability here is provided by scouts). While on Endor, adds 1 to your Force drains at your exterior Endor sites where you have a scout of ability > 2 (and no Ewoks).
front.lore: Self-taught marksman and Scout from a rural region of Chandrila. Inspired by Mon Mothma to join the Alliance. Newly recruited into Madine's commandos as a field technician.

front.title: •Corporal Rushing
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Naboo. While firing a blaster, adds one to total weapon destiny. Once per battle, if a battle droid was just hit by a blaster here, battle droid is lost and oppopnent loses 1 Force.
front.lore: Royal Naboo security officer in charge of protecting Amidala's Throne Room. His wife and children were captured when the Trade Federation invaded the planet.

front.title: •Corran Horn
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power and 2 to maneuver of anything he pilots. During your move phase, may use 1 Force to 'break cover' of opponent's Undercover spy at same site. Power +3 in battle against opponent's spy or bounty hunter. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Corellian. Former counter-intelligence agent and spy for CorSec (Corellian Security). Gifted tactician. One of Wedge Antilles' best pilots. Member of Rogue Squadron.

combo: Corran Horn + Double Agent
Corran Horn + Red 6 (or any other spy with pilot ability) Deploy Corran Horn on Red 6 to any system even without presece or Force icons.

front.title: •Corran Horn In Rogue 9
front.gametext: Permanent pilot is •Corran Horn, who provides ability of 4. Weapon destiny draws are -2 here. While with a snub fighter, attrition against opponent is +1 here. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Blank.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by The Advocate Council)"

front.title: •Corulag
front.gametext: Light: : If you control, all non-unique Rebels are power and forfeit +1 and Rebel guards may move.

front.title: •Coruscant
front.gametext: Light: : If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Coruscant sites.

front.title: •Coruscant
front.gametext: Light: : Force drain +1 here. If Rebels control this system, Imperials and Imperial starships are deploy +2.

front.title: •Coruscant (V)
front.gametext: Light: : If just converted, may raise this system to the top.

front.title: •Coruscant Celebration
front.gametext: Deploy on Coruscant system if you occupy at least two Coruscant battleground sites. During each of your control phases, retrieve 1 Force for each Coruscant battleground you occupy. Canceled if opponent controls this system. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Despite Imperial propaganda, the citizens of Coruscant very much wish for the collapse of the Empire.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Coruscant Guard
front.gametext: Once per turn, may use 1 Force to add 2 to politics of one of your senators present for remainder of turn. While present at Galactic Senate, all characters without politics here are forfeit = 0 (except Coruscant Guards).
front.lore: Highly trained guard personnel play a valuable role in protecting the various dignitaries and political figures that frequently have business to attend to on Coruscant.

front.title: •Coruscant: Docking Bay
front.gametext: Light: : Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.

front.title: •Coruscant: Galactic Senate
front.gametext: Light: : During battles here, a character's power is equal to that character's politics.

combo: Coruscant: Galactic Senate + Plead My Case To The Senate + Sanity And Compassion

front.title: •Coruscant: Jedi Archives
front.gametext: Light: : Once per game, if Jedi Council Chamber on table, may take Speak To The Jedi Council into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

front.title: •Coruscant: Jedi Council Chamber
front.gametext: Light: : [Episode I] Yoda may deploy here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to Revolution.

combo: Coruscant: Jedi Council Chamber + Plead My Case To The Senate Objective
Coruscant: Jedi Council Chamber + Speak With The Jedi Council

front.title: •Coruscant: Jedi Council Chamber (V)
front.gametext: Light: : May not be deployed if your Senate on table. If you just deployed a Jedi Council Member here, may take any one card into hand from Used Pile; reshuffle.

front.title: •Coruscant: Lower Levels
front.gametext: Light: : If your Insurgent present, Force Drain + 1 here.

front.title: •Coruscant: Main Power Plant
front.gametext: Light: : Attempts to 'disable' the Planetary Shield are +2 for each Rogue Squadron pilot here.

front.title: •Coruscant: Night Club
front.gametext: Light: : Your characters here are defense value -1 and may not be excluded from battle.

front.title: •Coruscant: Night Club
front.gametext: Light: : Your characters here are defense value -1 and may not be excluded from battle.

front.title: •Coruscant: Senate Landing Platform
front.gametext: Light: : Starships may deploy here. Once per turn, may deploy a starship site from Reserve Deck if its starship card on table; reshuffle.

front.title: •Count Me In
front.gametext: Deploy on Leia if That's One is on table. I Know is a Used Interrupt. Once per battle, when Leia is battling with Han and Chewie and you are about to draw a card for battle or weapon destiny, you may instead use Leia's ability number.
front.lore: Leia couldn't let Han out of her sight.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas

front.title: •Count Me In (V)
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on Leia (even if a captive) or Back Door. Attrition against opponent is +1. Once per game, may place this Effect out of play to cancel a Force drain at same or related site.
front.lore: Leia couldn't let Han out of her sight.

front.title: •Courage Of A Skywalker
front.gametext: One of your Skywalkers present during a battle at a site, for remainder of turn, loses immunity to attrition but adds ability to power (he or she may not apply ability toward drawing battle destiny). OR During a duel, add one destiny to your total.
front.lore: Despite being alone, trapped and desperately outmatched, Luke continued his battle with the Dark Lord of the Sith.

combo: Courage Of A Skywalker + Draw Their Fire + Treva Home (Psychobabble)

front.title: •Courage Of A Skywalker (V)
front.gametext: During battle, unless Inner Strength on table, initiate a duel between your participating Skywalker (except Shmi) present and a participating Dark Jedi present. Both players draw two destiny and add ability. Higher total wins. Loser is lost.
front.lore: Despite being alone, trapped and desperately outmatched, Luke continued his battle with the Dark Lord of the Sith.

front.title: •Covert Landing
front.gametext: USED: If your shuttle (including a shuttle vehicle) is in battle, add one battle destiny.  LOST: If your starfighter just landed at a site where opponent has no presence, deploy scouts (and weapons on those scouts) aboard it (capacity permitting) from Reserve Deck; reshuffle."
front.lore: The stolen code allowed the Rebels to land their strike team on the Endor surface undetected - or so they thought.

combo: Covert Landing + Luminous

front.title: •Covert Landing (V)
front.gametext: USED: During opponent's move phase, if Bunker 'blown away,' peek at top four cards of a player's Reserve Deck; replace in any order.  LOST: During opponent's move phase, deploy a Rebel scout of ability < 5 from Reserve Deck to an Endor site opponent does not occupy; reshuffle."
front.lore: The stolen code allowed the Rebels to land their strike team on the Endor surface undetected - or so they thought.

front.title: Crack Shot
front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on table. Any card which is 'hit' may not be used to satisfy attrition. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Imperial recruits are repeatedly assured that small cracks between the plates of their armor pose little risk from laser fire. Their first day of battle often tells a different story.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Crash Site Memorial
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. If you just lost a vehicle, droid, weapon, or device, may stack it here. Once during your deploy phase, you may exchange any one card in hand with one card stacked here. Any cards stacked here are considered 'supporting.'
front.lore: Mos Eisley was built around wreckage of the colony ship Dowager Queen. The wreck remains as a monument where residents leave junk for Jawa scavengers.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
canceledBy: Turn It Off! Turn It Off!

front.title: •Crash Site Memorial (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Dune Sea, Hutt Canyon, Jawa Camp, and Jawa Canyon are deserts. At deserts you occupy with a Jawa, Rontos and Sandcrawlers are power +1 and forfeit +2, and opponent's Force generation is canceled. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Mos Eisley was built around wreckage of the colony ship Dowager Queen. The wreck remains as a monument where residents leave junk for Jawa scavengers.

front.title: •Credits Will Do Fine
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on table. If you just initiated a Force drain (or won a battle) at Watto's Junkyard, opponent loses 1 Force (cannot be reduced) and stacks lost card here face down. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'No, they won't!'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Credits Will Do Fine + I Feel The Conflict + Draw Their Fire
Credits Will Do Fine + Master Qui-Gon (V)

front.title: •Critical Error Revealed
front.gametext: If you have a leader at your war room, peek at the top card of opponent's Reserve Deck. You may place it on bottom of that Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Hologram technology allows effecient communication of complex intelligence during war room briefings.

front.title: •Crusher Roodown
front.gametext: Power -3 with Unkar Plutt. Once per battle, may use 1 Force to peek at cards stacked on Graveyard Of Giants; place one in owner's Lost Pile to add one destiny to total power at same or adjacent site. May take your starship just drawn for destiny into hand.
front.lore: Abednedo scavenger.

front.title: •CT-5385 (Tup)
front.gametext: During any move phase, may fire a weapon at an Undercover spy. Permanent weapon is Clone Snipe Rifle (may target a character or vehicle for free; draw destiny; target hit if destiny +2 > defense value).
front.lore: Clone trooper.

front.title: •CT-5555 (Fives)
front.gametext: Once per turn, if you just drew a destiny of 5, may take that card into hand. During any deploy phase, may use 1 Force to target a Dark Jedi present. Draw destiny. If destiny = 5, target loses immunity to attrition for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Clone trooper and spy.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Chris Menzel)"
combo: Commander Cody + Captain Rex + CT-5555 (Fives)

front.title: •Cyborg Construct
front.gametext: Deploy on an alien of ability < 3. Each turn, you may 'store' one card from hand face-down here. Holds up to three cards (six on Lobot). You may play or deploy cards from here as if from hand. Place stored cards in Used Pile if device lost or removed from character.
front.lore: Biotech's latest model, the Aj^g, boasts greater storage capacity than all other models combined. Advertised as, 'Artificial intelligence worth shaving your head for.'

front.title: •Cyborg Construct (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on an alien of ability < 3. While at a Scomp link, Computer Interface is a Used Interrupt, and once per turn may use 1 Force to take Computer Interface into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per turn, if on Lobot, may deploy a trooper here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Biotech's latest model, the Aj^g, boasts greater storage capacity than all other models combined. Advertised as, 'Artificial intelligence worth shaving your head for.'

front.title: CZ-3 (Seezee-Three)
front.gametext: If opponent has just initiated a battle or Force drain at CZ-3's location or an adjacent site, you may 'react' by deploying cards (at normal use of the Force) to that battle or Force drain location.
front.lore: CZ comm droid built by Serv-O-Droid. Outdated but still commonly in use. Built-in comlink. Sophisticated scramblers and encryption programming.

combo: CZ-3 (Seezee-Three) + Rebel Trooper +  Rebel Guard

front.title: •Dack Ralter
front.gametext: Adds 1 to weapon destiny draws of anything he is aboard as a passenger (adds 3 if aboard Rogue 1 or with Luke).
front.lore: Born in an Imperial labor camp on Kalist 6. Joined the Rebellion after his escape. Young student of Commander Skywalker. Experienced crackshot gunner.

front.title: •Dack Ralter (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to the power of anything he pilots. Heroic. Rogue Squadron Pilot. During battle when Dack (or a starship or vehicle he pilots) fires a weapon, may add 1 to total weapon destiny and hit targets are power -2. If Dack is about to leave table may place him in Used Pile instead.
front.lore: Born in an Imperial labor camp on Kalist 6. Joined the Rebellion after his escape. Young student of Commander Skywalker. Experienced crackshot gunner.

front.title: •Dagobah: Bog Clearing
front.gametext: Light: : Your starfighters may deploy here and immune to Awwww, Cannot Get Your Ship Out here.

front.title: •Dagobah: Jungle
front.gametext: Light: : No starships or vehicles here. Your creatures are deploy -2 here.

front.title: •Dagobah: Swamp
front.gametext: Light: : At end of your turn, your starships and vehicles here 'sink' to Used Pile.

front.title: •Dagobah: Training Area
front.gametext: Light: : Once per turn, may search Reserve Deck. Take one Jedi Test into hand. Reshuffle deck.

pulls: It Is The Future You See

front.title: •Dagobah: Yoda's Hut
front.gametext: Light: : If Yoda here, once per turn, may subtract 2 from attrition against you at another location.

front.title: •Dams Denna
front.gametext: Once during your deploy phase, you may deploy a Kaadu, Fambaa or Eopie to same site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. If you just lost a creature vehicle from same site, you may place that creature in your Used Pile.
front.lore: Knowledgable animal trainer and herd-master. Collector of Linn'con memorabilia.

front.title: •Dantooine
front.gametext: Light: : Your capital starships deploy -2 and your starfighters deploy -1 here.

front.gametext: Dantooine Base Operations:Deploy Dantooine system.{While} this side up, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy from Reserve Deck to Dantooine one site or non-unique Rebel; reshuffle. Your Force drains are +1 at systems where you have a squadron present.{Flip} this card if opponent controls at least two Dantooine locations.{Place} out of play if Dantooine is 'blown away.'

front.title: •Dantooine Engineering Corps
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  While Dantooine Base Operations or More Dangerous Than You Realize on table, Dantooine sites are immune to [Premium] No Escape, and your Force generation is +1.  While you control a Dantooine site, your squadrons may deploy without replacement for X Force, where X = squadron's power -3. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Alliance carefully chooses docking bays from which to launch limited offensives.

front.title: •Dantooine: Base - Docking Bay
front.gametext: Light: : Your docking bay transit from here is free.

front.title: •Dantooine: Base - Operations Center
front.gametext: Light: : Your T-47s may move as a 'react' to Dantooine sites. Immune to Revolution.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Brandon Schele - Corellia Regionals 2005)

front.title: •Dark Approach
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle, you may do one of the following: Add one destiny to power only. OR If you have a character weapon present, select one opponent's character present to lose all immunity to attrition for remainder of battle.
front.lore: 'The Force is with you, young Skywalker. But you are not a Jedi yet.'

front.title: •Dark Approach (V)
front.gametext: During the weapons segment, if your character is about to be lost, it is instead lost at end of battle (forfeit for 0).  OR  Play a Defensive Shield from under your Starting Effect.  OR  During the power segment, cancel a just drawn destiny (except battle destiny).
front.lore: 'The Force is with you, young Skywalker. But you are not a Jedi yet.'

front.title: Dark Dissension
front.gametext: USED: Cancel Dark Collaboration or Lone Pilot.  LOST: If two Imperials each with ability > 2 are in a battle together, use 2 Force to draw two destiny. Subtract that amount from opponent's attrition and total power (cannot fall below zero)."
front.lore: The huge Imperial officers corps, with its high rate of turnover, is ripe with competitiveness and ambition. Advancement comes at the expense of another's career.

front.title: Dark Dissension (V)
front.gametext: USED: Take Demotion into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR For remainder of turn, cancel the game text of an Imperial (except a Dark Jedi) present with another Imperial.  LOST: Cancel Imperial Command (unless limiting your battle destiny draws)."
front.lore: The huge Imperial officers corps, with its high rate of turnover, is ripe with competitiveness and ambition. Advancement comes at the expense of another's career.

front.title: •Darklighter Spin
front.gametext: During a battle at a system or sector, if you are about to draw a card for battle destiny, you may instead use the maneuver number of your starfighter in that battle.
front.lore: Biggs improvised this maneuver shortly after joining the Alliance. By spinning his starfighter while firing all four cannons, he was able to destroy multiple incoming targets.

front.title: •Darklighter Spin (V)
front.gametext: Deploy a battleground system from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  OR  If opponent just modified your battle destiny draw, cancel and redraw it (it may not be modified).  OR  If opponent just canceled your battle destiny draw, make that destiny = X instead, where X is the number of battlegrounds you occupy.
front.lore: Biggs improvised this maneuver shortly after joining the Alliance. By spinning his starfighter while firing all four cannons, he was able to destroy multiple incoming targets.

front.title: •Darth Maul's Demise
front.gametext: If your [Episode I] Jedi just defeated Maul in lightsaber combat, draw destiny. Add 2 if Qui-Gon out of play. If total > 6, place Maul out of play and you may search your Lost Pile and take any one card into hand. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: Despite coming face to face with the first Sith to be seen in a millennia, the young Padawan was still a force to be reckoned with.

front.title: •Dash
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to increase a character's or creature vehicle's landspeed by 1 for remainder of turn. OR Use 3 Force to move one of your characters as a 'react' (free if character is a scout).
front.lore: See Luke run. Run Luke, run!

front.title: •Dash in Rogue 10
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. Permanent pilot is •Dash, who provides ability of 3. During battle, if with another T-47 and about to draw battle destiny, may draw two and choose one. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Enclosed.

front.title: •Dash in Rogue 10
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. Permanent pilot is •Dash, who provides ability of 3. During battle, if with another T-47 and about to draw battle destiny, may draw two and choose one. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Enclosed.

combo: This card gains immune to attrtion < 6 from Echo Base Garrison

front.title: •Dash Rendar
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Outrider, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise, and once per battle, may reduce power of one opponent's starship in same battle by power of Outrider for remainder of battle.
front.lore: Emperor banished Rendar family from Coruscant. Became gambler and smuggler. Brought down AT-AT at the Battle of Hoth. Works for Rebel Alliance from time to time. Corellian.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
combo: Dash Rendar + Outrider + Moving To Attack Position

front.title: •Dash Rendar (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting alone (or at same location as opponent's AT-AT or Imperial), draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise and opponent draws no more than one battle destiny here. Dash is a matching pilot for any unique (•) Rogue speeder.
front.lore: Emperor banished Rendar family from Coruscant. Became gambler and smuggler. Brought down AT-AT at the Battle of Hoth. Works for Rebel Alliance from time to time. Corellian.

front.title: •Dash Rendar (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. May move as a 'react'. When in battle with Leebo (or opponent's gangster, [Permanent Weapon] card, or [Maintenance] card), may draw one destiny; subtract that amount from opponent's total power and attrition.
front.lore: Emperor banished Rendar family from Coruscant. Became gambler and smuggler. Brought down AT-AT at the Battle of Hoth. Works for Rebel Alliance from time to time. Corellian.

front.title: •Daughter Of Skywalker
front.gametext: Deploys -3 on Tydirium, Endor or Dagobah. May be deployed instead of Luke by Mind What You Have Learned (that card then targets Leia instead of Luke for remainder of game). While at any exterior site, adds one Light side icon. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Scout. Leader. Made friends with Wicket. Negotiated an alliance with the Ewoks. Leia found out the truth about her father from Luke in the Ewok village.

combo: Daughter Of Skywalker + Jerus Jannick
Daughter Of Skywalker + Warrior's Courage Add two battle destinies if Leia is defending a battle alone at a site.

front.title: •Daughter Of Skywalker (V)
front.gametext: If in hand, may place her under Reserve Deck. May be targeted instead of Luke by Mind What You Have Learned (that card then targets Leia instead of Luke for remainder of game). May deploy Reflection from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Scout. Leader. Made friends with Wicket. Negotiated an alliance with the Ewoks. Leia found out the truth about her father from Luke in the Ewok village.

front.title: •Daughter Of Skywalker (V)
front.gametext: If in hand, may place her under Reserve Deck. May be targeted instead of Luke by Mind What You Have Learned (that card then targets Leia instead of Luke for remainder of game). May deploy Reflection from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Scout. Leader. Made friends with Wicket. Negotiated an alliance with the Ewoks. Leia found out the truth about her father from Luke in the Ewok village.

front.title: Deactivate The Shield Generator
front.gametext: Deploy on Bunker. Once during your control phase, if you control Bunker with a Rebel, you may attempt to 'blow away' Bunker as follows: Charges! Come On, Come On!: Draw two destiny. Add 3 to total for each Explosive Charge on Bunker. Move! Move! Move!: If total destiny > 12, your characters here may relocate to Back Door for free, Bunker and Landing Platform (if on table) are 'blown away,' opponent loses 8 Force and this card is lost.

combo: Deactivate The Shield Generator+ Major Hewex
Deactivate The Shield Generator + Throw Me Another Charge Adds 1 to Deactivate The Shield Generator total.

front.title: •Death Star
front.gametext: Light: : Deploy if Death Star Plans completed and and Death Star system not on table. If 'blown away,' Dark Side loses 8 Force.

front.title: •Death Star Plans
front.gametext: Deploy on any Death Star site(except docking bay). Target one of your droids(not on Death Star). When target reaches Utinni Effect, 'steal' plans. If target then moves to any Yavin 4 site, draw 3 destiny. Retrieve that much lost Force. Lose Utinni Effect.
front.lore: 'What's so important? What's he carrying?' 'The technical readouts of that battle station. I only hope that when the data is analyzed, a weakness can be found.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
canceledBy: Shut Him Up Or Shut Him Down

front.title: •Death Star: Detention Block Control Room
front.gametext: Light: : If you control, Force Drain +1 here and all imprisoned characters on Death Star are released.

cards.counterpart: Death Star: Detention Block Control Room

front.title: •Death Star: Detention Block Corridor
front.gametext: Light: : Force drain +1 here. Whenever you release a captive here, retrieve 1 Force (4 if Leia).

front.title: •Death Star: Docking Bay 327
front.gametext: Light: : Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.

front.title: •Death Star: Level 6 Core Shaft Corridor
front.gametext: Light: : If you control, Luke and Obi-Wan are power +2 on Death Star.

front.title: •Death Star: Trash Compactor
front.gametext: Light: : You may deploy here without presence. If you control, Force drain +1 here.

front.title: •Death Star: Trench
front.gametext: Light: : 'Trench Rules' in effect and each of your starfighters is maneuver - 2 here.

combo: Death Star: Trench + Tight Squeeze

front.title: •Debnoli
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When firing a character weapon, adds 1 to total weapon destiny and characters he 'hits' are forfeit=0. Immune to attrition < 2 (< 5 while armed with a blaster).
front.lore: Good-natured patron of Mos Eisley cantina, until the Empire impounded his starship. Expert marksman. Seeking revenge on the Empire.

front.title: •Debnoli (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While with an Imperial, you may initiate battle here for free. Permanent weapon is blaster rifle (may target a character or creature for free; draw destiny; target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if destiny +1 > defense value).
front.lore: Good-natured patron of Mos Eisley cantina, until the Empire impounded his starship. Expert marksman. Seeking revenge on the Empire.

front.title: •Declaration Of Rebellion
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Bail, Leia, and Mon Mothma are Insurgents. While an Insurgent present at a battleground, your total battle destiny is +1, and, if with your non-unique character, each may forfeit for 4 when hit. Once per game, may take one K'lor'slug into hand from reserve deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter).
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Defiance
front.gametext: May add 5 pilots, 6 passengers, 1 vehicle and 3 starfighters. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 2. Each of it's weapon destiny draws are +2. Capital starships it hits are power -5.
front.lore: Fleet rear guard. Weapon batteries hard-wired to central targeting processor. Coordinates vicious crossfire against enemy captial starships.

front.title: •Dejarik Hologameboard
front.gametext: Light: : 'Dejarik Rules' in effect here.

front.title: Demotion
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on any Imperial except Vader, Emperor or a stormtrooper. That Imperial is power -2 and its game text is canceled.
front.lore: Repercussions for failure are severe in the Imperial military. Many officers prefer demotion to 'alternative' punishment from Darth Vader.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Demotion (V)
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on an Imperial leader of ability < 5 or a senator. That character's game text is canceled. If present with another Demotion, this Effect lost.
front.lore: Repercussions for failure are severe in the Imperial military. Many officers prefer demotion to 'alternative' punishment from Darth Vader.

front.title: •Deneb Both
front.gametext: When deployed, draw up to 2 cards from top of Reserve Deck. Unless Graak on table, while at a battleground and opponent is losing Force from Force drains at same or adjacent site, lost Force must come from Force Pile, if possible.
front.lore: Shy Ithorian forester. She seeks to leave Tatooine for a better life. Firm adherent to Ithorian philosophy of planting two trees for every one harvested.

combo: Deneb Both + Draw Their Fire

front.title: •Depa Billaba
front.gametext: Deploys only to Jedi Council Chamber. While at Jedi Council Chamber, immune to attrition and once per turn may use 1 Force to peek at the top card of any Reserve Deck and place that card on top of owner's Reserve Deck or Used Pile.
front.lore: Chalactan Jedi Master who was rescued by Mace Windu from space pirates when she was six months old. Jedi Council member who is reknowned for her insights.

combo: Depy Billaba + Are You Brain Dead?!
Depa Billaba + Encampment or Deploy regardless of location deployment restrictions.
Depa Bilaba + Smoke Screen

front.title: •Depa Billaba (V)
front.gametext: If at least two [Light Side] icons here, once during your control phase may draw top card of Reserve Deck. If at least two [Dark Side] icons here, may forfeit in place of your hit non-Jedi character present with Depa (forfeit = 0), restoring that character to normal.
front.lore: Chalactan Jedi Master who was rescued by Mace Windu from space pirates when she was six months old. Jedi Council member who is reknowned for her insights.

front.title: •Derek 'Hobbie' Klivian
front.gametext: Power +2 when at same site as Biggs. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (3 if a Star Destroyer is at same location). When piloting Rogue 4, also adds 2 to maneuver.
front.lore: Defected from the Empire with Biggs Darklighter. Aided in mutiny aboard the transport Rand Ecliptic. Served in the Ecliptic Evaders. Luke's wingman at the Battle of Hoth.

front.title: •Derek 'Hobbie' Klivian (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting Rogue 4 (or any X-wing), draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. Permanent weapon is Rogue Blaster (may target a character or creature for free; draw destiny; target hit and it's forfeit = 0, if destiny + 1 > defense value).
front.lore: Defected from the Empire with Biggs Darklighter. Aided in mutiny aboard the transport Rand Ecliptic. Served in the Ecliptic Evaders. Luke's wingman at the Battle of Hoth.

front.title: •Derek 'Hobbie' Klivian (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting Rogue 4 (or any X-wing), draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. Permanent weapon is Rogue Blaster (may target a character or creature for free; draw destiny; target hit and its forfeit = 0, if destiny + 1 > defense value).
front.lore: Defected from the Empire with Biggs Darklighter. Aided in mutiny aboard the transport Rand Ecliptic. Served in the Ecliptic Evaders. Luke's wingman at the Battle of Hoth.

front.title: •Descent Into The Dark
front.gametext: During your turn, if either player just placed a card in a Used Pile, deploy on table. All Used Piles are immediately re-circulated. When any player places one or more cards in a Used Pile, Immediate Effect canceled.
front.lore: Jedi training is a journey into the depths of an apprentice's subconscious, where one must learn to use the Force wisely. 'A Jedi's strength flows from the Force.'

pulledBy: Don't Do That Again - Defensive Shield
Don't Do That Again (V) - Defensive Shield
We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Descent Into The Dark (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. While you have less than 10 Life Force, your battle and weapon destiny draws are +1.
front.lore: Jedi training is a journey into the depths of an apprentice's subconscious, where one must learn to use the Force wisely. 'A Jedi's strength flows from the Force.'

front.title: <>Desert
front.gametext: Light: : Your Jawas may deploy here. Sandwhirl here moves only if on Tatooine. May not be deployed to Bespin, Coruscant, Dagobah, Hoth, Kessel or Naboo.

front.title: Desperate Reach
front.gametext: During your move phase, relocate one of your characters (unless Disarmed) from Weather Vane to any Cloud City site. Character may not move for remainder of turn. OR Cancel Imperial Barrier or The Shield Doors Must Be Closed.
front.lore: If only someone had given Luke a hand.

cancels: The Shield Doors Must Be Closed

front.title: Desperate Reach (V)
front.gametext: Take Houjix or [Reflections II] R2-D2 into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Cancel Dark Jedi Presence, I Have You Now, or Maul Strikes. OR Place a card stacked on Droid Racks in opponent's Lost Pile. OR If a lightsaber was just 'swung' during battle, it may not target again this battle.
front.lore: If only someone had given Luke a hand.

front.title: •Desperate Tactics
front.gametext: If your vehicle weapon was just fired during a battle, add one battle destiny. OR During a battle at a site where you have an artillery weapon or vehicle weapon, cancel all opponent's immunity to attrition for remainder of battle.
front.lore: Members of the Rebel Alliance are willing to make a perilous frontal attack for their cause.

cancels: All opponent's immunity to attrition for remainder of battle

front.title: •Desperate Tactics(V)
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated battle, lose 1 Force to target a character present.  Target is power +2 and loses all immunity to attrition this turn.  OR  Once per game, exchange a character in hand with a character of the same persona from Lost Pile or Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Members of the Rebel Alliance are willing to make a perilous frontal attack for their cause.

cards.conceptBy: (Original Concept by Clayton Atkin - California States 2009)"

front.title: •Desperate Times
front.gametext: During a battle where your opponent has more characters participating than you, fire (for free) one blaster that cannot fire repeatedly, even if that blaster was already fired this battle. Add 1 to your total weapon destiny.
front.lore: Han's best tactic when outnumbered? Shoot first and don't worry about asking questions later.

front.title: Devaronian
front.gametext: Power +2 at Mos Eisley, any mobile site or any docking bay. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When playing sabacc, may use clone cards to 'clone' his own destiny number.
front.lore: Adept at sneaking through corridors and alleyways. Devaronians frequently surprise opponents. Regarded as drunkards, gamblers and fools by many species.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: •Dexter Jettster
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Coruscant or to same location as Obi-Wan. Adds one battle destiny with Jango. Dring your move phase, may use X Force to "break cover" of opponent's Undercover spy at same site, where X = spy's printed deploy cost -2.
front.lore: Information broker.

front.title: •Dice Ibegon
front.gametext: If present where an opponent's character just fired a weapon, may use 1 Force to utilize Dice's poison stinger (once per turn). Target that character and draw destiny. If destiny = ability, target is 'hit'.
front.lore: Female companion of Lak Sivrak. A Florn lamproid. Dangerous predator with a poison stinger. Rumored to have mysterious time-shifting attunement to the Force.

front.title: •Dice Ibegon (V)
front.gametext: Power +2 at a Jabba's Palace or Endor site. If just lost, place Dice in Used Pile. if opponent is about to draw destiny for an Interrupt targeting your character here, opponent must first lose 1 Force then shuffle their Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Female companion of Lak Sivrak. A Florn lamproid. Dangerous predator with a poison stinger. Rumored to have mysterious time-shifting attunement to the Force.

front.title: Diplomatic Mission To Alderaan / A Weakness Can Be Found
front.gametext: Diplomatic Mission To Alderaan:Deploy Tatooine system (with Tantive IV, non-[Reflections II] R2-D2, and Stolen Data Tapes there) and Dune Sea.{For} remainder of game, you may not deploy Sandwhirl or [Episode I] Jedi.{While} this side up, your Force drains at Tatooine system are -1. Once per turn, may deploy Alderaan or a Tatooine battleground site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Until the start of your turn, Tantive IV may be forfeited to satisfy all battle damage against you.{Flip} this card if Stolen Data Tapes 'delivered' and Rebels control two battlegrounds (a site and a system).A Weakness Can Be Found:{While} this this side up, your total battle destiny is +X, where X = number of battlegrounds occupied by Rebels of ability < 4. Once per turn, may deploy Alderaan or a Tatooine battleground site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per turn, if you just won a battle, may retrieve 1 Force.{Flip} this card if you do not occupy a battleground site and a battleground system (or you do not control any locations).

back.gametext: Diplomatic Mission To Alderaan:Deploy Tatooine system (with Tantive IV, non-[Reflections II] R2-D2, and Stolen Data Tapes there) and Dune Sea.{For} remainder of game, you may not deploy Sandwhirl or [Episode I] Jedi.{While} this side up, your Force drains at Tatooine system are -1. Once per turn, if you just won a battle, may retrieve 1 Force.{Flip} this card if you do not occupy a battleground site and a battleground system (or you do not control any locations).

front.title: •Direct Assault
front.gametext: If you have a piloted starship armed with a starship weapon, select one opponent's starship present to lose all immunity to attrition for remainder of turn. OR Cancel Dark Maneuvers.
front.lore: 'I got 'im! I got 'im!'

front.title: Disarmed
front.gametext: If both players have a character with a weapon present at same site, deploy on that opponent's character during any control phase. Character loses all weapons, is power -1 and may no longer carry weapons. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: When Dr. Evazan and Ponda Baba confronted Luke in the Cantina, Obi-Wan pointed out, 'This little one isn't worth the effort.' A brawl ensued.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Disarmed + Rebel Barrier

front.title: Disarming Creature
front.gametext: If you have a character with a weapon at same site as any creature (except Space Slug), deploy on that creature during any deploy phase, Creature is Disarmed (each time ferocity is calculated, draw destiny, subtract that amount). (Immune to Control.)
front.lore: Luke's defensive maneuver put him out of arm's way.

pulledBy: Don't Do That Again - Defensive Shield
Don't Do That Again (V) - Defensive Shield
We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Disarming Creature (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Skull is destiny +2.  Once per game, may deploy one Tauntaun Bones from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  You may play I Thought They Smelled Bad On The Outside as follows: 'USED: Lose 1 Force to take a creature (except Nudj), creature vehicle, or Beast-Rider into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.' (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Luke's defensive maneuver put him out of arm's way.

front.title: •Dismantle On Sight
front.gametext: Use 4 Force to deploy on a droid with armor (free on IG-88). At end of any opponent's turn, droid is immediately lost if present with an Imperial (or with a bounty hunter if droid is IG-88).
front.lore: After losing control of several extremely powerful and deadly assassin droids, the Empire issued a decree ordering their immediate destruction.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Dismantle On Sight (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. After starting hands are drawn, players may only take into hand or deploy on table from Reserve Deck (except as a 'react' or response) during their deploy phase (if another phase specified, it becomes 'during your deploy phase'). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: After losing control of several extremely powerful and deadly assassin droids, the Empire issued a decree ordering their immediate destruction.

front.title: Disruptor Pistol
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your warrior (1 on your non-unique warrior). May target a character or creature using 2 Force (for free if on your non-unique warrior). Draw Destiny. Target lost if destiny > defense value.
front.lore: llegal weapon easily purchased by Rebel suppliers on the black market. Rechargeable energy packs make it a cost-effective weapon.

front.title: •Diversionary Tactics
front.gametext: If your starfighter with a pilot character aboard is in a battle, target an opponent's starfighter present that has no characters aboard. For remainder of battle, both starfighters are power = 0, and target starfighter is forfeit = 0. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: Rebel pilots understand that what they lack in numbers, they must make up for in strategy. They often use diversions to remove dangerous opponents from a conflict.

front.title: •Diversionary Tactics (V)
front.gametext: USED: Target one piloted starship at a system. That starship is hyperspeed -1 for remainder of turn.  LOST: If you have 2 unique (•) piloted Rebel (or [Republic]) starfighters in battle at a system, draw destiny. If destiny < 4, exclude one starship from that battle.
front.lore: Rebel pilots understand that what they lack in numbers, they must make up for in strategy. They often use diversions to remove dangerous opponents from a conflict.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Thomas Caspersen - Norwegian Nationals 2006)"

front.title: •Do, Or Do Not
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Sense and Alter are now Lost Interrupts. Also, when and player makes a destiny draw for Sense or Alter, and that destiny draw is successful, that player loses 2 Force. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: A Jedi may choose to intervene in the natural course of events, but must accept responsibility for the consequences.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Do, Or Do Not
front.gametext: Plays on table. Sense and Alter are now Lost Interrupts. When any player makes a destiny draw for Sense or Alter, and that destiny draw is successful, that player loses 2 Force.
front.lore: A Jedi may choose to intervene in the natural course of events, but must accept responsibility for the consequences.

cards.counterpart: There Is No Try - Defensive Shield

front.title: •Do, Or Do Not & •Wise Advice
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Sense and Alter are now Lost Interrupts. When any player makes a destiny draw for Sense or Alter, and that destiny draw is successful, that player loses 2 Force. Your Immediate Effects may deploy for free. Whenever opponent cancels your card with Sense or Alter, place that canceled card in Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Docking And Repair Facilities
front.gametext: Use 4 Force to deploy on your side of table. A starship you just lost may be placed here. Holds one starship at a time. During your deploy phase, may use X Force to bring starship to hand, where X= deploy cost of that starship.
front.lore: Most Rebel frigates are equipped with repair facilities for damaged or disabled starfighters. Capital ships are serviced at larger spaceports.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Docking And Repair Facilities + Corporal Marmor Corporal Marmor reduces X by 3 on Docking And Repair Facilities when a Star Cruiser is held there.

front.title: •Dodge
front.gametext: If one of your characters of ability > 2 was just targeted by a weapon, subtract 3 from each destiny draw. OR If opponent just initiated a battle at a site against one of your lone characters present, move that character away as a 'react' (for free).
front.lore: Normally parents try to prevent their children from falling down the stairs.

combo: Dodge + All My Urchins A good way to make your opponent lose 2 Force for nothing. (l000needles)

front.title: •Doikk Na'ts
front.gametext: For each other musician at same site, the ability required to draw battle destiny here increases by 1 for both players.
front.lore: Male Bith musician. Plays Fizz (Dorenian Beshniquel) in Figrin D'an's band. Frustrated by sentients, especially humans, he prefers to work with droids.

front.title: Domain Of Evil
front.gametext: Deploy on Dagobah: Jungle or Dagobah: Cave. Target a mentor on Dagobah and an apprentice who has completed Jedi Test #2. Attempt when apprentice is present at the end of your turn and none of your cards participated in battles, Force drains or Jedi Tests during that turn. Draw training destiny. If destiny + apprentice's ability > 14, test completed. Place on apprentice. You may subtract 1 from each of opponent's destiny draws.

front.title: •Don't Do That Again
front.gametext: Plays on table. Once per game may take any Immediate Effect into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While opponent occupies no battleground systems, Mobilization Points is suspended.
front.lore: The Jedi won't tolerate silly behavior for very long.

pulls: The Time For Our Attack Has Come
What're You Tryin' To Push On Us?

front.title: •Don't Do That Again
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per game may take any Immediate Effect into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While opponent occupies no battleground systems, Mobilization Points is suspended. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Jedi won't tolerate silly behavior for very long.

pulls: The Time For Our Attack Has Come
What're You Tryin' To Push On Us?
pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Don't Do That Again (Tatooine) (V)
front.gametext: Plays on table. Always Thinking With Your Stomach, Ice Storm, and Sandwhirl are canceled. Once per game, may /\ an Immediate Effect. Unless opponent occupies a battleground system, Mobilization Points is suspended.
front.lore: The Jedi won't tolerate silly behavior for very long.

front.title: •Don't Do That Again (Tatooine) (V)
front.gametext: Plays on table. Once per game, may take an Immediate Effect into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While opponent occupies no battleground systems, Mobilization Points is suspended. 'Missing' on Always Thinking With Your Stomach is treated as 'landspeed = 0 for remainder of turn.'
front.lore: The Jedi won't tolerate silly behavior for very long.

front.lore: The Jedi won't tolerate silly behavior for very long.

front.lore: The Jedi won't tolerate silly behavior for very long.

What're You Tryin' To Push On Us?

front.title: •Don't Forget The Droids
front.gametext: USED: Cancel 3,720 To 1 if it was just inserted or revealed. (Immune to Sense.)  LOST: Cancel one opponent's battle destiny just drawn by sacrificing (losing) one of your droids in that battle."
front.lore: 'We're on our way!'

cancels: One opponent's battle destiny just drawn by sacrificing (losing) one of your droids in that battle

front.title: •Don't Forget The Droids (V)
front.gametext: USED: Cancel an attempt to target a droid with a weapon.  LOST: If a battle was just initiated at a site, lose 1 Force and place your droid there out of play to cancel all opponent's weapon and battle destiny draws during this battle.
front.lore: 'We're on our way!'

front.title: •Don't Get Cocky
front.gametext: If Luke and Han are in a battle together, you may add two battle destiny. OR If opponent just initiated a battle at a system or sector, choose one TIE/ln present to be lost.
front.lore: Luke and Han made an effective team when defending the Millennium Falcon with its quad laser cannons against attacking TIE fighters. 'Great kid! Don't get cocky.'

front.title: Don't Tread On Me
front.gametext: USED: Add 1 to your just-drawn weapon destiny.  STARTING: If you have deployed a battleground, deploy Ultimatum, Scrambled Transmission and/or Do, Or Do Not from Reserve Deck. Place Interrupt in Reserve Deck."
front.lore: Han did not take kindly to Jabba's posturing.

front.title: Don't Tread On Me (V)
front.gametext: USED: Use 1 Force to deploy an Effect that deploys for free on table (or on your side of table) and is always Immune to Alter from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  STARTING: When drawing your starting hand, draw up to 12 cards instead of 8. Place this Interrupt in Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Han did not take kindly to Jabba's posturing.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Steven Lewis - PC Volunteer Award 2008)"

front.title: Don't Tread On Me (V)
front.gametext: USED: Use 1 Force to deploy an Effect that deploys for free on table (or on your side of table) and is always Immune to Alter from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  STARTING: When drawing your starting hand, draw up to 12 cards instead of 8. Place this Interrupt in Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Han did not take kindly to Jabba's posturing.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Steven Lewis - PC Volunteer Award 2008)"
pulls: Any (Immune to Alter) effect that deploys for free on table (or your side of table)

front.title: Don't Underestimate Our Chances
front.gametext: If an opponent has just initiated a battle, triple the resulting battle damage for the eventual loser. OR Triple the result of You Overestimate Their Chances.
front.lore: 'Stand-by alert. Death Star approaching. Estimated time to firing range, fifteen minutes.'

front.title: Don't Underestimate Our Chances (V)
front.gametext: USED: Initiate a battle for free.  STARTING: If Dantooine Operations on table, deploy from Reserve Deck Operations Center, Dantooine Engineering Corps, and up to two Effects which deploy on table (or your side of table), are always [Immune to Alter], and have no deploy cost. Place this Interrupt in Lost Pile."
front.lore: 'Stand-by alert. Death Star approaching. Estimated time to firing range, fifteen minutes.'

front.title: •Dorme'
front.gametext: Once per turn, if Amidala at another location, may activate 1 Force. During your move phase, may target an opponent's Undercover spy here and draw two destiny. Choose one (take the other into hand). If destiny +1 > target's ability, 'break cover' of target.
front.lore: Spy and handmaiden.

front.title: •Dorme'
front.gametext: Once per turn, if Amidala at another location, may activate 1 Force. During your move phase, may target an opponent's Undercover spy here and draw two destiny. Choose one (take the other into hand). Target 'breaks cover' if destiny +1 > target's ability.
front.lore: Spy and handmaiden.

front.title: Double Agent
front.gametext: If both players have a spy at same site, draw destiny. Add 2 if opponent's spy is Undercover. Opponent's spy is lost if destiny > 2. OR Opponent's Tonnika Sisters present at a site cross to your side.
front.lore: Typical of impersonators, Shada double-crossed everyone. Her true affiliations still remain a mystery.

combo: Double Agent + Light Side spy.

front.title: •Down With The Emperor!
front.gametext: If no Dark Jedi is on table, deploy on Death Star system. If Death Star 'blown away,' relocate to opponent's side of table: each Imperial and Imperial starship is deploy +8 and loses immunity to attrition. Canceled if a Dark Jedi is deployed. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: News of Imperial defeat inspires the citizens of the galaxy. A major loss seriously undermines the Empire's ability to function.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Down With The Emperor! (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. All immunity to attrition is -3. You may not fire [Permanent Weapon] weapons. If opponent just lost a Dark Jedi or a battle, they lose 1 Force. During your draw phase, use 3 Force or place this Effect in Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: News of Imperial defeat inspires the citizens of the galaxy. A major loss seriously undermines the Empire's ability to function.

front.title: •Down With The Emperor! (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. All immunity to attrition is -3. You may not fire [Permanent Weapon] weapons. If opponent just lost a Dark Jedi or a battle, they lose 1 Force. During your draw phase, use 3 Force or place this Effect in Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: News of Imperial defeat inspires the citizens of the galaxy. A major loss seriously undermines the Empire's ability to function.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Draw Their Fire
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Whenever a battle is initiated, player initiating battle retrieves 1 Force and defender loses 1 Force. Also, during a battle you initiate, each time opponent plays an interrupt, opponent must first use 1 Force. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'I'm going to cut across the axis and try and draw their fire.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Draw Their Fire + Frozen Assets
Draw Their Fire + Deneb Both

Draw Their Fire + I Did It! If your opponent wants to be able to use any Interrupt in a battle you initiate, they will have to lose 2 Force each turn (provided you meet the conditions on I Did It!). (Psychobabble)

Draw Their Fire + Treva Home If you have a deck which is designed around setting up big beatdowns (eg. with Jedi Presence and supporting cards like Courage of a Skywalker), Treva is your most effective way of stopping your opponent using Ghhhk to avoid the battle damage when combined with Draw Their Fire. The other methods of achieving this result - Frozen Assets and Beggar - are each canceled by the Fanfare shield, so Treva is probably the best way to abuse Draw Their Fire in this way. (Psychobabble)
Draw Their Fire + Jawa Siesta

front.title: •Dressel
front.gametext: Light: : During your control phase, if you occupy, may lose 1 Force to retrieve a trooper into hand.

front.title: Dresselian Commando
front.gametext: Power +1 when at a forest, jungle or exterior Endor site. When in battle at an exterior site against a non-unique alien, adds one destiny to power only, prevents opponent from drawing more than one battle destiny and is immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Dresselians combat their homeworld's subjugation with supplies provided by Bothans. The Alliance uses their talents as resistance fighters. These scouts prefer to work alone.

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)
combo: Dresselian Commando + Dresselian Commando + any Jedi + Jedi Presence

front.title: •••Droid Merchant
front.gametext: Spaceport Speeders may be played at same site. Once per game, may do one of the following: activate 1 Force when you deploy a droid OR retrieve 1 Force when you deploy an astromech to a starfighter.
front.lore: Careful manipulator of funds and Imperial taxation codes. Buys droids from Jawas and sells them to the Alliance.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
canceledBy: Game text canceled by Empire's New Order

front.title: Droid Sensorscope
front.gametext: Deploy on one of your R-unit droids. During any control phase, you may use 1 Force to peek at the top card of opponent's Reserve Deck. Also, if on Dagobah, droid may move for free.
front.lore: Full-spectrum transceiver for R-unit droids including electro-photo receptors, DERs and heat and motion detectors. Data is routed directly to droids Intellex IV internal computer.

front.title: Droid Shutdown
front.gametext: Cancel an attempt by opponent to target your droid to be stolen, 'hit,' lost or captured. Droid is protected from all such attempts for remainder of turn.
front.lore: If low on energy and unable to recharge, a droid can shutdown active systems to conserve power.

front.title: •Droopy McCool
front.gametext: Power +2 at any desert or Tatooine site. Immune to Gravel Storm, Sandwhirl and desert landspeed requirements. While at Audience Chamber, all your other Kitonaks are forfeit +2. Immune to attrition < number of your musicians on table.
front.lore: Kitonak musician. Lead jizz wailer. Searching for other Kitonak rumored to be living on Tatooine. Rarely uses his real name, Snit.

combo: Droopy McCool + 3 Kitonaks at same site

front.title: Dual Laser Cannon
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your T-47. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Subtract 1 if targeting a character or creature. Add 2 if targeting a vehicle. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Sund x2-100 laser cannon. Popular among outlaw organizations because it is both cheap and powerful. Frequently mounted on T-47 airspeeders.

front.title: Dual Laser Cannon (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on your T-47. May target a character or vehicle for free. Draw destiny. Character hit, and its forfeit = 0, if destiny +2 > defense value. Vehicle hit if destiny +X > defense value, where X = T-47 pilot's ability (maximum 5).
front.lore: Sund x2-100 laser cannon. Popular among outlaw organizations because it is both cheap and powerful. Frequently mounted on T-47 airspeeders.

front.title: •Dune Sea Sabacc
front.gametext: Requirements: A Jawa at a Tatooine site. Wild cards (0-7): Sandcrawler sites, Magnetic Suction Tube, Jawa Siesta and Jawa Pack. Clone cards: Tatooine locations, sandcrawlers, Jawa weapons, and Utinni! Stakes: One device or droid with out armor.
front.lore: R'kik D'nec remains undefeated in this version of sabacc. Or at least there are no witnesses to the contrary.

combo: Dune Sea Sabacc + R'kik D'nec, Hero Of The Dune Sea
Dune Sea Sabacc + Lift Tube Escape + Lift Tube These two cards can be tracked pretty easily for perfect Sabacc. (Indiana Jones Jedi Knight)

front.title: •Dutch
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Gold 1, also adds 1 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. Adds 1 to forfeit of each other Gold Squadron pilot at same location.
front.lore: Jon 'Dutch' Vander. Gold Squadron leader at Battle of Yavin. Prefers Y-wing fighters. Previously led squadron at Renforra Base. Emblem of Specter Squadron on his helmet.

combo: Dutch + Pops + Tiree
Dutch + Gold 1
Dutch + Tiree + Gold 2

front.title: •Dutch (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (3 if Gold 1). While piloting a Y-Wing, for each Y-wing you have in a battle, attrition against opponent is +1 and attrition against your is -1. Y-wing pilots are fofeit +1 here.
front.lore: Jon 'Dutch' Vander. Gold Squadron leader at Battle of Yavin. Prefers Y-wing fighters. Previously led squadron at Renforra Base. Emblem of Specter Squadron on his helmet.

front.title: •Echo Base Garrison
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Rogue T-47s are immune to attrition < 4 (or < 6 if matching pilot aboard). Once during each of your turns, may take one maintenance droid, Bacta Tank, Lone Rogue, [Hoth] Luke, [Special Edition] Wedge, Zev or Hobbie into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: 'All troop carriers will assemble at the North Entrance. The heavy Transport ships will leave as soon as they're loaded.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Echo Base Operations
front.gametext: Deploy on Main Power Generators if you occupy at least three Echo sites. At every system location, you deploy is -1, your Force drains are +2 and your total power is +3 in battles. Effect canceled if opponent occupies five Hoth sites. (Immune to Alter.).
front.lore: Following the Battle of Yavin, the Alliance garnered the support of systems ready to oppose the Empire. Echo Base provides a command center for focusing that support.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Echo Base Operations + Echo Base Command Center + any Droid + How Did We Get Into This Mess?
Echo Base Operations + Kessel + 3 Y-wings + Y-wing Assault Squadron

front.title: •Echo Base Sensors
front.gametext: Deploy on North Ridge if Main Power Generators on table. When opponent deploys a character or vehicle to a marker site, activate 1 Force and that card may not move that turn. Effect lost if opponent occupies an Echo site, or your Ice Storm on table. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'The sensors are in place. You'll know if anything comes around.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Echo Base Trooper
front.gametext: Deploy only on Hoth, but may move elsewhere. Power -1 when at a site other than a Hoth site.
front.lore: The personnel assigned to protect Echo Base are veteran warriors. Troopers such as Jess Allashane are trained to counter Imperial tactics in cold environment.

combo: Echo Base Trooper + Hoth: Defensive Perimeter + Echo Base Trooper Officer
Echo Base Troopers + General Carlist Rieekan + any Leia + Leia Of Alderaan

front.title: •••Echo Base Trooper Officer
front.gametext: Deploy only on Hoth but may move elsewhere. Echo Base Troopers deploy -1 to same site. Your troopers may move to same Hoth site as a 'react.'
front.lore: Like many Rebel specialists, Trey Callum defected from the Imperial officer corps. Trooper officers are masters at stretching the meager resources of the Rebellion.

front.title: •••Echo Base Trooper Officer (V)
front.gametext: While at a non-shielded marker site, may use 1 Force to suspend 'Hoth Energy Shield Rules' until the start of your next turn.
front.lore: Like many Rebel specialists, Trey Callum defected from the Imperial officer corps. Trooper officers are masters at stretching the meager resources of the Rebellion.

front.title: Echo Base Trooper Rifle
front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on your warrior (Free on your Echo Base trooper). May target a character, creature or vehicle at same or adjacent site using 2 Force (1 if fired by an Echo Base trooper). Draw Destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value.
front.lore: BlasTech A295 blaster rifle. Standard-issue longarm at Echo Base. Highly accurate with good range. Favored by marksmen and snipers in a hostile environment.

front.title: Echo Trooper Backpack
front.gametext: Deploy on your trooper. May use any number of weapons and devices. Trooper is immune to attrition < 3 when at a planet site.
front.lore: Rebels carry a variety of equipment to be fully prepared for enemies and the elements. Weather-resistant backpacks keep gear protected and operational.

front.title: Effective Repairs
front.gametext: USED: Cancel Limited Resources.  LOST: Use 3 Force to retrieve into hand one Effect of any kind."
front.lore: When the nav computer maintenance program failed to auto-repair the hyperdrive, Han decided to take matters into his own hand.

combo: Effective Repairs + Death Star Plans or Rycar's Run or Kessel Run or Our Most Desperate Hour
Effective Repairs + Uncontrollable Fury
Effective Repairs + Civil Disorder

front.title: Effective Repairs & Starship Levitation
front.gametext: USED: Cancel Broken Concentration, Lateral Damage, or Limited Resources. OR Place a card just stacked on Droid Racks or Strategic Reserves in opponent's Lost Pile. (Immune to Sense) OR If you just drew a starship for destiny, take that starship into hand to cancel and redraw that destiny.  LOST: Use 3 Force to retrieve an Effect of any kind or a non-[Maintenance] starship into hand."

front.title: EG-4 (Eegee-Four)
front.gametext: Adds 1 to power of each of your droids present, except power droids. * Destiny equals zero, but if drawn as a battle destiny where you have less power than opponent, your total power present is doubled (once per battle).
front.lore: Very popular droid on inhospitable worlds. Rugged design. Modified top-mounted power sockets. Donated to the Alliance by the Bothan underground.

combo: EG-4 (Eegee-Four) + Off The Edge + Cloud City: Incinerator

front.title: •Egregious Pilot Error
front.gametext: During opponent's control phase, if opponent has two or more capital starships at a system or sector together, draw destiny. If destiny -1 < number of those starships, they may not move or participate in battle until end of your next turn.
front.lore: Details of the notorious 'Incident at Anoat' are required reading at the Imperial Academy of Raithal, where the pilots' names are posthumously displayed.

combo: Egregious Pilot Error + Collision
Egregious Pilot Error + Rebel Barrier

front.title: •Either Way, You Win
front.gametext: Opponent chooses: opponent may activate up to 2 Force and you may activate up to 4 Force, or opponent retrieves 1 Force and you retrieve 3 Force.
front.lore: 'Deal!'

front.title: •Either Way, You Win (V)
front.gametext: USED: Reveal the top four cards of your Reserve Deck and separate them into two piles of any size. Opponent places one pile in your hand and the other on top of your Used Pile in any order. OR Take Control into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. LOST: Place an opponent's just-played Interrupt out of play.
front.lore: 'Deal!'

front.title: Eject! Eject!
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to target a starfighter having one or more permanent pilots. Draw destiny. If destiny > 2, deploy on starfighter to remove all permanent pilots (otherwise, Effect is lost). May add 1 pilot for each permanent pilot removed. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Guiderhouser ejection seat has saved many pilots from their exploding starships. However, system malfunctions have sometimes caused spontaneous ejection.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Eject! Eject! (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on opponent's just deployed [Reflections III][Maintenance] card; opponent loses 1 Force, you may retrieve 1 Force, and you may play a Defensive Shield from under your Starting Effect.  Target is power -3 and opponent must use 1 Force to apply target's ability towards drawing battle destiny.  During opponent's draw phase, opponent must lose 1 Force or place target in Lost Pile.  If just lost, place this Effect in Used Pile. (Immune to Control.)  OR  If you are about to lose Force during opponent's control phase, deploy on table to reduce loss by 2.

front.title: Electrobinoculars
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on any warrior. At any time, you may peek at the top card of your Reserve Deck by using 2 Force. You may choose to move that card to the top of your Force Pile.
front.lore: Enhances distant targets using a computer-assisted zoom technology. Provides range information. Works in low-light. Rugged case protects the internal systems.

front.title: Electropole
front.gametext: Deploy on your Gungan. May target a character for free. Draw destiny. If destiny > defense value, character is power -4 for remainder of turn. At the end of battle here, may place this electropole on top of Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Gungan weapon that is very similar to the Force pike. Used to control crowds, wild animals, and the occasional battle droid.

front.title: Elegant Lightsaber
front.gametext: Deploy on a Jedi. May add 1 to Force drain at opponent's site where present. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. If total destiny > defense value, target hit and may not be used to satisfy attrition.
front.lore: The lightsaber is an extremely versatile weapon, making a Jedi a rather difficult opponent to slow down. 'This is impossible!'

front.title: •Ello Asty
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting an X-wing alone, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise and all immunity to attrition here is canceled. Once during your control phase, may take Sabotage into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Abednedo.

front.title: Ellorrs Madak
front.gametext: Deploy on your non-pilot character (except droids) to give that character [Pilot] skill. Adds 2 to power of anything that character pilots. OR Deploy on your pilot. Adds 1 to power of anything that character pilots. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Like many Duros, Madak has natural piloting and navigation skill. Former scout. Freelance instructor. Makes runs to important trade worlds Celanon, Byblos and Yaga Minor.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Ellorrs Madak (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Your ••• aliens are deploy -1.  Your Rep is immune to attrition and may not be captured.  While you have alien characters of five different species on table, your Force drains and battle destiny draws are +1, and opponent's battle destiny draws are -1. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Like many Duros, Madak has natural piloting and navigation skill. Former scout. Freelance instructor. Makes runs to important trade worlds Celanon, Byblos and Yaga Minor.

front.title: •Ellorrs Madak, Pilot Instructo
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. Adds 2 to the hyperspeed of any freighter he pilots. During your move phase, may use 1 Force to 'break cover' of opponent's Undercover spy at same site. Cancels Lateral Damage targeting your starship at same or related system.
front.lore: Duros scout and smuggler.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Brian Fred)"

front.title: Elom
front.gametext: Power +3 at same site as an Imperial. For remainder of game, Plastoid Armor is an Effect, is not unique, is immune to Alter while on table, and it deploys only on a Rebel or alien at same mobile site as Elom (character is now 'disguised').
front.lore: Many Elom commit sabotage and theft against the Empire to avenge the invasion of their homeworld. Experts in adapting stolen equipment for use by the Rebellion.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: •Elyhek Rue
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 7 during battle, adds one destiny to total power only. When at Ralltiir system, adds 1 to each of your Force drains there.
