front.lore: Piloted Red 7 at the Battle of Yavin. Part of the Griffon flight wing, a Rebel squadron sent to fight the Imperial subjugation of Ralltiir.

front.title: •Emperor's Sinister Plans
front.gametext: Deploy on your non-droid spy at Back Door.  Target your war room.  Until completed, spy may not relocate or be Undercover.  When Utinni Effect reaches target, stack there: opponent's battle destiny draws are -1 and your spies may not have their forfeit reduced below 3.
front.lore: Hologram technology allows effecient communication of complex intelligence during war room briefings.

front.title: <>Encampment
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on any exterior planet site where you have a Rebel or alien. You may deploy characters at this site, even without presence, regardless of location deployment restrictions.
front.lore: Pirates, smugglers and Rebels operate from tiny camps which can be set up quickly and relocated at a moment's notice. A surprise visitor made Luke an unhappy camper.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: <>Encampment (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on a non-docking bay exterior planet site you occupy. While you occupy this site, at same and related sites, your characters may deploy regardless of location deployment restrictions. Once per game, your character may deploy -3 here. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Pirates, smugglers and Rebels operate from tiny camps which can be set up quickly and relocated at a moment's notice. A surprise visitor made Luke an unhappy camper.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Brian Hollingworth - NYC Mini-Open Winner 2005)"

front.title: •End Of A Reign
front.gametext: USED: Cancel Overseeing It Personally. OR Use 4 Force to cancel Vader's game text for remainder of turn.  LOST: If Emperor just lost from table, draw destiny. Opponent must lose Force equal to the destiny draw."
front.lore: The turning of Vader and the loss of Palpatine was the beginning of a new era for the entire galaxy.

cancels: Vader's game text for remainder of turn

front.title: •Endor
front.gametext: Light: : Force drain -1 here. To move your starship here from Sullust, Rendezvous Point or Haven requires -1 Force.

combo: Endor + Strike Planning Opponent's Force generation at Endor system is canceled unless Endor Operations on table.

front.title: "•Endor (V)
front.gametext: Light: : If you have no Rebels on Endor, Force drain -1 here. If you control, each of opponent's biker scouts is forfeit -1.

combo: Endor (V) + Strike Planning Opponent's Force generation at Endor system is canceled unless Endor Operations on table.

front.title: •Endor Celebration
front.gametext: Cancel Tatooine Occupation, Cloud City Occupation or Rebel Base Occupation. (Immune to Sense.) OR During your activate phase, activate 1 Force for each Endor battleground you occupy.
front.lore: The Rebel presence on Endor meant that the Ewoks would be able to live free from the Empire's tyranny.

combo: Endor Celebration + The Planet It's Farthest From  A handy way to convince your opponent to try another planet.

front.title: •Endor Celebration (V)
front.gametext: Cancel an Effect with 'occupation' in title. (Immune to Sense.) OR During your draw phase, if you have a Rebel scout alone at Back Door, draw destiny. Activate or retrieve 5 Force and place this Interrupt on bottom of Lost Pile if destiny < the number of your scouts on table.
front.lore: The Rebel presence on Endor meant that the Ewoks would be able to live free from the Empire's tyranny.

front.title: •Endor Commando Team
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Endor. During battle, your other Rebels here may not have their forfeit reduced unless this card 'hit.' Each time this character is 'hit,' it is cumulatively power -2 until end of turn.
front.lore: General Solo's strike team was made up of the Alliance's finest ground troops. Scout trooper.

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

front.title: Endor Scout Trooper
front.gametext: Power -1 while not on Endor. While Endor Scout Trooper is on Endor, Lieutenant Page and each of your Rebel scouts of ability < 3 at same and adjacent exterior sites are immune to attrition < 2.
front.lore: Rebel troopers receive Scout training that helps them to survive combat in harsh environments. Often protect 'specialists' while they accomplish mission tasks.

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

front.title: •Endor: Back Door
front.gametext: Light: : During your move phase, you may move from Back Door to Bunker (or vice versa).

combo: Endor: Back Door + Fallen Portal

front.title: •Endor: Bunker
front.gametext: Light: : Force drain +1 here. If you initiate a battle here, add one battle destiny.

front.title: •Endor: Bunker (V)
front.gametext: Light: : Unless you occupy Bunker (or Back Door), your characters may not deploy here.

front.title: •Endor: Chief Chirpa's Hut
front.gametext: Light: : Your Ewoks are deploy -1 here. Chief Chirpa deploys free here.

combo: Endor: Chief Chirpa's Hut + Chief Chirpa

front.title: •Endor: Dense Forest
front.gametext: Light: : No starships or vehicles here except speeder bikes, AT-STs, Ewok gliders and creature vehicles.

front.title: •Endor: Ewok Village
front.gametext: Light: : No starships or vehicles here. Ewok devices and Ewok weapons deploy -1 here.

combo: Endor: Ewok Village + Wicket + Ewok Spear
Endor: Ewok Village + Catapult + Ewok Sentries

front.title: •Endor: Ewok Village (V)
front.gametext: Light: : Non-unique Ewoks are Heroic. While you occupy, gains one [Light Side Force]. No starships or vehicles here.

front.title: •Endor: Ewok Village (V)
front.gametext: Light: : While a Skywalker here, Prophecy Of The Force may not relocate from here.

front.title: •••Endor: Great Forest
front.gametext: Light: : Your character movement from here (except for Ewoks and scouts) requires +1 landspeed.

front.title: •Endor: Hidden Forest Trail
front.gametext: Light: : During your move phase, your scouts may move between here and any exterior Endor site.

front.title: •Endor: Landing Platform (Docking Bay)
front.gametext: Light: : Your docking bay transit from here requires 2 Force.

front.title: •Endor: Rebel Landing Site (Forest)
front.gametext: Light: : Your starfighters land here for free. Your droids and [Endor] Rebels are deploy -1 here.

front.title: •Energy Walls
front.gametext: During your control phase, deploy on Theed Palace Generator Core. No more than one character may deploy to here each turn, and characters may not move to or from here. Immediate Effect lost at end of opponent's turn.
front.lore: Theed security protocol proved to be a deciding variable in the duel of the fates.

pulledBy: Don't Do That Again - Defensive Shield
Don't Do That Again (V) - Defensive Shield
We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Enhanced Proton Torpedoes
front.gametext: Deploy on your X-wing, Y-wing or B-wing. May target a starship for 1 Force. Add 1 if targetting a capital starship. Otherwise, subtract 1. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Often modified by Rebel technicians. Heavy warhead provides increased armor penetration. Decreased maneuverability and effectiveness against starfighters.

pulledBy: Lieutenant s'Too Vees (when at a docking bay)

front.title: Enhanced Proton Torpedoes (V)
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your starfighter. May target a starship for free. Draw destiny. If on a Heroic starfighter, may use 1 Force to add 3 to total. Target hit if destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Often modified by Rebel technicians. Heavy warhead provides increased armor penetration. Decreased maneuverability and effectiveness against starfighters.

front.title: Ensign Chad Hilse
front.gametext: During battle, if present at a site with a stormtrooper (or Rebel leader), may add one destiny to total power only. Once per turn, may subtract 1 from a destiny draw of an opponent's Interrupt or weapon targeting a non-Jedi Rebel here.
front.lore: Corellian Corvette trooper Ensign Chad Hilse, an Alderaanian, typifies the loyal Rebel volunteers dedicated to defeating the Empire. Trained in starship and ground combat.

front.title: •Entering The Arena
front.gametext: USED: Once per game may take Podracer Bay into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  LOST: During a battle at Podracer Bay, add one battle destiny."
front.lore: 'What'd he mean by that?' 'I'll tell you later.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Entrenchment
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Once per turn, you may cancel a Force drain by placing here from hand any non-unique Rebel. Rebels may deploy from here as if from hand (if Effect canceled by opponent, any Rebels here may immediately deploy for free.)
front.lore: As the Empire advances, Rebels retreat to fortified positions to marshal their resources and redeploy the troops.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Entrenchment (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on a site. During battle here, you take the first weapons segment action. Your characters are defense value +1 here.
front.lore: As the Empire advances, Rebels retreat to fortified positions to marshal their resources and redeploy the troops.

front.title: Eopie
front.gametext: May add 2 'riders' (passengers). Ability = 1/4.Moves for free. While 'ridden' by Amidala in battle, adds one battle destiny.
front.lore: Herd animal native to Tatooine. Adults are used as beasts of burden, while the young and elderly eopies are useful for consuming desert weeds.

front.title: •Errant Venture
front.gametext: May add 6 pilots. Permanent pilot provides ability of 3. Unless your [Reflections 2] objective on table, once per game, may deploy a non-[Maintenance] scoundrel aboard from Reserve Deck; reshuffle and while Corran or a Terrik piloting, immune to attrition < 7.
front.lore: Blank

front.title: •Errant Venture (AI)
front.gametext: May add 6 pilots. Permanent pilot provides ability of 3. Unless your [Reflections 2] objective on table, once per game, may deploy a non-[Maintenance] scoundrel aboard from Reserve Deck; reshuffle and while Corran or a Terrik piloting, immune to attrition < 7.
front.lore: Blank

front.title: Escape Pod
front.gametext: Save all characters, weapons, and devices aboard any just-lost capital starship. Relocate them to any planet site.
front.lore: Capital starships have emergency escape pods. Equipped with food, water, flares, medpacs, hunting blaster and tracking beacon (R2-D2 deactivated this one's beacon).

front.title: Escape Pod & We're Doomed
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to take a dejarik into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR For remainder of turn, you lose no Force to Cloud City Occupation, Rebel Base Occupation, Tatooine Occupation, That Thing's Operational, or You May Start Your Landing.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: Escape Pod (V)
front.gametext: Take a dejarik, hologram, or holosite into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Cancel a Force drain at a holosite. OR If opponent is about to place your character out of play, place that character in your Lost Pile instead.
front.lore: Capital starships have emergency escape pods. Equipped with food, water, flares, medpacs, hunting blaster and tracking beacon (R2-D2 deactivated this one's beacon).

front.title: Escape Pod (V)
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to take a dejarik or holosite into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Cancel a Force drain at a holosite. OR If opponent is about to place your character our of play, place that character in your Lost Pile instead.
front.lore: Capital starships have emergency escape pods. Equipped with food, water, flares, medpacs, hunting blaster and tracking beacon (R2-D2 deactivated this one's beacon).

cancels: A Force drain at a holosite

front.title: Evacuation Control
front.gametext: Deploy on your war room. Once during each of your move phases, your Planet Defender Ion Cannon at same planet may fire. Also, each of your medium transports at same planet is hyperspeed +2, is immune to attrition < 3 and may move for free.
front.lore: 'Give the evacuation code signal...and get to your transports!'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Evacuation Control (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table; shuffle your Reserve Deck, peek at top three cards, and stack them face-up here. During battle, may take a card here into hand to prevent all battle destiny draws from being modified or canceled (each player may draw no more than one battle destiny). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'Give the evacuation code signal...and get to your transports!'

front.title: Evacuation Control (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table; shuffle your Reserve Deck, peek at top three cards, and stack them face-up here. During battle, may take a card here into hand to prevent all battle destiny draws from being modified or canceled (each player may draw no more than one battle destiny). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'Give the evacuation code signal...and get to your transports!'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Eventually You'll Lose
front.gametext: USED: If a battle was just initiated, place the top card of your Used Pile on top of your Reserve Deck.  LOST: Use 3 Force to cause opponent to reveal hand. All cards opponent has 3 or more of in hand are lost."
front.lore: In the end, Watto finally came to understand the agony of defeat.

combo: Eventually You'll Lose + Threepio With His Parts Showing

front.title: •Ewok And Roll
front.gametext: If opponent's creature vehicle or AT-ST just deployed or moved to where your Ewok is present, draw destiny. Creature vehicle lost if destiny > defense value. AT-ST crashed if destiny +2 > armor. OR If your Ewok is defending a battle, add 2 to your total power.
front.lore: Even an All Terrain Scout Transport cannot stand on all terrain.

front.title: Ewok Bow
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your Ewok. May target a character or creature using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 for each other Ewok present who is armed with an Ewok Bow. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Primitive weapon. Effective in large volleys. Imperial troops are not prepared for such simple tactics.

front.title: Ewok Catapult
front.gametext: Deploy on an exterior Endor site. Does not require a power source. Your Ewok present may target a vehicle with armor at same or adjacent site for free. Draw destiny. Add 1 for each Ewok present. Target crashes if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Crowning achievement of Chirpa's engineers. Heavy stones from these weapons distracted Imperial AT-ST walkers.

front.title: •Ewok Celebration
front.gametext: Deploy on table. At Endor sites where you have an Ewok, your characters are forfeit and defense value +1 (+3 if you have two Ewoks at that site.) In battles at Endor sites where all your ability is provided by Ewoks, add one battle destiny. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'Na na, beecha na noooooooooooooooowa.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Ewok Glider
front.gametext: May add 1 driver (must be an Ewok). Once per turn, when in battle, may target a character or creature present. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny -1 > defense value.
front.lore: Primitive flying vehicle used by Ewoks. Used to drop rocks on Imperial troops during the Battle of Endor.

combo: Ewok Glider + Wicket + Ewok Spear This combo can exclude one opponent from battle, make another opponent power 0 and make a third opponent "hit".

front.title: •Ewok Log Jam
front.gametext: If opponent's transport vehicle or AT-ST just deployed or moved to an Endor site, draw destiny. Add 1 for each of your Ewoks present. Vehicle lost if total destiny -1 > defense value. OR Lose 1 Force to take into hand a card you just drew for battle or weapon destiny.
front.lore: Any problem can be solved by the proper application of the principles of mass and velocity.

front.title: Ewok Rescue
front.gametext: If your Ewok is present with an escorted captive, draw destiny. Add 2 if Ewok is a scout. If total destiny > escort's defense value, captive is released. OR If your Ewok is defending a battle, up to three of your Ewoks at one exterior site may move as a 'react' (for free).
front.lore: Ewoks used superior knowledge of Endor's forested terrain to free commandos captured by Imperial stormtroopers.

front.title: Ewok Sentry
front.gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each Light side icon at same Endor site. May deploy as a 'react'. May move as a 'react' (for free) to a battle where you have a unique (•) Ewok.
front.lore: Ewok sentries scout the perimeter of their domain. Their watchful eyes search for both predatory animals and invading stormtroopers.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: Ewok Spear
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your Ewok (free on Ewok Spearman). Adds 1 to power. May target a character or creature using 1 Force. Both players draw destiny. Target's power or ferocity for remainder of turn = 0 if your destiny + Ewok's power > opponent's destiny.
front.lore: Chosen weapon of most Ewok warriors. Pointed tip made of stone or animal horn.

combo: Ewok Spear + Lumat

front.title: Ewok Spearman
front.gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each Light side icon at same Endor site. When on Endor and present with any other Ewok, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: Ewok fighters train with primitive weapons. Their bravery and careful aim helped defeat the Imperial troops during the Battle of Endor.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: Ewok Tribesman
front.gametext: Power and forfeit +1 for each Light side icon at same Endor site. When forfeited at same site as your Ewok of ability > 1, may satisfy all remaining attrition against you.
front.lore: Members of Chief Chirpa's Ewok tribe are courageous in battle. They seek to impress older members of the tribe. Deploys only on Endor.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
combo: Chief Chirpa + Ewok Tribesman

front.title: Explosive Charge
front.gametext: Deploy on an interior site you occupy. Immune to Overload. Place in Used Pile if opponent controls this site. If you just lost a battle opponent initiated here, may draw destiny. All cards (except Effects) here are lost if destiny > 4 (otherwise, Charge lost).
front.lore: Standard explosive charge carried by Rebel commandos. When used in multiple, these charges have the explosive capacity to level a heavily armored structure.

front.title: •Eyes In The Dark
front.gametext: Deploy beside either player's Lost Pile. That pile is turned face down. Cards from that player's Life Force may not be viewed when they are lost.
front.lore: 'I don't like the look of this.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Eyes In The Dark (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on a holosite.  [Virtual Block] Wipe Them Out, All Of Them ignores this site.  'Effect' on Alter may be treated as 'Mantellian Savrip.'  The game text of your Effects here may not be suspended.  Except during battles here, may play your Interrupts here as if from hand.
front.lore: 'I don't like the look of this.'

front.title: •Ezra Bridger
front.gametext: Power +1 for each Dark Jedi or Jedi on table. At start of opponent's turn, if at opponent's site, opponent chooses: their Force generation is -X this turn, or you may activate up to X Force, where X = number of [Dark Side Force] icons here.
front.lore: Padawan. Spy.

front.title: •Faithful Service
front.gametext: Deploy on an opponent's location. Whenever you lose a droid from hand or Life Force, it satisfies Force loss up to its forfeit value. Once per turn, you may play Scomp Link Access to cancel a Force drain where you have a droid. Effect canceled if opponent controls this location.
front.lore: Unlike the Empire, the Alliance treats their droids with respect. Many droids volunteered to share the risk of battle and aid the Rebellion's assault on the Death Star.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Faithful Service (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Your unique (•) [Hoth], [Endor], and [Death Star II] non-pilot warriors of destiny > 1 are troopers. Your troopers have armor = 4. When opponent is about to remove their last card from Life Force, you may first place all your troopers in Used Pile (last card must still be removed). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Unlike the Empire, the Alliance treats their droids with respect. Many droids volunteered to share the risk of battle and aid the Rebellion's assault on the Death Star.

front.title: Fall Back!
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle at an exterior site with more than double your total power, use 1 Force to cancel the battle and have all your characters there move away to an adjacent site (for free) where the opponent has no presence.
front.lore: 'K-one zero...all troops disengage.'

front.title: •Fall Of A Jedi
front.gametext: If your Jedi was just defeated in lightsaber combat, you may either: Reveal a Dark Jedi's combat cards and place one in opponent's Lost Pile (return others). OR Place Qui-Gon out of play and take [Episode I] Obi-Wan into hand from Lost Pile or Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: The blow, when it came, was lightning swift and fatal. But Qui-Gon's death gave new life to his former Padawan.

front.title: •Fall Of The Empire
front.gametext: At the end of a battle that you won at an interior site where you have a character of ability > 3 present, relocate one opponent's character present to an adjacent site. (If on Cloud City, character may be relocated to Weather Vane instead.)
front.lore: 'Aaaaah!'

front.title: •Fall Of The Legend
front.gametext: If you just lost a character during a battle or duel at a Cloud City site, use 2 Force to relocate that character to Weather Vane instead of your Lost Pile. OR Search your Reserve Deck, take one Weather Vane into hand and reshuffle.
front.lore: Luke had a falling out with his estranged father.

front.title: •Fallen Portal
front.gametext: Target one creature or up to two characters present that just initiated an attack or battle against you at Back Door, Rancor Pit, Tatooine: Jabba's Palace or any docking bay. Draw destiny. Target(s) immediately lost if destiny +2 > total defense value.
front.lore: Jabba ordered the two-meter thick door to keep the rancor in. He never thought it would be the instrument of the rancor's demise.

canceledBy: Establish Control prevents the targeting of a character with Fallen Portal
They're Still Coming Through! may re-target Fallen Portal by choosing up to two of opponent's characters there instead of your own

front.title: •••Fambaa
front.gametext: May add 2 'riders' (passengers). Ability + 1/2. Requires +1 Force to use landspeed. May not be attacked by creatures.
front.lore: Pack animal domesticated by Gungan warriors. Able to bear heavy loads, even during the heat of combat.

combo: Gungan Energy Shield + Fambaa

front.title: <>Farm
front.gametext: Light: : During your deploy phase, Hydroponics Station or Vaporator may deploy here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. May not be deployed to Bespin, Coruscant, Dagobah, Hoth, Kessel.

pulledBy: I Must Be Allowed To Speak (V)

front.title: ••Field Dressing
front.gametext: If you just forfeited a character of ability < 5 present at a site, deploy on that character (who remains at same site and, if 'hit,' is restored to normal).  Character is forfeit = 0 (even if forfeit may not normally be reduced).  May play First Aid to place this card in Used Pile.  Immune to your Control.
front.lore: The Alliance lost many fine soldiers at conflicts such as the Battle of Hoth. The Rebel High Command is aware of the cost of freedom from Imperial tyranny.

front.title: •Figrin D'an
front.gametext: Once each turn during your control phase, you may use 1 Force to make a 'wager.' Draw three destiny. Opponent draws two destiny. Player with highest total may randomly select one card to be retrieved from that player's Lost Pile.
front.lore: A male Bith. Musician who leads the Mos Eisley Cantina band, Figrin D'an and the Modal Nodes. Expert gambler and card shark.

front.title: •Finn
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of any starship or enclosed vehicle he is aboard as a passenger. May deploy as a 'react' to same location as your pilot (free if Poe or Rey). Once per game, may take Blaster Proficiency into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Gunner. Stormtrooper.

pulls: Sorry About The Mess & Blaster Proficiency
pulledBy: I'm Getting Kind Of Good At This

front.title: Fire Extinguisher
front.gametext: Deploy on your astromech droid. Cancels an 'exploding' Program Trap here. Any starship it is aboard is immune to Lateral Damage and ion cannons. If deployed on R2-D2, may lose Fire Extinguisher to cancel a battle just initiated where present at a site.
front.lore: Among the various special devices on droids like R2 units are gasbased fire extinguishers. Effective against electrical fires and can cause confusion during battle.

cancels: A battle just initiated where present when deployed on R2-D2
Result of an Ion Cannon where present

front.title: Firefight
front.gametext: During a battle, if you have weapons at at least 2 sites adjacent to that battle, add 3 to your total power and add one battle destiny. OR For remainder of turn, your scout at an exterior site is power +1 and adds 1 to each of that character's weapon destiny draws.
front.lore: Lieutenant Page effectively deployed his detachment of Rebel commandos during the attack at the control bunker.

combo: Firefight + Corporal Janse + A280 Sharpshooter Rifle

front.title: Firefight (V)
front.gametext: If a battle was just initiated (except at a Coruscant site), each of your troopers and [Republic] starfighters present is power +1 and immune to attrition for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Lieutenant Page effectively deployed his detachment of Rebel commandos during the attack at the control bunker.

front.title: •Firin Morett
front.gametext: Subtracts 2 from deploy cost of each of your starfighters to same docking bay. Once during each of your control phases, may take one Advanced Preparation, Rebel Planners or docking bay into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Engineer responsible for preparing Red and Gold Squadron starships for battle. Has final launch authority in the Yavin 4 docking bay.

front.title: •First Aid
front.gametext: If your character's forfeit was just reduced to 0, restore it to normal. OR Reduce your battle damage by 5 by losing from hand a starship, vehicle or character. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: The Alliance used stolen medical droids to help carry on the battle against the Empire.

front.title: •First Officer Thaneespi
front.gametext: Deploys -2 to Home One. Adds 3 to power of any capital starship she pilots. When piloting a Star Cruiser with another Mon Calamari pilot aboard, unless opponent has total ability > 6 piloting here, may reset opponent's total battle destiny here to 0.
front.lore: Mon Calamari deck officer. Brilliant tactical analyst. One of several brave leaders of Mon Calamari refugees from Imperial invasion of her planet.

front.title: •Fixer
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Deploys -1 to same site as Camie. Once per turn, may use 1 Force to place a card from Crash Site Memorial in Used Pile. If Crash Site Memorial leaves table (except by your card), place all cards on it in Used Pile.
front.lore: Careful manipulator of funds and Imperial taxation codes. Buys droids from Jawas and sells them to the Alliance.

front.title: •Flash Of Insight
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. At any time, you may use 3 Force to draw the top card of your Reserve Deck into your hand. If that card is a space creature, you may immediately deploy it for free.
front.lore: Occasionally Han was capable of such feats, even without Threepio there to tell him these things.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Flash Of Insight (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Play with the top card of your Reserve Deck revealed (if possible). During your draw phase, place this Effect in Used Pile and you may retrieve 1 Force.
front.lore: Occasionally Han was capable of such feats, even without Threepio there to tell him these things.

front.title: •••Florn Lamproid
front.gametext: May deploy as a 'react' to any jungle or forest site. Power and forfeit +2 while Dice Ibegon at Audience Chamber. Poison stinger cumulatively adds 1 to attrition against opponent in battles at same site.
front.lore: Aggressive, serpent-like colonizers. Found on many jungle and forest planets. Have poison stinger that they use when defending themselves.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: •Fly Casual
front.gametext: USED: Cancel Early Warning Network or It's An Older Code. OR During your deploy phase, deploy one starship (deploy -1) and/or one pilot to a system even without presence or Force icons.  LOST: Take one Tydirium or Tantive IV into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle."
front.lore: As a smuggler, Han had years of experience at avoiding Imperial detection. He chose the approach to Endor's moon as the time to pass some of that knowledge on to Chewie.

front.title: •For Luck
front.gametext: Deploy on table. If Counter Assault is played, may use 1 Force to add one destiny to your total. If Sense or Alter just played, may use X Force to exclude X Dark Jedi from being the 'highest-ability character.'
front.lore: Before swinging across the treacherous abyss, Leia gave Luke a kiss for luck. Despite an incessant storm of laserblasts, they made it.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •For Luck (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once during your control phase, if opponent occupies a non-battleground location, may peek at top two cards of your Reserve Deck and take one into hand. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Before swinging across the treacherous abyss, Leia gave Luke a kiss for luck. Despite an incessant storm of laserblasts, they made it.

front.title: •For Luck (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once during your control phase, if opponent occupies a non-battleground location, may peek at top two cards of your Reserve Deck and take one into hand. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Before swinging across the treacherous abyss, Leia gave Luke a kiss for luck. Despite an incessant storm of laserblasts, they made it.

pulls: One of the two top cards of Reserve Deck
pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Force Levitation
front.gametext: Take a device (except Landing Claw) into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Target one opponent's droid present with your Jedi in battle. For remainder of turn, target is power -1 and may not fire weapons.
front.lore: Blank.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Tim Simon)"

front.title: •Force Projection
front.gametext: USED: If [Episode VII] Luke at a site, target all your characters at one other site. They are defense value = 5 this turn.  LOST: Once per game, if opponent just drew battle destiny and Luke is out of play, draw destiny and subtract that amount from opponent's total battle destiny."
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: <>Forest
front.gametext: Light: : Your characters present here are immune to attrition. May not be deployed to Bespin, Coruscant, Hoth, Kessel or Tatooine.

front.title: •Foul Moudama
front.gametext: If at your prison, light side goes first. Deploys -2 to Coruscant or a mobile site. May carry a character of power < 4 (as if riding a creature vehicle). Guardian's Lightsaber may deploy on Foul. Once per game, may take a clone or a non-Jedi alien into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Talz.

front.title: Found Someone You Have
front.gametext: If you have a character of ability > 4 on table, use 3 Force to find one of your missing characters (your choice). OR During any control phase, examine the top card of your Lost Pile. If that card is a character of ability < 3, take that character into hand.
front.lore: 'I'm looking for someone.' 'Looking? Found someone you have I would say.'

front.title: •Found Someone You Have & Higher Ground
front.gametext: During a battle at opponent's site (or your non-<> site), instead of firing one of your character weapons at a target, cause that target to be immunity to attrition -3 (or limited to immunity to attrition < 5) for remainder of turn. OR Find one of your missing characters. OR Cancel a 'react.' OR Once per game, use 1 Force to exchange a card in hand with the top most character of ability < 5 in your Lost Pile.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: Found Someone You Have (V)
front.gametext: Find one of your missing characters. OR Retrieve the topmost character of your Lost Pile into hand.
front.lore: 'I'm looking for someone.' 'Looking? Found someone you have I would say.'

front.title: Found Someone You Have (V)
front.gametext: Find one of your missing characters. OR Retrieve the topmost character of your Lost Pile into hand.
front.lore: 'I'm looking for someone.' 'Looking? Found someone you have I would say.'

front.title: •Free Ride
front.gametext: If you control a location where opponent has a speeder bike, AT-ST or skiff, steal that vehicle (any characters aboard are lost). OR Peek at one card randomly selected from opponent's hand. If that card is a speeder bike, AT-ST or skiff, steal it into hand.
front.lore: To prevent biker scouts from reaching their base, Luke and Leia 'borrowed' some nearby transportation.

front.title: •Free Ride & •Endor Celebration
front.gametext: Cancel Tatooine Occupation, Cloud City Occupation, Rebel Base Occupation. (Immune to Sense.) OR Peak at one card randomly selected from opponent's hand. If that card is a speeder bike, AT-ST, or skiff, steal it into hand.

front.title: •Freon Drevan
front.gametext: Cancels game text of opponent's accountants and tax collectors at same or adjacent site. While in a battle at a site, your battle destiny draws may not be canceled, and you may not draw more than two battle destiny.
front.lore: Xexto who had his business license revoked when his partner siphoned away his credits, fled the system, and left him with the tax debt.

cancels: Game text of opponent's accountants and tax collectors

front.title: Friendly Fire
front.gametext: An accident occurs at the beginning of a battle at any site where opponent has at least two characters and one weapon. Draw destiny. If destiny < number of opponent's characters at that site, one is lost. (Opponent's choice.)
front.lore: Overcrowding in heavy fire zones increases chances of accidentally shooting one's own comrades. Stormtroopers never let accuracy get in the way of victory.

front.title: •Frostbite
front.gametext: Deploy on Hoth system. At the end of each player's turn, for every character that player has present at a marker site under 'nighttime conditions,' that player must lose 1 Force (2 if character is missing).
front.lore: 'Then I'll see you in hell!'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Frostbite (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on the Hoth system if you control two exterior Hoth sites. During your control phase, may retrieve 1 Force for each Hoth site you control with a unique (•) combat vehicle. If opponent controls this system, this Effect lost. While you occupy 1st marker, immune to Alter.
front.lore: 'Then I'll see you in hell!'

front.title: •Frozen Assets
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. At every site where there is a 'frozen' captive, your Rebels deploy -2 and are power +2 in battle. OR Deploy on top of opponent's Force Pile. Force below this card may not be drawn or used. Effect lost at end of opponent's next turn.
front.lore: Molten carbonite is released into the chamber and then flash frozen, releasing a blast of air. The subject is instantly covered in the newly solidified material.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Frozen Assets + Draw Their Fire

front.title: •Full Throttle
front.gametext: If your pilot (or permanent pilot) is defending a battle alone at a system or sector, add one battle destiny. OR If Luke is defending a battle alone at a system or sector, add 1 to power and add one battle destiny.
front.lore: Rebel pilots use visual scanning to supplement sensors for an edge against Imperial fighter pilots. Natural instincts allow lone Rebels to overcome superior numbers.

front.title: Fusion Generator Supply Tanks
front.gametext: Deploy on your starship at a system or sector where a related docking bay is on table. Adds 1 to hyperspeed, power and maneuver.
front.lore: Uses standard fusion technology. Provides starships with energy for hyperspace travel. Installed at docking bays and throughout the Outer Rim Territories.

front.title: Fusion Generator Supply Tanks (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on a docking bay or your capital starship. Your unique (•) starships are power, maneuver, and hyperspeed +1. May place this device in Lost Pile to cancel Lateral Damage. If opponent controls this location, place this device in Used Pile.
front.lore: Uses standard fusion technology. Provides starships with energy for hyperspace travel. Installed at docking bays and throughout the Outer Rim Territories.

front.title: FX-7 (Effex-Seven)
front.gametext: Once per turn, one of your 'hit' non-droid characters at same or adjacent site may go to your Used Pile rather than your Lost Pile. Cumulatively subtracts 2 from X on your Bacta Tank.
front.lore: Model nicknamed 'Fixit' by Rebels at Echo Base. Though obsolete in advanced hospitals, FX-7 droids still operate at many Rebel outposts as assistant surgeons.

combo: FX-7 (Effex-Seven) + Bacta Tank

front.title: •Galen Erso
front.gametext: Once per game, may place a non-[Immune to Alter] Effect in owner's Used Pile. If both players just drew one battle destiny here, may use 2 Force (free if with an Imperial) to switch numbers. Opponent must first lose 2 Force to fire a superlaser.
front.lore: Information broker, leader, and spy.

front.title: •Gambler's Luck
front.gametext: If any gambler is defending a battle alone at a site, add one battle destiny (draw two destiny, and choose one). OR if your Lando is defending a battle alone at a site, add two battle destiny (draw three and choose two).
front.lore: Works every time.

front.title: •Gambler's Luck (V)
front.gametext: During opponent's control phase, if your gambler on table, use 1 Force. Both players draw three destiny. Winner (higher total destiny) may target one opponent's character with a printed power matching one of the winner's destiny draws. Target is lost.
front.lore: Works every time.

front.title: •Garon Nas Tal
front.gametext: While at Audience Chamber, all your other Saurins are forfeit +2 and all your characters trained by Sai'torr Kal Fas are power and forfeit +1.
front.lore: Saurin combat expert. Hired by Jabba to train his Gamorrean guards. Regrets taking the job. Dislikes Jabba and his henchbeings. Plotting to kill Jabba.

front.title: •Garouf Lafoe
front.gametext: Adds 1 to power of anything he pilots. Adds 1 to forfeit of each of your characters at same Tatooine site. Subtracts 1 from forfeit of each of opponent's characters at same Hoth site. Game text suspended if at same site as a tax collector.
front.lore: Free-trader who imports ice chunks from rings of Ohann and Adriana, outer planets in Tatoo system. Sales remain cold...due to steep Imperial taxes and bribes.

front.title: •Geezum
front.gametext: During your control phase, if at an exterior planet site, may use 2 Force to search your Reserve Deck, take a related site into hand and reshuffle. While at Audience Chamber, all your other Snivvians are forfeit +2.
front.lore: Snivvian scout. Enjoys exploring new planets and charting difficult terrain. Paid very well by Jabba to do so. Unsure of his employer's motivations.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.title: •General Airen Cracken
front.gametext: Adds 2 to the power of anything he pilots. Opponent may not add destiny draws to power or attrition here. While all your ability here is provided by scouts and/or spies, adds one battle destiny and once during your turn may peek at top card of opponent's Force Pile.
front.lore: Leader, scout, and information broker.

front.title: •General Airen Cracken
front.gametext: Adds 2 to the power of anything he pilots. Opponent may not add destiny draws to power or attrition here. While all your ability here is provided by scouts and/or spies, adds one battle destiny and once during your turn may peek at top card of opponent's Force Pile.
front.lore: Leader, scout, and information broker.

front.title: •General Bel Iblis
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting a non-[Episode I] corvette or a stolen starship, adds one battle destiny and it is immune to attrition < 5. 'Exiled' (placed out of play) if at Corellia. Once per game, may steal a dreadnaught from opponent's Lost Pile into hand.
front.lore: Insurgent leader. Corellian.

front.title: •General Bob Hudsol
front.gametext: While at an interior Yavin 4 site, Massassi Base Sentry is [Immune to Alter], and, once per turn, during battle at a 'liberated' system (either opponent's or one with only one [Dark Side]), except Yavin 4, may place your just forfeited card in Used Pile.
front.lore: Typical of hard-line Corellian officers known for caution in battle. Leader of resistance in Bothan space. Developed strong ties to Bothan spynet.

front.title: •General Calrissian
front.gametext: Deploy -2 aboard Falcon. Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting a freighter, adds 1 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. When he attempts to 'blow away' Death Star II, adds 2 to total.
front.lore: Leader. Gambler. Fair pilot. Lando was given the rank of General for 'a little maneuver' at the Battle of Taanab. Willing to lead Rebel starfighters in a crazy attack.

front.title: •General Carlist Rieekan
front.gametext: Each Rebel present with him at a Hoth site is power +1. May use 1 Force to cancel Death Squadron. While at an Echo site, opponent must occupy an additional Hoth site to cancel Echo Base Operations.
front.lore: One of the original founders of the Rebel Alliance. Former civilian strategist with the House of Organa. Somber leader of Echo Base.

front.title: •General Carlist Rieekan (V)
front.gametext: Your artillery weapons at same and related sites are powered and forfeit +2.  Once per turn, may use 1 Force to deploy one A New Secret Base, Echo Base Operations, Haven (to Hoth), a [Hoth] location, a [Hoth] artillery weapon, or a non-unique [Hoth] Rebel from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: One of the original founders of the Rebel Alliance. Former civilian strategist with the House of Organa. Somber leader of Echo Base.

front.title: •General Carlist Rieekan (V)
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to a war room. While at a war room, your capital starships at Rebel Base systems may not be targeted by weapons and your Rebels and T-47s at same and related Rebel Base locations move for free to same or related locations.
front.lore: One of the original founders of the Rebel Alliance. Former civilian strategist with the House of Organa. Somber leader of Echo Base.

front.title: •General Crix Madine
front.gametext: Once during each of your deploy phases, may take one scout of ability < 3 into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While at your war room or aboard your capital starship, adds 1 to immunity to attrition of all your scouts who have immunity.
front.lore: Military advisor to Mon Mothma. Leader of commando project. Corellian native. Defected to the Alliance shortly after the Battle of Yavin. Rescued by Rogue Squadron.

front.title: •General Dodonna
front.gametext: Increases Rebel Planners by 1, doubles if at same site. May use 1 Force to cancel Wrong Turn. Each Rebel present with him at a Yavin 4 site is power +1.
front.lore: Skilled tactician and natural leader. Planned attack on Death Star after analyzing technical readouts provided by Princess Leia. Star Destroyer captain during Old Republic.

front.title: •General Dodonna (V)
front.gametext: During your control phase, if at a Rebel Base location, may use 1 Force to take one Colonel Feyn Gospic, an Admiral's Order, or a Rebel pilot of ability < 3 into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Skilled tactician and natural leader. Planned attack on Death Star after analyzing technical readouts provided by Princess Leia. Star Destroyer captain during Old Republic.

front.title: •General Dodonna (V)
front.gametext: Once per game, if at a war room, may take a related battleground (or a Y-wing) into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While present at a war room, opponent's spies may not deploy here and your Epic Event destiny draws are +1.
front.lore: Skilled tactician and natural leader. Planned attack on Death Star after analyzing technical readouts provided by Princess Leia. Star Destroyer captain during Old Republic.

front.title: •General Jar Jar
front.gametext: Once per game may take Brisky Morning Munchen into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per battle, may use 1 Force to target an opponent's droid present. Both players draw destiny. If your destiny + 1 > opponent's destiny, target lost.
front.lore: After uniting the Gungans and the Noboo, Boss Nass promoted Jar Jar Binks to General. He's still a bit clumsy.

combo: General Jar Jar + Brisky Morning Munchen
General Jar Jar + Wesa Gotta Grand Army Make opponent's undercover spy lost.

front.title: •General Jar Jar (AI)
front.gametext: Once per game may take Brisky Morning Munchen into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per battle, may use 1 Force to target an opponent's droid present. Both players draw destiny. If your destiny + 1 > opponent's destiny, target lost.
front.lore: After uniting the Gungans and the Noboo, Boss Nass promoted Jar Jar Binks to General. He's still a bit clumsy.

front.title: •General Kenobi
front.gametext: During battle, if alone or with a clone, may activate 1 Force or add 1 to a just drawn destiny. Once per game, may take a clone or [Reflections III] lightsaber into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 6.
front.lore: Jedi Council member. Leader.

front.title: •General Leia Organa
front.gametext: While at a war room or battleground, game text of Admiral's Orders is suspended and whenever you initiate a battle with a Resistance character, retrieve 1 Force (2 if initiating against a First Order character). Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Leader.

front.title: •General McQuarrie
front.gametext: While McQuarrie is on Hoth, your Hoth Sentry is not unique (•), is doubled, deploys free, applies all of its modifiers and is immune to Alter. Power -1 when not on Hoth.
front.lore: Commander from Ralltiir. Fled from his homeworld after its occupation by the Empire. Was instrumental in the establishment of the new Rebel base on Hoth.

combo: General McQuarrie + Hoth Sentry

front.title: •General Solo
front.gametext: Deploys -2 on Falcon, Tydirium or Endor. Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When in battle with Chewie (or another of your scouts at an exterior site), may use 2 Force to cancel one opponent's battle destiny just drawn. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Scout. Leader of the Rebel strike team on Endor. Needed the cleverness of a Corellian to destroy the Endor control bunker. Discovered the truth about Luke and Leia.

combo: General Solo + Life Debt Deploy Chewie for free from Reserve Deck if Han is defending a battle alone.

front.title: •General Solo (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. During battle, may use 1 Force to play an Interrupt from your Reserve Deck (then place that card out of play). Once per turn, may take a non-Interrupt card with 'door' in game text into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Scout. Leader of the Rebel strike team on Endor. Needed the cleverness of a Corellian to destroy the Endor control bunker. Discovered the truth about Luke and Leia.

front.title: •General Solo (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. During battle, may use 1 Force to play an Interrupt from your Reserve Deck (then place that card out of play). Once per turn, may take a non-Interrupt card with 'door' in game text into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Scout. Leader of the Rebel strike team on Endor. Needed the cleverness of a Corellian to destroy the Endor control bunker. Discovered the truth about Luke and Leia.

pulls: One non-Interrupt card with door in game text

front.title: •General Solomahal
front.gametext: Once per game, may rearrange all Blockade Flagship sites (all cards at a given site move along with that site).  Once per turn, if [Virtual Block 5] Palpatine on table (or imprisoned) and you just drew a battle destiny of 3, may use X Force (limit 3) to add X to that destiny.
front.lore: Leader. Scout.

front.title: •General Walex Blissex
front.gametext: Deploys -2 aboard your Star Cruiser or to same location as your Admiral. Adds 1 to the power of anything he pilots. Adds 1 to the power and forfeit ofeach of your A-wings at same and related locations.
front.lore: Engineer who worked with Jan Dodonna to design the A-wing starfighter. Given honorary rank due to his service to the Rebellion.

combo: General Walex Blissex + A-wing

front.title: •General Walex Blissex (V)
front.gametext: Adds 1 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting a capital starship at a battleground system, in each battle a player's first battle destiny draw may not be canceled or reduced and if opponent canceled a just drawn battle destiny, they lose 1 Force.
front.lore: Engineer who worked with Jan Dodonna to design the A-wing starfighter. Given honorary rank due to his service to the Rebellion.

front.title: •General Walex Blissex (V)
front.gametext: While at a war room, at systems where you have two piloted snub fighters, opponent may draw no more than one battle destiny (you may not cancel those destiny draws) and opponent must use +1 Force to move an Imperial starship away.
front.lore: Engineer who worked with Jan Dodonna to design the A-wing starfighter. Given honorary rank due to his service to the Rebellion.

front.title: •Geonosis: Docking Bay
front.gametext: Light: : Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force (free if Yoda on Geonosis).

front.title: •Geonosis: Forward Command Center
front.gametext: Light: : [Episode I] Yoda ignores location deployment restrictions here. Once per game may deploy Yoda here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

front.title: •Geonosis: Petranaki Arena
front.gametext: Light: : Amidala, Anakin and Obi-Wan deploy -1 here.

front.title: •Geonosis: Rocky Plains
front.gametext: Light: : Your total power here is +1 for each [Clone Army] card present.

front.title: •Get Alongside That One
front.gametext: Target two non-creature vehicles with maneuver (one yours, one opponent's) present at same site. Both players draw destiny; add your vehicle's maneuver to your total. Lowest total loses vehicle. OR Your speeder bike piloted by Luke or a scout adds one battle destiny.
front.lore: Versatility is key to the Rebellion. The Rebels' ability to adapt to any situation is well-known.

front.title: •Get To Your Ships!
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once during your deploy phase, may reveal an unpiloted starfighter from hand to take its matching pilot character from Reserve Deck (or vice versa) and deploy both simultaneously; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Queen's plan called for the remnants of Bravo Flight to eliminate the Droid Control Ship. Not an easy task.

pulls: An unpiloted starfighter and matching pilot (or vice versa)
pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Ghoel
front.gametext: Deploys only at interior sites. Cannot move. During a battle at same site, may target one character present. Draw destiny. If destiny +3 > ability, target may not use ability toward drawing battle destiny this turn.
front.lore: Wol Cabbasshite. Immobile. Species evolved from parasites. Mistakenly left in Jabba's palace. No one suspects its intelligence. Often tries to lick passersby.

combo: Ghoel + Affect Mind Ghoel makes Affect Mind much more useful, as the removal of up to six ability, plus two from Affect Mind, can total eight ability away from battle destiny, a significant amount, especially if your opponent is relying on Vader.

front.title: •Ghost
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots, 3 passengers, and Phantom. Has ship-docking capability. May deploy Phantom here from reserve deck; reshuffle. While Hera piloting, immune to attrition < 5 (may not be canceled).
front.lore: Phoenix Squadron

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: Gian Speeder
front.gametext: May add 1 driver and 3 passengers. May move as a 'react' to Naboo sites. Your battle destiny draws are +1 for each of your Royal Naboo Security present. (Limit +3.)
front.lore: Military repulsorlift armed with three light repeating blasters. With a top speed of 160 kilometers per hour, they have the ability to out-flank an opponent in battle.

front.title: •Gift Of The Mentor
front.gametext: If Luke and Obi-Wan or Yoda are in a battle together, you may add two battle destiny. OR Use 1 Force to search through your Reserve Deck and take any one lightsaber into your hand. Shuffle deck, cut and replace.
front.lore: Luke relied on Obi-Wan's knowledge and advice to learn the ways of the Force. Obi-Wan continued to counsel Luke long after the old Jedi's apparent 'death.'

front.title: •Gimme A Lift!
front.gametext: Relocate Jar Jar to a battle just initiated at an adjacent site. OR Increase Jar Jar's landspeed by 1 for remainder of turn. OR If Jar Jar on Brisky Morning Munchen, take him into hand.
front.lore: Jar Jar Binks's courage on the battlefield put quite a thorn in the Trade Federation's side. Many believed it wasn't actually courage.

front.title: •Glancing Blow
front.gametext: If you have a character with a lightsaber present in a battle with Vader, lose 1 Force to reduce Vader's power to zero. OR If you have a character with a lightsaber in a duel, cancel one opponent's destiny draw immediately after it is revealed.
front.lore: It had been decades since Vader had felt the sting of an enemy's blade.

front.title: Golan Laser Battery
front.gametext: Deploy on any exterior planet site. Your warrior present may target a creature, character or vehicle at same or adjacent site using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Add 2 if targeting a creature or character. Target hit if destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Modified Golan Arms DForfeit: 9 anti-infantry battery. Proton-shielded control cylinder capped by one or more rotating turret-mounted laser cannons.

front.title: •Gold 1
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers.
front.lore: Lead fighter of Gold Squadron at Battle of Yavin. Flown by Jon 'Dutch' Vander. Designated Specter 1 at Renforra Base.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Gold 1 (V)
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers. If Dutch piloting, power +2, immune to attrition < 4, and once during any control phase, may take the top or bottom card of your Force Pile into hand.
front.lore: Lead fighter of Gold Squadron at Battle of Yavin. Flown by Jon 'Dutch' Vander. Designated Specter 1 at Renforra Base.

front.title: •Gold 2
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers. May forfeit in place of your other starfighter hit in Death Star: Trench, restoring that starfighter to normal.
front.lore: Tiree's Y-wing during the Battle of Yavin. Custom high-power lateral thrusters provide enhanced maneuverability, allowing Gold 2 to better draw and evade enemy fire.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Gold 3
front.gametext: If deployed to Dantooine, may retrieve 1 Force. May add 2 pilots or passengers. Proton Torpedoes deploy and fire free aboard. Immune to attrition < 4 when matching pilot aboard.
front.lore: Part of Pops' Y-wing squadron at the Rebel base on Dantooine. Led evacuation efforts from the base. Piloted by Ryle Torsyn.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Gold 4
front.gametext: If deployed to Anoat, may retrieve 1 Force. May add 2 pilots or passengers. SW-4 Ion Cannon deploys and fires free aboard. Immune to attrition < 4 when matching pilot aboard.
front.lore: Point starfighter for Gold Squadron during the approach to the Death Star. Impact scars on its hull caused by small asteroids.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Gold 5
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers, and 1 astromech.
front.lore: Flown by the veteran Rebel fighter pilot Pops during the Battle of Yavin. He personally supervised all repairs and maintenance.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Gold 6
front.gametext: If deployed to Kashyyyk, may retrieve 1 Force. May add 2 pilots or passengers. SW-4 Ion Cannon deploys and fires free aboard. Immune to attrition < 4 when matching pilot aboard.
front.lore: Led an attack on an Imperial outpost at Kashyyyk. Disabled the outpost's shields with ion cannons. Flown by Hol Okand during the Battle of Yavin.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Gold Leader In Gold 1
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot aboard is •Dutch, who provides ability of 2, adds 2 to power and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: At the Battle of Yavin, Dutch led his squadron of outdated but reliable Y-wings in the first wave of the assault against the Death Star.

front.title: •Gold Leader In Gold 1 (V)
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot is •Dutch, who provides ability of 2. Opponent may not 'react' to here and must first use 1 Force to draw a card for battle destiny here.
front.lore: At the Battle of Yavin, Dutch led his squadron of outdated but reliable Y-wings in the first wave of the assault against the Death Star.

front.title: •Gold Leader In Gold 1 (V)
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot is •Dutch, who provides ability of 2. Opponent may not 'react' to here and must first use 1 Force to draw a card for battle destiny here.
front.lore: At the Battle of Yavin, Dutch led his squadron of outdated but reliable Y-wings in the first wave of the assault against the Death Star.

front.title: •Gold Squadron 1
front.gametext: Deploy -2 to Endor. May add 2 pilots and 2 passengers. Immune to Tallon Roll. Immune to attrition < 4 when Lando or Nien Nunb piloting (< 6 when both).
front.lore: The Millennium Falcon relies on heavily upgraded speed and maneuverability to survive in combat. General Calrissian's starship at Battle of Endor.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •••Gold Squadron Y-wing
front.gametext: Deploy -2 at Yavin 4 or to same location as Dutch. May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 2 and adds 2 to power. Adds 1 to its ion cannon weapon destiny draws.
front.lore: Gold Squadron had the best Y-wing pilots in the Alliance. Lead by Jon 'Dutch' Vander. First wave of starfighters to assault the Death Star. Many were lost in the Battle of Yavin.

front.title: •Goldenrod
front.gametext: Plays on table. For opponent to deploy a character, starship, or vehicle for free (except by that card's own game text), opponent must first use 2 Force.

front.title: •Goo Nee Tay
front.gametext: Deploy on opponent's side of table. All opponent's characters of ability > 2 deploy +2. Also, opponent may not play Surprise and may not use M'iiyoom Onith's game text.
front.lore: 'Nah nah nah. Ohhhh! Louwa! GOO NEE TAY!'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Goo Nee Tay + Corporal Kensaric
canceledBy: I Find Your Lack Of Faith Disturbing (V) (Defensive Shield)

front.title: •Graak
front.gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each Light side icon at same Endor site. When opponent is losing Force from Force drains at same or adjacent Endor site, lost Force must come from Reserve Deck if possible.
front.lore: Cunning Ewok. Led successful attacks, encircling enemies and cutting off their retreats.

front.title: •••Gran
front.gametext: May retrieve 1 Force whenever opponent initiates battle at same or adjacent site (if at same site, retrieved Force may be taken into hand).
front.lore: From an ancient civilization. Pacifists. Those who commit acts of violence are banished from their home planet, Kinyen. Organizes peaceful protests against the Empire.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: Grappling Hook
front.gametext: If opponent just played an Interrupt, use 1 Force to deploy on table. That Interrupt is played out but is then 'grappled' (placed here but is out of play). Any new Interrupts of the same name are now unique (•). (Immune to Control.)
front.lore: Stormtrooper utility belts contain basic tools such as a grappling hook to grab onto protrusions. The hook can also be used to ensnare escaping targets.

pulledBy: Don't Do That Again - Defensive Shield
Don't Do That Again (V) - Defensive Shield
We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Grappling Hook (V)
front.gametext: If opponent just played an Interrupt, unless three Grappling Hooks on table, use 1 Force to deploy on table and stack that Interrupt here. Other copies of stacked Interrupt are destiny -3. (Immune to Control.)
front.lore: Stormtrooper utility belts contain basic tools such as a grappling hook to grab onto protrusions. The hook can also be used to ensnare escaping targets.

front.title: •Graveyard Of Giants
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Starships and vehicles just lost from Jakku locations are stacked here face down. Unless no cards here, if a player just Force drained on Jakku: that player may retrieve 1 Force (if they Force drained with a scavenger, may randomly retrieve instead), peek at cards stacked here, and then place one in owner's Lost Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: High-speed collisions are a constant danger during chaotic starfighter dogfights. Scanners can be jammed. Pilots rely on vision, increasing the chances of such accidents.

pulledBy: Old Allies (at the start of the game)
We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Graxol Kelvyyn
front.gametext: While at Podrace Arena, at end of opponent's turn: you retrieve 1 Force if Anakin's Podracer is leading the Podrace, or you lose 1 Force if Anakin's Podracer is losing the Podrace.
front.lore: Gentle male Anx who enjoys the risk and reward of the Podraces. Has a bet against Watto that Skywalker will win the Boonta Eve event.

front.title: •Gray Squadron 1
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers. Ion cannons may fire free aboard. Each of its ion cannon destiny draws is +2. Immune to attrition < 4 when Salm or Kian piloting.
front.lore: Y-wing flown by Colonel Salm at the battle of Endor. Ordered to disable capital starships between the Death star and General Calrissian.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Gray Squadron 2
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers. Immune to attrition < 3 when Lieutenat Telsij or Karie Neth piloting (when both immune to attrition < 5 and adds one destiny to power only).
front.lore: Flown by Lieutenant Telsij as Colonel Salm's wingman. Part of gray squadron at the battle of Endor.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •••Gray Squadron Y-wing Pilot
front.gametext: Adds 2 to the power of anything he pilots. When piloting a Y-wing, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. When a starship he pilots fires an ion cannon, once per turn, may draw two weapon destiny and choose one.
front.lore: Veteran pilots of the reliable Koensayr starfigher were assigned by Ackbar to a key role at Endor. Both the pilots and their venerable Y-wings were up to the task.

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

front.title: •Great Shot, Kid!
front.gametext: Deploy on table. If Death Star 'blown away': Whenever you deploy a unique (*) starship to a system location, retrieve 3 Force; Once per during each of your turns you may deploy (for free) a starship from hand or Reserve Deck and reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: With the destruction of the Death Star, the Rebel Alliance received new-found support throughout the galaxy.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Great Shot, Kid! + Launching The Assault Make the most out of the free deploy by adding to your drains with all those Star Cruisers you can have.

Great Shot, Kid! + Home One + Admiral Ackbar + First Officer Thaneespi First use Great Shot, Kid! to get Home One, deploy it free, deploy Ackbar on it for two (You can use Balanced Attack to grab Ackbar), use Ackbar to get First Officer Thaneespi and deploy her for one. Suddenly, for only three Force you have a power 15 capital ship with immunity to attrition of anything less that ten and forces your opponent to come up with seven or more ability before any attrition can happen!

front.title: Great Warrior
front.gametext: Deploy on a Dagobah site. Target a mentor here. Also, target or deploy (regardless of location deployment restrictions) an apprentice here. Attempt when targets are present at the beginning of your control phase. Draw training destiny. If destiny + apprentice's ability > 12, test completed: Place on apprentice. All opponent's Force drain bonuses are canceled.

front.title: •Green Leader
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Green Squadron 1, draws on battle destiny if not able to otherwise. Adds 3 to total weapon destiny of any starfighter he pilots firing at a starfighter with lower maneuver.
front.lore: Leader. Assigned to fly fighter screen for General Calrissian at Endor.

front.title: •Green Leader In Green Squadron 1
front.gametext: Permanent pilot is •Green Leader, who provides ability of 2. Adds one battle destiny with a Rebel snub fighter. During battle, may cancel immunity to attrition of one starship here; this A-wing is 'hit.'
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Green Squadron 1
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. Power -1 when opponent has a starfighter present with higher maneuver. Immune to attrition < 4 when Green Leader piloting.
front.lore: Constructed at Chardaan Shipyards, a zero-gravity facility. Typically used as an escort for Y-wings or B-wings on critical attack missions.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
combo: Green Squadron 1 + General Walex Blissex

front.title: •Green Squadron 1 (V)
front.gametext: May add Green Leader as a pilot. Once per turn, may take Diversionary Tactics into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. If with Executor at end of battle, may draw destiny; Executor and this starfighter lost if destiny > 5.
front.lore: Constructed at Chardaan Shipyards, a zero-gravity facility. Typically used as an escort for Y-wings or B-wings on critical attack missions.

front.title: •Green Squadron 3
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. Power -1 when opponent has a starfighter present with higher maneuver. Maneuver +2 at a Death Star II sectors. Immune to attrition < 4 when Tycho Celchu piloting.
front.lore: Flown by Tycho Celchu at the Battle of Endor. Modified canopy improves pilot vision in tight confines. Assigned to fly top cover for Millennium Falcon.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
combo: Green Squadron 3 + General Walex Blissex

front.title: •••Green Squadron A-wing
front.gametext: Deploy -2 to Sullust or same system or sector as Green Leader. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2 and adds 2 to power. Power -1 when opponent has a starfighter present with a higher maneuver.
front.lore: A-wing starfighters from Green Squadron. Assigned mission of screening Rebel capital starships from enemy fighters and bombers.

combo: Green Squadron A-wing + General Walex Blissex

front.title: •••Green Squadron Pilot
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting an A-wing, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise and is forfeit +2.
front.lore: Many top X-wing pilots transferred to A-wing squadrons when the new starfighter entered service. The best A-wing pilots were selected to fly for Green Squadron at the Battle of Endor.

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

front.title: •Grimtaash
front.gametext: USED: If opponent has 13 or more cards in hand, place all but 8 (random selection) in Used Pile.  LOST: Cancel Molator (even at a holosite). OR Use 4 Force to reveal opponent's hand. All cards opponent has two or more of in hand are lost."
front.lore: Dejarik representation of mythical Molator guardian. The spirit of Grimtaash is said to protect Alderaanian royalty from corruption and betrayal.

combo: Grimtaash + BG-J38 Adds 2 to the destiny of each of your holograms and dejariks drawn for battle destiny or weapon destiny.

front.title: •Grondorn Muse
front.gametext: While Grondorn is on Yavin 4, your Yavin Sentry is not unique (•), is doubled, deploys free, applies all three of its modifiers and is immune to Alter. Power -1 when not on Yavin 4.
front.lore: Formerly belonged to the Corellian militia. Popular musician before the Empire blacklisted his songs for their political content. Joined the Alliance with his wife, Duriet.

combo: Grondorn Muse + Yavin Sentry

front.title: Grounded Starfighter
front.gametext: Deploy on a landed starship (not at a docking bay). Starship may not move. OR Deploy on a starship or vehicle on Dagobah. Starship or vehicle may not move. At the start of your next control phase, starship or vehicle 'sinks' to bottom of the Lost Pile.
front.lore: 'If you're saying coming here was a bad idea. I'm beginning to agree with you.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Grrrghrrrgh!
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  If your Wookiee just lost, may stack it here.  You may not add more than one destiny to total power in battle.  Wookiees are deploy -1 and, while at least one stacked here, they are armor = 4 and immune to attrition < 3.  During any battle, may place a card here out of play to add one destiny to total power. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'It's not wise to upset a Wookiee.' 'But sir, nobody worries about upsetting a droid.' 'That's 'cause a droid don't pull people's arms out of their sockets when they lose.'

front.title: •Grugnak
front.gametext: While on Cloud City, once during each of your deploy phases may use or lose X Force to relocate any one of your characters at same site to a related site, where X equals ability of your character being relocated.
front.lore: Elderly Ugnaught who despised the Empire for occupying his home on Cloud City. Helped the Rebellion secretly move personnel to aid the resistance movement.

front.title: •Guardian's Lightsaber
front.gametext: Deploy on Aayla or [Virtual Block 7]Mace. During your control phase, if present at a battleground you control, opponent loses 1 Force. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and may not be used to satisfy attrition if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: A Jedi learns not only to wield a lightsaber, but how to channel the Force to increase skill and control the lightsaber's damage.

front.title: Gundark
front.gametext: * Ferocity = 3 + destiny.  Habitat: forests, jungles, swamps and exterior Endor sites.  During battle here (even if excluded), may place Gundark in Lost Pile to reduce your battle damage by 5.

front.title: •••Gungan Energy Shield
front.gametext: Deploy on an exterior site. While your Fambaa here: your characters here may not be targeted by weapons, oponent's battle destiny draws here are -1, and characters must use +1 Force when moving to or from here using their landspeed.
front.lore: Gungan energy shields can only be passed through by slow-moving objects. This allowed the Gungans to neutralize the threat posed by longrange tank weapons.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Fambaa + Gungan Energy Shield

front.title: •••Gungan General
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Naboo. Your Gungans at same site are firfeit +2. While in a battle, if you just drew a Gungan for battle destiny you may take that card into hand.
front.lore: Many Gungans spend years studying the art of war in the depths of Otoh Gunga. Only at the Battle of Naboo were these Gungans able to exercise that knowledge. Leader.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
combo: Gungan General + Wesa Gotta Grand Army Make opponent's undercover spy lost.

front.title: Gungan Guard
front.gametext: Your Gungan leaders present may not be targeted by weapons. While defending a battle on Naboo, Power +4 and, whenever you draw a Gungan for battle destiny, add 3 to that destiny. Requires +2 Force to use landspeed.
front.lore: Equipped with portable Gungan shields, these front line troops provide a secondary defense against blaster fire.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
combo: Gungan Guard + Wesa Gotta Grand Army Make opponent's undercover spy lost.

front.title: Gungan Warrior
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to a Naboo site opponent occupies. While with another Gungan, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. Power +3 while armed with an electropole.
front.lore: Residing in the underwater city of Otoh Gunga, the Gungans established an alliance with the Naboo to fight the Trade Federation's forceful occupation of their planet.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
combo: Agents In The Court Objective + Jar Jar Binks + multiple Gungan Warriors
Gungan Warrior + Wesa Gotta Grand Army Make opponent's undercover spy lost.

front.title: •Han
front.gametext: <none>
front.lore: Corellian. Graduated with honors from the Imperial Academy. Dishonorably discharged. Wanders the galaxy building a reputation as a gambler and a hot-shot pilot.

combo: Han + Life Debt Deploy Chewie for free from Reserve Deck if Han is defending a battle alone.

front.title: •Han (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. Force retrieval with Or Be Destroyed is immune to Secret Plans. While armed with a blaster, Han is defense value +2. While Or Be Destroyed on table, immune to attrition < Han's power.
front.lore: Corellian. Graduated with honors from the Imperial Academy. Dishonorably discharged. Wanders the galaxy building a reputation as a gambler and a hot-shot pilot.

front.title: •Han (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. Force retrieval with Or Be Destroyed is immune to Secret Plans. While armed with a blaster, Han is defense value +2. While Or Be Destroyed on table, immune to attrition < Han's power.
front.lore: Corellian. Graduated with honors from the Imperial Academy. Dishonorably discharged. Wanders the galaxy building a reputation as a gambler and a hot-shot pilot.

combo: Han (V) + Life Debt Deploy Chewie for free from Reserve Deck if Han is defending a battle alone.

front.title: •Han Solo
front.gametext: Once during battle, may use 1 Force to cancel and re-draw your just drawn destiny. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Falcon, also adds 2 to maneuver and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: Smuggler, gambler and 'freelance law-bender.' Crafty Corellian pirate. Rebel hero. Owns Millennium Falcon. Co-pilot Chewbacca promised him 'life-debt.' Has bounty on head.

combo: Han Solo + Life Debt Deploy Chewie for free from Reserve Deck if Han is defending a battle alone.
cancels: Your just drawn destiny to cause a re-draw

front.title: •Han Solo (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots.  Cards with 'Han' in title are destiny +3.  May use 1 Force to cancel Boba Fett or Jabba's game text for remainder of turn.  If opponent just initiated battle here, may use 1 Force to take the first weapons segment action.
front.lore: Smuggler, gambler and 'freelance law-bender'. Crafty Corellian pirate. Rebel hero. Owns Millennium Falcon. Co-pilot Chewbacca promised him 'life-debt'. Has bounty on head.

front.title: •Han Solo, Courageous Smuggler
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting Falcon, may add one destiny to total power or attrition. If Han is about to draw a card for weapon destiny, may instead use Han's ability number. Once per game, may deploy non-[Maintenance] Chewie to same site. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Han's smuggling adventures in Corporate Sector and Hutt Space put him in many tight scrapes. He's about to be in another.

front.title: •Han Solo, Innocent Scoundrel
front.gametext: Adds 3 to the power of anything he pilots. Draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. During battle, Han may fire a (Virtual Block 8) blaster twice. Once per turn, if opponent is about to draw a weapon destiny targeting Han, they draw two and you choose one. Immune to attrition < 3 (<4 if armed).
front.lore: 'Well, that was a long time ago. I'm sure he's forgotten about that.' Since he needed Calrissian's help, Han regretted having introduced Lando to the Tonnika sisters.

front.title: •Han With Heavy Blaster Pistol
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. Adds one battle destiny if with Luke or Chewie. Permanent weapon is •Han's Heavy Blaster Pistol (may target a character or creature for free; draw destiny; target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if destiny +1 > defense value).
front.lore: Scoundrel, smuggler, gambler and risk taker. 'Everything's going to be fine. Trust me.'

combo: Han With Heavy Blaster Pistol + Life Debt Deploy Chewie for free from Reserve Deck if Han is defending a battle alone.
Han With Heavy Blaster Pistol + Blaster Proficiency Add 3 to your weapon destiny.

front.title: •Han, Chewie, And The Falcon
front.gametext: Permanent pilots are •Han and •Chewie: provide ability of 5, add one battle destiny, and add 5 to power. Immune to attrition < 6, Come With Me, and Lateral Damage. End of your turn: Use 3 Force to maintain OR Place out of play.
front.lore: Although tempermental, this trusty hunk of junk always seems to perform for its proud owner and his Wookie co-pilot when needed the most.

combo: Han, Chewie, And The Falcon + Life Debt Adds two destinies, bringing it to a total of 4.
Han, Chewie, And The Falcon + Punch It! Adds two destinies in a defending battle.

front.title: •Han, Chewie, And The Falcon (V)
front.gametext: May add 2 passengers. Permanent pilots are •Han and •Chewie, who provide total ability of 5. While in battle, adds one destiny to total power. Immune to Come With Me, Life Debt, and attrition < 5.
front.lore: Although tempermental, this trusty hunk of junk always seems to perform for its proud owner and his Wookie co-pilot when needed the most.

front.title: •Han, Chewie, And The Falcon (V)
front.gametext: Permanent pilots are •Han and •Chewie: provide ability of 5. Attempts here to 'blow away' any Death Star are +2. Immue to Come With Me, Lateral Damage, Life Debt and attrition < 6.
front.lore: Although tempermental, this trusty hunk of junk always seems to perform for its proud owner and his Wookie co-pilot when needed the most.

combo: Han, Chewie, And The Falcon + Punch It! Adds two destinies in a defending battle.

front.title: Han's Back
front.gametext: If Han is lost, use 1 Force to retrieve him from the Lost Pile. OR Use 3 Force to search through your Reserve Deck and take Han into your hand. Shuffle deck, cut and replace.
front.lore: 'Didn't we just leave this party?'

front.title: Han's Back (V)
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy (or retrieve) Han's Heavy Blaster Pistol, Falcon, or Han from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR If opponent just drew weapon destiny targeting Falcon or Han, cancel and redraw that destiny.
