front.gametext: *Ferocity = destiny - 4. Habitat: planet sites (except Hoth and Tatooine) and Dark Waters. Cumulatively absorbs (temporarily cancels) one [Dark Side Force] icon present. Parasite: None.
front.lore: Tree-nesting reptile. Favors moist caves and marshes. Extremely docile, despite fearsome appearance. Responsive to Force energy.

front.title: •Obi-Wan in Radiant VII
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. Permanent pilot is •Obi-Wan, who provides ability of 6. Opponent's starships may not cloak. Your total ability here may not be reduced.
front.lore: Optimized for diplomatic missions with sensor-proof pods that have ejection capabilities. Easily identified by its red coloration.

front.title: •Obi-Wan in Radiant VII
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. Permanent pilot is •Obi-Wan, who provides ability of 6. Opponent's starships may not 'cloak.' Your total ability here may not be reduced.
front.lore: Optimized for diplomatic missions with sensor-proof pods that have ejection capabilities. Easily identified by its red coloration.

front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi
front.gametext: When a battle was just initiated where present, may use 1 Force to choose one opponent's character of ability = 1 present to move away (for free), or that character is lost. Immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Jedi Knight. Trained by Yoda. Friend of Bail Organa. General Kenobi became a hero of the Old Republic during the Clone Wars. Mentor of Anakin and Luke Skywalker.

combo: Obi-Wan Kenobi + Krayt Dragon Howl

front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi (V)
front.gametext: Obi-Wan's game text may not be canceled and he may not be targeted by cards that capture. Unless another Jedi present, may Force drain here regardless of Objective restrictions. Immune to attrition < 5 (< 8 if with a Dark Jedi).
front.lore: Jedi Knight. Trained by Yoda. Friend of Bail Organa. General Kenobi became a hero of the Old Republic during the Clone Wars. Mentor of Anakin and Luke Skywalker.

front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi (V)
front.gametext: Obi-Wan's deploy cost may not be increased. Power +1 for each Dark Jedi here. Once per game, may exchange two cards in hand with any one card in Lost Pile. Immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Jedi Knight. Trained by Yoda. Friend of Bail Organa. General Kenobi became a hero of the Old Republic during the Clone Wars. Mentor of Anakin and Luke Skywalker.

combo: Obi-Wan Kenobi (V) + Krayt Dragon Howl

front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight
front.gametext: Deploys -2 to Naboo. Power +2 if Maul present. If Qui-Gon is participating in lightsaber combat and Obi-Wan is present, Qui-Gon may use Obi-Wan's combat cards. Immune to Sniper and attrition < 5.
front.lore: Padawan learner promoted to Jedi Knight after his encounter with Darth Maul. Has sworn to train Anakin Skywalker, even if the Jedi Council forbids it.

combo: Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight + Are You Brain Dead?! Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight + Krayt Dragon Howl

front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight (V)
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to [Episode I] sites. During a battle (or duel) with a Dark Jedi, unless Obi-Wan's Journal on table, may lose 1 Force to cancel a just drawn duel or weapon destiny. Immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Padawan learner promoted to Jedi Knight after his encounter with Darth Maul. Has sworn to train Anakin Skywalker, even if the Jedi Council forbids it.

front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner
front.gametext: Deploys -2 to Tatooine. If opponent just initiated a battle at a related Tatooine site, may use 2 Force to relocate Obi-Wan to that site. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Qui-Gon Jinn's Padawan. Stayed behind to protect Queen Amidala when Qui-Gon left to explore Mos Espa, but was in constant communication should he be needed.

combo: Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner + Krayt Dragon Howl

front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner (AI)
front.gametext: Deploys -2 to Tatooine. If opponent just initiated a battle at a related Tatooine site, may use 2 Force to relocate Obi-Wan to that site. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Qui-Gon Jinn's Padawan. Stayed behind to protect Queen Amidala when Qui-Gon left to explore Mos Espa, but was in constant communication should he be needed.

front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner (V)
front.gametext: Deploys -2 (and landspeed = 2) on Tatooine.  If a card was just stacked on Credits Will Do Fine, may take a non-character card into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  While at opponent's Watto's Junkyard, its Light Side game text is canceled.  Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Qui-Gon Jinn's Padawan. Stayed behind to protect Queen Amidala when Qui-Gon left to explore Mos Espa, but was in constant communication should he be needed.

front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner (V)
front.gametext: Deploys -2 (and landspeed = 2) on Tatooine. If a card was just stacked on Credits Will Do Fine, may take a non-character card into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While at opponent's Watto's Junkyard, its Light Side game text is canceled. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Qui-Gon Jinn's Padawan. Stayed behind to protect Queen Amidala when Qui-Gon left to explore Mos Espa, but was in constant communication should he be needed.

front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner (V) (AI)
front.gametext: Deploys -2 (and landspeed = 2) on Tatooine.  If a card was just stacked on Credits Will Do Fine, may take a non-character card into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  While at opponent's Watto's Junkyard, its Light Side game text is canceled.  Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Qui-Gon Jinn's Padawan. Stayed behind to protect Queen Amidala when Qui-Gon left to explore Mos Espa, but was in constant communication should he be needed.

front.title: •Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner (V) (AI)
front.gametext: Deploys -2 (and landspeed = 2) on Tatooine.  If a card was just stacked on Credits Will Do Fine, may take a non-character card into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  While at opponent's Watto's Junkyard, its Light Side game text is canceled.  Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Qui-Gon Jinn's Padawan. Stayed behind to protect Queen Amidala when Qui-Gon left to explore Mos Espa, but was in constant communication should he be needed.

front.title: •Obi-Wan With Lightsaber
front.gametext: Permanent weapon is •Obi-Wan's Lightsaber (may target a character or creature for free; draw two destiny; target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value).
front.lore: 'The Force will be with you... always.'

combo: Obi-Wan With Lightsaber + Obi-Wan's Cape Makes Obi-Wan immune to attrition < 5.
Obi-Wan With Lightsaber + A Jedi's Resilience
Obi-Wan With Lightsaber + Krayt Dragon Howl

front.title: •Obi-Wan, Crazy Wizard
front.gametext: Old Ben is a Used Interrupt and may target this site even if not a Tatooine site. Dark Jedi may not 'swing' lightsabers more than once per battle here. When leaving table, place all your cards on Obi-Wan in Used Pile. Immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: 'That old man's just a crazy wizard.' Obi-Wan lived in Tatooine's deserts for years...ready for the right moment to act.

front.title: •Obi-Wan's Apparition
front.gametext: Use 4 Force to deploy on any site if opponent is generating at least 3 Force more than you. At that site, adjacent sites and same sites as Obi-Wan, players activate Force only if they have presence.
front.lore: 'Luminous beings are we, not this crude matter.' The inner consciousness of a Jedi can transcend even death.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Obi-Wan's Apparition (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. May place your just lost Jedi out of play. May use X Force to add X to a just drawn weapon or battle destiny, where X = number of your Jedi out of play.
front.lore: 'Luminous beings are we, not this crude matter.' The inner consciousness of a Jedi can transcend even death.

front.title: •Obi-Wan's Cape
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your Rebel or alien. Character is immune to attrition < 5. Also, When a battle was just initiated where present, may use 1 Force to choose one opponent's character of ability = 1 present to move away (for free), or that character is lost.
front.lore: A symbol of the noble Jedi and his mysterious powers.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Obi-Wan's Cape (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on Obi-Wan. Obi-Wan is defense value +1 and may not be excluded from battle. During opponent's turn, may place this Effect in Lost Pile to cancel a just drawn duel, lightsaber combat, or weapon destiny draw here.
front.lore: A symbol of the noble Jedi and his mysterious powers.

front.title: •Obi-Wan's Journal
front.gametext: Deploy on Luke or Obi-Wan. Your characters present armed with a unique (•) lightsaber Weapon card may not be Disarmed, once per battle may cancel a weapon destiny just drawn, and that lightsaber's Force drain modifiers may not be canceled. Lost if about to be stolen.
front.lore: Written by Obi-Wan Kenobi. Used by Luke to construct his lightsaber. Contained instructions on building required tools as well. Keyed to self-destruct if not opened by Luke.

front.title: •Obi-Wan's Lightsaber
front.gametext: Deploy on Obi-Wan. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: 'An elegant weapon for a more civilized time.' Miniaturized power cell. Uses rare crystals to focus the lightblade. This lightsaber was personally built by Obi-Wan.

front.title: •Obi-Wan's Lightsaber
front.gametext: Deploy on [Episode I] Obi-Wan. May add 1 to Force drain if present at a Naboo battleground. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Add 1 if targeting a Dark Jedi. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Constructed by Obi-Wan himself, this Padawan's lightsaber was responsible for tearing an ancient Sith weapon in half.

front.title: •Odin Nesloor
front.gametext: During your move phase, target any or all of your characters at one exterior site to 'transport' (relocate) to another exterior site. Draw destiny. Use that much Force to 'transport,' or place Interrupt in Lost Pile.
front.lore: Odin's family mysteriously disappeared during a hyperspace jump. He scours the galaxy for information on them, and his best lead has brought him to Tatooine.

front.title: •Odin Nesloor & •First Aid
front.gametext: If your character's forfeit was just reduced to 0, use 1 Force (free if forfeit reduced by a [Permanent Weapon] weapon) to restore it to normal. (Immune to Sense.) OR Cancel an attempt to 'operate' on a character; character is protected from any further attempts until start of opponent's next turn. OR During your move phase, target any or all of your characters at one site to 'transport' (relocate) to an exterior or battleground site. Draw destiny. Use that much Force to 'transport,' or place Interrupt in Lost Pile.

front.title: •Odin Nesloor & •First Aid
front.gametext: If your character is about to be hit, use 1 Force (free if by a [Permanent Weapon] weapon) to prevent its forfeit from being reduced  (and character is immune to Dr. Evazan) for remainder of turn. OR Cancel Disarmed. (Immune to Sense.) OR Cancel a 'react'. OR During your move phase, target any or all of your characters at one site to 'transport' (relocate) to an exterior or battleground site. Draw destiny. Use that much Force to 'transport,' or place Interrupt in Lost Pile.

front.title: •Off The Edge
front.gametext: Target one of your characters at a Cloud City site. Draw destiny. If destiny > character's destiny number, retrieve Force equal to the distance. If destiny < character's destiny number, lose difference. If destiny = character's destiny number, character is lost.
front.lore: Despite the brutal attacks of the Dark Lord, dying on Cloud City was not Luke's destiny.

combo: Off The Edge + Cloud City: Incinerator + EG-4 (Eegee-Four)

front.title: •Officer Dolphe
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While aboard Bravo 2, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise, and opponent's battle destiny draws are -2 at same system.
front.lore: Growing up in a small town outside of Theed, Porro became adept at speeder control and thrust. His decision to volunteer for Bravo Flight made Ric Olie a very happy man.

front.title: •Officer Ellberger
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anythings she pilots. While piloting Bravo 5 and at same system as a droid starfighter, adds one destiny to attrition only.
front.lore: Computer systems troubleshooter whose sour past is not discussed by her squad mates. Years of experience enabled her to predict and adjust to droid starfighter tactics.

front.title: •Officer Perosei
front.gametext: Once during your deploy phase, may use 1 Force to relocate Perosei to an adjacent Naboo site. While with a Republic character during battle, may place Perosei out of play to add 5 to your total power this battle.
front.lore: Royal Naboo security guard who can disassemble and reassemble a Naboo blaster in less than sixty seconds. During the occupation, was a prisoner at Camp Four.

front.title: •Oh, He's Not Dead, Not Yet
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Once per game, if Vader on table, may deploy Obi-Wan from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  May place this Effect in Used Pile to take a [Grabber] into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  If you just attempted to take into hand or deploy a card from Reserve Deck, and the card was not found, may place this Effect in Lost Pile to search your Force Pile for that card; reshuffle.
front.lore: 'Where did you dig up that old fossil?' 'I don't think he exists anymore.' 'Surely he must be dead by now.' 'I can't believe he's gone.' 'Oh, he's not dead, not yet.' Obi's back!

front.title: Old Allies / We Need Your Help
front.gametext: Deploy Jakku system and Niima Outpost Shipyard (with [Episode VII] Falcon there). May deploy Graveyard Of Giants.{For} remainder of game, you may not deploy Luke or Jedi. Your Destiny is suspended. Opponent's [Reflections II] objective targets Rey instead of Luke. While Rey at a battleground site, Visage Of The Emperor is suspended.{While} this side up, once per turn, may deploy a Jakku location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if you control Jakku system and occupy two Jakku battleground sites (or vice versa).We Need Your Help{While} this side up, once per turn, may deploy a Jakku location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once during opponent's control phase, if you control two Jakku battlegrounds and are about to lose Force, may reduce that Force loss to 1 (may not be further reduced). Once per battle involving your Resistance character, may subtract 2 from a just drawn destiny. While with Han, your [Episode VII] characters and [Episode VII] starships are defense value +2.{Flip} this card if you do not occupy two battlegrounds.

back.title: Old Allies / We Need Your Help
back.gametext: Deploy Jakku system and Niima Outpost Shipyard (with [Episode VII] Falcon there). May deploy Graveyard Of Giants.{For} remainder of game, you may not deploy Luke or Jedi. Your Destiny is suspended. Opponent's [Reflections II] objective targets Rey instead of Luke. While Rey at a battleground site, Visage Of The Emperor is suspended.{While} this side up, once per turn, may deploy a Jakku location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if you control Jakku system and occupy two Jakku battleground sites (or vice versa).We Need Your Help{While} this side up, once per turn, may deploy a Jakku location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once during opponent's control phase, if you control two Jakku battlegrounds and are about to lose Force, may reduce that Force loss to 1 (may not be further reduced). Once per battle involving your Resistance character, may subtract 2 from a just drawn destiny. While with Han, your [Episode VII] characters and [Episode VII] starships are defense value +2.{Flip} this card if you do not occupy two battlegrounds.

front.title: Old Ben
front.gametext: Use 1 Force if any of your characters (except Obi-Wan) was just forfeited from a Tatooine site. Mysterious 'crazy wizard' steps in and revives (returns from Lost Pile) that character back to same site.
front.lore: 'That old man's just a crazy wizard.' Obi-Wan lived in Tatooine's deserts for years...ready for the right moment to act.

front.title: •Old Pirates
front.gametext: If a battle was just initiated involving Han and any Lando, the eventual loser of the battle may not lose cards from Life Force to satisfy battle damage while that player has any cards in hand. OR Cancel Double-Crossing, No-Good Swindler.
front.lore: 'How you doing, you old pirate? So good to see you.'

combo: Old Pirates + Han + Lando + Chewie + Luke + Rug Hug + Millenium Falcon Four destiny draws and immunity to attrition < 5.

front.title: Old Times
front.gametext: If Luke and Biggs are defending a battle together (or are in any battle together at Tatooine), add one battle destiny. OR If Luke and Biggs are making an Attack Run, add one battle destiny to your Attack Run total.
front.lore: 'I'll be right up there with you! And, have I got stories to tell you...'

front.title: •On Target
front.gametext: If you have a piloted capital starship armed with a starship weapon, use 2 Force to target an opponent's starship present. Until the end of your next turn, target cannot move and its pilots may not apply ability toward drawing battle destiny.
front.lore: Some Imperial starfighters are equipped with sensors, informing the pilot when an enemy craft has targeted him. The pilot's evasive maneuvers cost him time, but save his life.

cards.counterpart: They've Shut Down The Main Reactor

front.title: On The Edge
front.gametext: Use 1 Force and target one Rebel (on table) of ability > 2. Choose a number from 1 to 6. You may retrieve that amount from your Lost Pile if you now draw destiny > chosen number. If you fail, Rebel is lost.
front.lore: Luke and Leia nearly fell over the retracted bridge across the Death Star's central core while trying to elude stormtroopers. They were soon trapped on the precipice.

front.title: •One More Pass
front.gametext: If you are about to draw power harpoon weapon destiny, add ability of one pilot aboard same vehicle.
front.lore: 'Cable out. Let 'er go!'

front.title: •Only Jedi Carry That Weapon
front.gametext: Plays on table. For opponent to steal a weapon from target character using a non-[Episode I] card, must first draw destiny. If destiny +1 > target's ability, weapon stolen. Otherwise, attempt fails and stealing card is placed out of play.
front.lore: An elegant weapon for a more civilized age.

cards.counterpart: Weapon Of A Sith - Defensive Shield

front.title: •Oola
front.gametext: During your control phase, may cause opponent to reveal entire hand by using X Force, where X = number of cards in opponent's hand. All unique (•) male Imperials or unique (•) male aliens there are placed in opponent's Used Pile.
front.lore: Female Twi'lek musician. Became a dancer to live a life of luxury. Has worked for Jabba for only two days. Desperate to escape.

combo: Oola + It Can Wait

front.title: •Opee Sea Killer
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Cancels Sando Aqua Monster. While no card here, may place an opponent's just-drawn battle destiny face-up here. If opponent just drew battle destiny with the same card title as card here, place both cards in opponent's Lost Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The opee sea killer catches its prey with a long, flexible tongue. It uses camouflage to assist in hunting prey, as well as avoiding larger predators like the sando aqua monster.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: <>Orbital Mine
front.gametext: Deploy at the same system as a bomber. 'Explodes' if an opponents starship deploys or moves here. Draw destiny. Add 2 when targeting a capital starship. Starship lost if total destiny > defense value. Orbital mine is also lost.
front.lore: Often Stolen from the Empire. Used by the Rebellion to protect key spaceports. Can be released to cover the retreat of a fleeing strike force.

front.title: •Ord Mantell
front.gametext: Light: : If you control, each of opponent's bounty hunters is forfeit -2.

combo: Ord Mantell + Theron Nett Theron Nett adds 1 to each of your Force drains here.

front.title: •Order To Engage
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on opponent's side of table. At the end of each of opponent's battle phases, if a battle did not take place at every location where both players have presence at the end of that phase, opponent loses 3 Force.
front.lore: Political pressure forced the Empire to join battle with the Alliance in otherwise tactically poor situations. Failure to engage the enemy was considered tantamount to treason.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Order To Engage + All My Urchins The Dark Side player can decide between losing three Force for not battling or losing two Force for attacking.

front.title: Organized Attack
front.gametext: USED: If a battle was just initiated, each of your X-wings and Y-wings present is power +1 and immune to attrition for remainder of turn.  LOST: Lose 1 Force to take up to three non-unique X-wings and/or non-unique Y-wings into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle."
front.lore: 'Hold up here and wait for my signal to start your run.'

front.title: •Orrimaarko
front.gametext: When Orrimaarko is in a battle you just won against an Imperial, opponent must lose 2 Force. Immune to attrition < 3 (or < 4 when present at a forest, jungle or exterior Endor site).
front.lore: Dresselian Scout and resistance leader. Worked tirelessly to combat the subjugation of his homeworld before Bothans brought him into contact with the Alliance.

front.title: •Orrimaarko (V)
front.gametext: Once per game, may take a rifle and/or an Interrupt with 'scout' in game text into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Unless Undercover, while alone at an exterior site, opponent's weapon destiny draws here are -2. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Dresselian Scout and resistance leader. Worked tirelessly to combat the subjugation of his homeworld before Bothans brought him into contact with the Alliance.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Jon Westergard - Virginia States 2005)"

front.title: •••Ortolan
front.gametext: Power and forfeit +2 on Hoth or at Dining Room. While at a marker site, cumulatively adds 1 to number of Hoth sites required for opponent to gain a Force drain bonus from Walker Garrison.
front.lore: Squat, floppy-eared food lovers. Ortolans come from the frigid planet Orto. Communicate above the auditory range of most species.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
combo: Ortolan + CZ-3 + Arcona

front.title: •Ounee Ta
front.gametext: Deploy on table. You may immediately take top card of Lost Pile into hand. None Shall Pass is unique (•) and a Lost Interrupt. At each opponent's <> site, your characters and vehicles are each deploy -3 and your Force generation is +1. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Jabba's decadent behavior makes him susceptible to deception. Leia and Lando exploited this weakness, posing as Jabba's kind of scum.

pulls: Top card of Lost Pile into hand
pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
canceledBy: Let's Keep A Little Optimism Here (V) - Defensive Shield

front.title: •Ounee Ta
front.gametext: Plays on table. At each opponent's <> site, your Rebels are each deploy -2 and your Force generation is +1.
front.lore: Jabba's decadent behavior makes him susceptible to deception. Leia and Lando exploited this weakness, posing as Jabba's kind of scum.

canceledBy: Let's Keep A Little Optimism Here (V) - Defensive Shield

front.title: •Ounee Ta (Premium) (V)
front.gametext: Plays on table. While you occupy a Renegade planet location, operatives are forfeit = 0, operatives do not add to Force drains and your Force drains may not be reduced. Sleens do not cancel Force icons. Cannot be canceled.
front.lore: Jabba's decadent behavior makes him susceptible to deception. Leia and Lando exploited this weakness, posing as Jabba's kind of scum.

front.title: •Ounee Ta (V)
front.gametext: Plays on table. While you occupy a Renegade planet location, operatives are forfeit = 0, operatives do not add to Force drains and your Force drains may not be reduced. Sleens do not cancel Force icons. Cannot be canceled.
front.lore: Jabba's decadent behavior makes him susceptible to deception. Leia and Lando exploited this weakness, posing as Jabba's kind of scum.

front.title: •Our Most Desperate Hour
front.gametext: Deploy on Alderaan. Target one Rebel at Tatooine. When Target reaches Utinni Effect, retrieve one lost Force for each Force-Attuned character you have on table, two for each Force-Sensitive or Jedi. Lose Utinni Effect.
front.lore: Following her father Bail Organa's instructions, Leia placed the Death Star plans into R2-D2, hoping that they could be delivered safely to Alderaan by Obi-Wan Kenobi.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Our Most Desperate Hour (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on Leia of ability < 4.  Leia moves for free, is power and defense value +2, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise, and, if she has spy skill, Rebels may deploy -1 here (to a minimum of 1).  If Leia about to be lost, place her and this Effect in Used Pile instead. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Following her father Bail Organa's instructions, Leia placed the Death Star plans into R2-D2, hoping that they could be delivered safely to Alderaan by Obi-Wan Kenobi.

front.title: •Our Only Hope
front.gametext: USED: If your Rebel of ability > 2 just won a battle or duel, randomly take into hand one card stacked on Insignificant Rebellion. (Immune to Sense.)  LOST: If Luke is in battle (except with Vader), subtract 2 from each of opponent's battle destiny draws."
front.lore: 'The Emperor knew, as I did, if Anakin were to have any offspring, they would be a threat to him.'

front.title: •Our Only Hope (V)
front.gametext: If your [Death Star II] objective on table,USED: Deploy Luke from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR During your move phase, relocate Luke to a site opponent occupies.  LOST: If your Rebel of ability > 2 just won a battle or duel, take any one card into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle (if Rebel is Luke, may also retrieve any one card)."
front.lore: 'The Emperor knew, as I did, if Anakin were to have any offspring, they would be a threat to him.'

front.title: Out Of Commission
front.gametext: During your control phase, use 2 Force to release a starship held by any Tractor Beam. (Not effective on Death Star Tractor Beam if Central Core in play.) OR Randomly select one card from opponent's Lost Pile or Blaster Rack and place out of play.
front.lore: 'I hope that old man got the tractor beam out of commission or this is gonna be a real short trip.'

front.title: Out Of Commission & Transmission Terminated
front.gametext: USED: Use 1 Force to randomly place one card in opponents Lost Pile out of play.  LOST: Cancel one hologram. OR Use 4 Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 to destiny for each asteroid sector on table. If total destiny> 3, Imperial Holotable site is 'blown away' (opponent loses 4 Force)."

front.title: Out Of Nowhere
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle at a system or sector where you have a starship with maneuver > 3, use 1 Force to add one battle destiny.
front.lore: Black market sensor-stealth arrays can be used to hide starships from enemy sensor scans. Stellar interference can naturally shield a starship for surprise attacks.

front.title: Out of Nowhere (V)
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to target a system or planet site. For remainder of turn you may deploy there even without presence or Force icons (Immune to Sense).  If you just deployed a non-Jedi character or starship to a location opponent occupies, take any one card from your Used Pile into hand; reshuffle.
front.lore: Black market sensor-stealth arrays can be used to hide starships from enemy sensor scans. Stellar interference can naturally shield a starship for surprise attacks.

front.title: •Out Of Somewhere
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle with more than double your total power, search your Reserve Deck. Any one character you find there may deploy as a 'react' (at normal use of the Force). Reshuffle.
front.lore: When the ghost-like image of Obi-Wan failed to appear, another came out of the light to rescue Luke.

front.title: •Out Of Somewhere (V)
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy (or retrieve) Lando from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR If a battle just initiated, and your Lando defending alone at a site, his forfeit cannot be reduced, he adds one destiny to power (add 1 for each character and vehicle present), and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: When the ghost-like image of Obi-Wan failed to appear, another came out of the light to rescue Luke.

front.title: <>Outpost
front.gametext: Light: : May not deploy to Bespin, Coruscant, Dantooine, Kessel or Tatooine. Once per game, may deploy a device (except a comlink) or Effect that deploys on a character here.

front.title: •Outrider
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 1 passenger. Utinni Effects which retrieve Force are immune to Alter, but are placed out of play when completed. While Dash or Leebo piloting, immune to attrition< 4.
front.lore: Highly modified Corellian Engineering Corporation YT-2400. KonGar KGDefender military grade ion engines. Griffyn/Y2TG hyperdrive. Never boarded by Imperial customs.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
combo: Outrider + Dash Rendar + Moving To Attack Position

front.title: •Overseer
front.gametext: May add Harc as a pilot. During battle, adds one destiny to total power. If opponent just deployed a Dark Jedi or Sith to a related site, may deploy a related location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 4 (< 6 while at Bespin).
front.lore: Used to combat pirate activity in and around Cloud City. Top speed in atmosphere 1,150 kph. Hyperdrive installed by Bespin Motors.

cards.conceptBy: (Original Concept by Angelo Consoli - World Champion 2002)"

front.title: •Overseer
front.gametext: May add Harc as a pilot. During battle, adds one destiny to total power. If a Dark Jedi or Sith was just deployed to a related site, may deploy a related location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 4 (< 6 at Bespin).
front.lore: Used to combat pirate activity in and around Cloud City. Top speed in atmosphere 1,150 kph. Hyperdrive installed by Bespin Motors.

cards.conceptBy: (Original Concept by Angelo Consoli - World Champion 2002)"
pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Owen Lars
front.gametext: Deploys free at Lars' Moisture Farm. Power +2 if at same site as Beru Lars or a Vaporator. If lost from table during opponent's turn, Luke is power +3 until the end of your next turn.
front.lore: Guardian of Luke Skywalker. Husband of Beru Lars. Brother of Obi- Wan Kenobi. Farmer of moisture. Disapprover of Luke's desire to leave Tatooine.

front.title: •Owen Lars & •Beru Lars
front.gametext: Deploy free to Lars' Moisture Farm. Draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. If opponent has a Stormtrooper at a Tatooine site, you may not play Harvest. If lost during opponent's turn, Luke is power +6 until end of your next turn.
front.lore: Watchful guardians of Luke Skywalker. When the Lars' moisture farm was attacked by stormtroopers, Luke's life changed forever.

combo: Owen Lars & Beru Lars + Harvest + Luke
Owen Lars & Beru Lars + Harvest + Tatooine: Lars' Moisture Farm

front.title: •Owen Lars (V)
front.gametext: Opponent activates no Force from Beru Stew. While present with Lars' Vaporator: during your control phase, may use 3 Force to exchange one card from hand with one 'crop' card; cards with 'lightsaber' in title may not deploy here.
front.lore: Guardian of Luke Skywalker. Husband of Beru Lars. Brother of Obi- Wan Kenobi. Farmer of moisture. Disapprover of Luke's desire to leave Tatooine.

front.title: •Padme Naberrie
front.gametext: Twice per game may deploy Qui-Gon or Obi-Wan here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While present with your Jedi at a site, opponent may not target Amidala with weapons.
front.lore: Queen Amidala posed as one of her own handmaidens for added safety as well as to keep an eye on her Jedi protectors. Was to be protected by the Jedi at all times.

combo: Padme Naberrie + Jerus Jannick

front.title: •Padme Naberrie (AI)
front.gametext: Twice per game may deploy Qui-Gon or Obi-Wan here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While present with your Jedi at a site, opponent may not target Amidala with weapons.
front.lore: Queen Amidala posed as one of her own handmaidens for added safety as well as to keep an eye on her Jedi protectors. Was to be protected by the Jedi at all times.

front.title: •Padme Naberrie (V)
front.gametext: Adds 1 to power of anything she pilots.  During your control phase, if present at a battleground site, opponent loses 1 Force for each Skywalker occupying a battleground (-1 Force if Vader on table) and you may use 2 Force to take one Leia or non-Jedi Luke into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Queen Amidala posed as one of her own handmaidens for added safety as well as to keep an eye on her Jedi protectors. Was to be protected by the Jedi at all times.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Lee Clarke - CanCon 2005)

front.title: •Padme Naberrie (V)
front.gametext: Cancels Vader's game text here. If with a Skywalker, may add one destiny to attrition. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Queen Amidala posed as one of her own handmaidens for added safety as well as to keep an eye on her Jedi protectors. Was to be protected by the Jedi at all times.

combo: Padme Naberrie + Jerus Jannick

front.gametext: Adds 1 to power of anything she pilots. During your control phase, if present at a battleground site, opponent loses 1 Force for each Skywalker occupying a battleground (-1 Force if Vader on table) and you may use 2 Force to take one Leia or non-Jedi Luke into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Queen Amidala posed as one of her own handmaidens for added safety as well as to keep an eye on her Jedi protectors. Was to be protected by the Jedi at all times.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Lee Clarke - CanCon 2005)

front.title: •Padme Naberrie (V) (AI)
front.gametext: Cancels Vader's game text here. If with a Skywalker, may add one destiny to attrition. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Queen Amidala posed as one of her own handmaidens for added safety as well as to keep an eye on her Jedi protectors. Was to be protected by the Jedi at all times.

front.title: Palace Raider
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (or 3 to power of anything he drives). When driving a transport vehicle, it moves for free and he adds one battle destiny.
front.lore: Smugglers from many worlds are hunted by the Empire for providing arms and supplies to the Alliance. The Outer Rim is their refuge.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: Palace Raider (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Adds 3 to power of anything he drives. When driving a transport vehicle, it moves for free and he adds one battle destiny. [Reflections 3] Wipe Them Out, All of Them ignores your non-unique aliens.
front.lore: Smugglers from many worlds are hunted by the Empire for providing arms and supplies to the Alliance. The Outer Rim is their refuge.

front.title: Palace Raider (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. This character (and other Palace Raiders) are deploy -3 if You're A Slave? on table. While driving a vehicle, it is power +3, defense value +1, and moves for free.
front.lore: Smugglers from many worlds are hunted by the Empire for providing arms and supplies to the Alliance. The Outer Rim is their refuge.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Brian Fred)"
combo: Hunting Party + Sandwhirl First you spin them around, then you bag them.
Hunting Party + Skiffs As the missing people will be in the desert, most likely, you'll need some cheap, fast landspeed to shuttle your bounty hunters around in.

front.title: •Palejo Reshad
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While at Audience Chamber, all your Corellians are power and forfeit +1 (+2 if non-unique) and your Force generation at the Corellia system is +2.
front.lore: Corellian spice trader. Makes a large profit by selling spice in Jabba's court. Secretly uses part of the profit to help fund the Rebellion.

combo: Palejo Reshad + Corellia

front.title: •Panaka, Protector Of The Queen
front.gametext: Deploys for free to a Naboo site. While with Amidala at a Naboo site, opponent may not target Amidala with weapons. While on Naboo, immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Leader of the Royal Naboo security Forces. Fought alongside Amidala in order to capture Viceroy Nute Gunray.

combo: Panaka, Protector Of The Queen + Queen Amidala + We Don't Have Time For This If Amidala and Panaka are in a battle together, add two battle destiny.

front.title: •Panaka, Protector Of The Queen (AI)
front.gametext: Deploys for free to a Naboo site. While with Amidala at a Naboo site, opponent may not target Amidala with weapons. While on Naboo, immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Leader of the Royal Naboo security Forces. Fought alongside Amidala in order to capture Viceroy Nute Gunray.

front.title: •Panaka's Blaster
front.gametext: Deploy on Panaka. May target a character, creature, or vehicle for free. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +2 > defense value. When this blaster hits a character or vehicle in battle, your total power here is +3 for remainder of battle.
front.lore: Naboo blaster personally modified by Captain Panaka. Boosted by extra power packs that allow it to maintain sustained fire in tense situations.

combo: Panaka's Blaster + Captain Panaka + Crack Shot + Rebel Artillery If Panaka hits a character, the Dark Side will have to lose three Force and the character.

front.title: Panic
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle where opponent has more than double your power, reveal up to 3 cards from your Reserve Deck. Of those 3, deploy anywhere (for free) any characters, starships, vehicles, devices or weapons. Any others are lost.
front.lore: Cornered by Imperial troops, Han's gambler reflexes led him to do what comes naturally - attack! Surprise assaults work...sometimes.

front.title: Panic (V)
front.gametext: Take a device or a non-lightsaber weapon into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR If opponent just initiated a battle or Force drain at a system or sector, deploy (as a 'react') an unpiloted Rebel starfighter and a pilot of ability < 3 (simultaneously) on table from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: Cornered by Imperial troops, Han's gambler reflexes led him to do what comes naturally - attack! Surprise assaults work...sometimes.

front.title: •Paploo
front.gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each light side icon at same Endor site. May pilot only speeder bikes. Once during each of your control phases, may take one Free Ride into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Ewok scout. Son of Warok. Brave, adventurous thief. Stole an Imperial speeder bike to create a diversion. 'Not bad for a little furball.'

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.title: •Paploo (V)
front.gametext: While on Endor, Perimeter Patrol is suspended. Once per game, if in battle with a speeder bike (or two scouts), may relocate Paploo and one opponent's character of ability < 4 present with him (unless either are 'hit') to an adjacent site.
front.lore: Ewok scout. Son of Warok. Brave, adventurous thief. Stole an Imperial speeder bike to create a diversion. 'Not bad for a little furball.'

front.title: •Part Of The Tribe
front.gametext: Deploy on your non-aliens, non-Jedi character. When deployed, choose a species of an alien here. Character gains that species. Aliens of that species may deploy (for -1 Force if non-unique) or move here as a 'react'. While on Endor, adds one [Light Side Force] icon.
front.lore: Wookiees are known to be creatures of great emotion and are very protective of family and friends. Chewbacca has come to treat Luke as a member of his own family.

front.title: •Path Of Least Resistance
front.gametext: Cancel Rite of Passage. OR Relocate one of your characters at an interior mobile site to a related interior mobile site.
front.lore: Yoda didn't say anything bad about taking the 'quick and easy corridor.'

front.title: •Path Of Least Resistance & •Revealed
front.gametext: Place one opponent's Undercover spy in opponent's Used Pile. OR If opponent has no presence or Force icons, return spy to hand. Any Force used to deploy spy remains used and that card may not deploy this turn. OR Relocate one of your characters at an interior mobile site to a related interior mobile site.

front.title: Patrol Craft
front.gametext: Power +1 or Coruscant of Bespin. May add 1 driver and 1 passenger. May deploy or move as a 'react.' At cloud sectors, may move and be targeted by weapons like a starfighter.
front.lore: Small, lightly armed, enclosed vehicle widely used throughout the galaxy. Sometimes used as a pleasure craft by wealthy eccentrics.

front.title: Perimeter Scan
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to glance at any one card which is face-down at a location. OR Use 1 Force to glance at opponent's hand. You may move each droid spy and Infantry Mine you find there to opponent's Used Pile. OR Cancel Probe Telemetry.
front.lore: 'It's a good bet the Empire knows we're here.'

combo: Perimeter Scan + Wyron Serper Add 2 to the destiny of this card.

front.title: Perimeter Scan (V)
front.gametext: If two related unique (•) sites are on table, deploy the related system from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Peek at a face down card on table. OR If a character or starship's power was just reduced, reset that card's power to its printed power for remainder of turn.
front.lore: 'It's a good bet the Empire knows we're here.'

front.title: Perimeter Scan (V)
front.gametext: USED: Play a Defensive Shield from under your Starting Effect. OR Target opponent's just-deployed [Maintenance] card. Target may not battle (or allow opponent to deploy cards from Reserve Deck) for remainder of turn. (Immune to Sense.)LOST: Cancel Trample (unless targeting an Undercover spy)."
front.lore: 'It's a good bet the Empire knows we're here.'

cards.counterpart: Turn It Off! Turn It Off! (V)

front.title: •Phantom
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 2 passengers. May deploy (with a pilot) or move as a 'react' to same system as a Rebel starship. When with Ghost, adds one destiny to total power.
front.lore: Phoenix Squadron.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Phylo Gandish
front.gametext: Deploys for free at a docking bay. Adds 2 to the power of anything she pilots. While at opponent's docking bay, adds 2 to your Force drains there, and your other characters there are defense value +1 and immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Good-natured former pilot whose family owns a galactic transportation company. Years of travel has her to learn many loopholes in spaceport protocol.

front.title: •Phylo Gandish (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots.  If opponent's [Virtual Block 6] card just added a destiny to total power or attrition here, draw two destiny, choose one, and subtract it from their attrition and total power.  Your characters here are immune to You Are Beaten and attrition < 3.
front.lore: Good-natured former pilot whose family owns a galactic transportation company. Years of travel has her to learn many loopholes in spaceport protocol.

front.title: •Planet Defender Ion Cannon
front.gametext: Deploy on an exterior Rebel Base site. During a battle at related system, may target a capital starship there using 2 Force. Draw destiny. If destiny +3 > armor, all starship weapons aboard target are lost, power = 0 and hyperspeed = 0.
front.lore: KDY v-150 surface-to-space heavy ion cannon. The most powerful ground-based weapon in the Rebel arsenal. Reserved for strategic installations due to limited supply.

front.title: •Planet Defender Ion Cannon (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on an exterior site.  May target a capital starship (except Executor) at related system for free.  Draw two destiny.  If total destiny > defense value, target is power and hyperspeed = 0 (if target forfeited this battle, may place this weapon out of play to steal it into your hand).
front.lore: KDY v-150 surface-to-space heavy ion cannon. The most powerful ground-based weapon in the Rebel arsenal. Reserved for strategic installations due to limited supply.

front.title: •Planetary Defenses
front.gametext: Plays on any interior site. This location may not be targeted by Proton Bombs.
front.lore: Key installations are protected from bombardment by a complex network of early-warning sensors, emergency shields and fast-response fighters.

front.title: •Planetary Defenses (V)
front.gametext: Plays on any site. This location may not be targeted by Proton Bombs.  Death Star sites are immune to Expand The Empire.  Unless Death Star: Docking Bay 327 on table, Commence Primary Ignition is canceled.
front.lore: Key installations are protected from bombardment by a complex network of early-warning sensors, emergency shields and fast-response fighters.

front.title: •Planetary Defenses (V)
front.gametext: Plays on any site. This location may not be targeted by Proton Bombs. Cancels Program Trap here. Unless Death Star: Docking Bay 327 on table, Commence Primary Ignition is canceled.
front.lore: Key installations are protected from bombardment by a complex network of early-warning sensors, emergency shields and fast-response fighters.

front.title: •Planetary Shiel
front.gametext: If Center of Tyranny on table, deploy on Coruscant. Once during your control phase, if you occupy Main Power Plant, may draw destiny. If destiny >5, Planetary Shield 'disabled' (place this device out of play; opponent loses 3 Force). May not be lost.
front.lore: Key installations are protected from bombardment by a complex network of early-warning sensors, emergency shields and fast-response fighters.

front.title: •Plastoid Armor
front.gametext: Deploy on a Death Star site where a stormtrooper was just lost. Target one of your characters not on Death Star. When target reaches Utinni Effect, relocate to target. Target is now 'disguised:' gains spy skill, power and forfeit +2, and armor = 5.
front.lore: Luke and Han took the armor suits from fallen stormtroopers and used them as both protection and disguise to penetrate the detention cell block aboard the Death Star.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Plastoid Armor (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on your non-droid character. Your Interrupts with 'back' in title are destiny = 5 and are Used Interrupts. Your characters are immune to Bad Feeling Have I. During opponent's move phase, may take an Interrupt with 'back' in title into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Luke and Han took the armor suits from fallen stormtroopers and used them as both protection and disguise to penetrate the detention cell block aboard the Death Star.

front.title: •Plea To The Court
front.gametext: Deploy on table. If no senator here, you may place a senator here from hand to cancel an opponent's Force drain. If a justice agenda here, during a battle where opponent has a weapon and you do not, may cancel a just drawn weapon destiny to cause a re-draw.
front.lore: Amidala did not hold much hope in the options she had. Regardless of how limited the choices, she had to choose one path to try and avert disaster befalling Naboo.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
cancels: A just drawn weapon destiny to cause a redraw

front.title: Plead My Case To The Senate / Sanity And Compassion
front.gametext: Plead My Case To The Senate:Deploy Galactic Senate and any other [Episode I] location.For remainder of game, Rebel and Imperial leaders of ability < 4 are politics +2. Counter Assault and Surprise Assault are canceled. You may deploy cards on your Political Effects to table. At Galactic Senate, weapon destiny draws are -6, creatures are lost and game text of non-Republic characters is canceled.{Flip} this card if you have 3 senators (or 2 senators, at least one with a peace agenda) at Galactic Senate.Sanity And Compassion:{While} this side up, once during your control phase may use 3 Force to place up to two random cards from opponent's hand into their Used Pile. Once per turn may take a Political Effect into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Your senators are destiny +2 (or +3 for any character with an order agenda) when drawn for battle or weapon destiny. May use 2 Force at end of a turn to place all cards on your Political Effects into Used Pile.{Flip} this card if you have less than two senators at Galactic Senate.

back.title: Plead My Case To The Senate / Sanity And Compassion
back.gametext: Plead My Case To The Senate:Deploy Galactic Senate and any other [Episode I] location.For remainder of game, Rebel and Imperial leaders of ability < 4 are politics +2. Counter Assault and Surprise Assault are canceled. You may deploy cards on your Political Effects to table. At Galactic Senate, weapon destiny draws are -6, creatures are lost and game text of non-Republic characters is canceled.{Flip} this card if you have 3 senators (or 2 senators, at least one with a peace agenda) at Galactic Senate.Sanity And Compassion:{While} this side up, once during your control phase may use 3 Force to place up to two random cards from opponent's hand into their Used Pile. Once per turn may take a Political Effect into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Your senators are destiny +2 (or +3 for any character with an order agenda) when drawn for battle or weapon destiny. May use 2 Force at end of a turn to place all cards on your Political Effects into Used Pile.{Flip} this card if you have less than two senators at Galactic Senate.

front.title: •Plo Koon
front.gametext: Deploys only to Jedi Council Chamber. While at Jedi Council Chamber, immune to attrition and, once per turn if a weapon or battle destiny was just drawn, may cancel and cause a re-draw.
front.lore: Kel Dor Jedi Council member descended from a long line of Jedi. Known for exceptional sensory skills, Plo Koon's control of the Force is unmatched by most.

combo: Plo Koon + Depa Billaba + Jedi Council Chamber
Plo Koon + Are You Brain Dead?!
cancels: A weapon or battle destiny draw to cause a redraw

front.title: •Plo Koon (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Once per game, may deploy a weapon here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While piloting, may battle regardless of objective restrictions. If a battle was just initiated here, may place your weapon here in Used Pile to make all non-vehicle weapon destiny draws -1.
front.lore: Kel Dor Jedi Council member descended from a long line of Jedi. Known for exceptional sensory skills, Plo Koon's control of the Force is unmatched by most.

front.title: •Plo Koon (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Deploys -2 to same location as Ahsoka (or vice versa). Once per turn, may lose top card of Force Pile to make your character (or piloted [Episode I] starfighter) here forfeit +2 and immune to attrition for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Kel Dor Jedi Council member descended from a long line of Jedi. Known for exceptional sensory skills, Plo Koon's control of the Force is unmatched by most.

front.title: •Podrace Prep
front.gametext: LOST: Instead of drawing race destiny, use a card from hand.  STARTING: Deploy Podrace Arena (with a Podracer, opponent may also deploy a Podracer there), Boonta Eve Podrace and any Effect that deploys for free. Place Interrupt in Reserve Deck."
front.lore: Advanced preparation in Podracing is usually the key to winning. A little extra work at the start can mean a lot in the long run.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Poe Dameron
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. Deploy -1 to Jakku. When piloting, adds one battle destiny. Anything he pilots is immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Leader.

front.title: Polarized Negative Power Coupling
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Turn every Used Pile face up. All subsequent cards placed in Used Piles are also turned face up. (Players must commit to using cards before revealing them.) Turn used cards face down whenever they are re-circulated.
front.lore: Imbalance in a converter's inverse energy field can improperly polarize the negative axis, causing hyperdrive failure. Replacement often requires an inverted engineer.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Polarized Negative Power Coupling (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Whenever a player plays a Used Interrupt, their opponent may stack it here. Either player may use 2 Force to place a card here in owner's Used Pile or may lose 2 Force to place a card here in owner's Lost Pile.
front.lore: Imbalance in a converter's inverse energy field can improperly polarize the negative axis, causing hyperdrive failure. Replacement often requires an inverted engineer.

front.title: •Pops
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Gold 5, also adds 1 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: Piloted Gold 5 at Battle of Yavin. Real name Davish Krail. Veteran pilot. Flew fighters for two decades. Wingman of Gold Leader.

front.title: Portable Fusion Generator
front.gametext: Deploy on any warrior. When that warrior fires a blaster rifle or artillery weapon, adds 1 to each of that weapon's destiny draws. Also, may add 1 to power of one droid present.
front.lore: Lardanis Survival Systems MFCR-200 Power Generator. Used by smugglers and Rebel agents. Highly portable. Powers and charges a wide range of equipment.

front.title: Portable Scanner
front.gametext: Deploy on your Rebel. Adds 2 to your search party destiny draws where present. Also, once during each of your control phases, may take one device or weapon (except a lightsaber) into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Cryoncorp EnhanceScan general-purpose scanner. 1,500-meter lifeform detection range. Motion sensor and metal detection sensors optimized for up to 500 meters.

front.title: Power Harpoon
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your combat or shuttle vehicle. May target an AT-AT or AT-ST for 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target crashes if destiny + your vehicle's maneuver > 8. Your vehicle crashes if destiny = 0.
front.lore: High-powered harpoon attached to a retractable flexi-steel tow cable and fusion-head disk designed by Beryl Chiffonage as a reserve defense against Imperial AT-ATs.

combo: Power Harpoon + Cloud Car

front.title: •Power Pivot
front.gametext: If your piloted starship armed with a starship weapon is in a battle, lose 1 Force to reduce the power of one opponent's starship in that battle to zero. OR Place one opponent's starship just 'hit' in Lost Pile.
front.lore: Using lateral thrusters, an X-wing can suddenly change direction, rotating around to fire at a pursuing ship.

front.title: •Precise Hit
front.gametext: USED: During a battle at a system or sector, instead of firing one of your starship weapons at a target, reduce that target's power by 4 until end of turn.  LOST: During a battle at a system or sector, use 3 Force to cancel one battle destiny just drawn."
front.lore: 'Luke, trust me.'

cancels: One battle destiny in a battle at a system or sector

front.title: •Precise Hit (V)
front.gametext: USED: If you just hit a target with a non-lightsaber non-[Permanent Weapon] weapon, may place target (and all cards on it) in owner's Used Pile.  LOST: Target a Heroic character or starship. It loses Heroic and/or immunity to attrition, if any, this turn."
front.lore: 'Luke, trust me.'

front.title: •Princess Leia
front.gametext: May only deploy on Hoth or Cloud City. Adds 1 to power of anything she pilots. May deploy (on Hoth or Cloud City) or move as a 'react' to same site as Han or Luke. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Prominent leader in the struggling Alliance. Former member of the Imperial Senate. Beginning to discover her true heritage. Likes scoundrels.

combo: Princess Leia + Reflection + Great Warrior
Princess Leia +
Princess Leia + Jerus Jannick
Princess Leia + Warrior's Courage Add two battle destinies if Leia is defending a battle alone at a site.

front.title: •Princess Leia (V)
front.gametext: May deploy or move as a 'react' to same site as an Imperial. Adds one battle destiny if with Han or Vader. During your deploy phase, may deploy one Leia Of Alderaan, Reflection, or a matching blaster on Leia from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Prominent leader in the struggling Alliance. Former member of the Imperial Senate. Beginning to discover her true heritage. Likes scoundrels.

front.title: •Princess Leia (V)
front.gametext: Leia's deploy cost may not be modified by opponent. Adds one battle destiny if with Han or Vader. May move as a 'react' to same site as an Imperial. Once per turn, may deploy Leia Of Alderaan or Reflection from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Prominent leader in the struggling Alliance. Former member of the Imperial Senate. Beginning to discover her true heritage. Likes scoundrels.

front.title: •Princess Leia Organa
front.gametext: * Deploys free as an escorted captive of Jabba, or a bounty hunter (you may not initiate battle there on the same turn). While a captive, opponent's unique (•) aliens at same site are forfeit -2. If released, retrieve 5 Force. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Captured by Jabba. Princess Leia provided a distraction for his henchbeings. Waiting for the first chance to escape. Really made Jabba's tail wiggle.

combo: Princess Leia Organa replacing another Leia
Princess Leia Organa (captive) + Luke Skywalker + Anakin's Lightsaber
Princess Leia Organa + Jerus Jannick

front.title: •Princess Leia Organa (V)
front.gametext: * Deploys free only as an escorted captive of Jabba or a bounty hunter. Your Strangle destiny draws are +1. 'Escort alone' on Strangle is treated as 'escort'. When released, escort is lost and you may retrieve any three cards (except Strangle).
front.lore: Captured by Jabba. Princess Leia provided a distraction for his henchbeings. Waiting for the first chance to escape. Really made Jabba's tail wiggle.

front.title: •Princess Leia, Lost Scion
front.gametext: While present at a battleground, Their Fire Has Gone Out Of The Universe flips and may not flip back.  While armed with Anakin's Lightsaber, her forfeit may not be reduced.  Immune to attrition < 4.

front.title: •Princess Organa
front.gametext: While at a Rebel Base location, subtracts 1 from opponent's Force drains at related locations. Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one Leia Of Alderaan, Reflection or leader of ability < 3 to same location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Adopted by Bail Organa. Former senator of Alderaan. Natural leader. Helped steal the Death Star plans. A key figure in the Rebel Alliance.

combo: Princess Organa + Jerus Jannick
Princess Organa + Warrior's Courage Add two battle destinies if Leia is defending a battle alone at a site.

front.title: •Prisoner 2187
front.gametext: Deploys only if Rescue The Princess on table. May not be transferred while imprisoned. Adds 2 to your Force drains here. For remainder of game, your objective cannot be placed out of play and, if Leia not on table, flip Sometimes I Amaze Even Myself.
front.lore: Princess Leia Organa. Alderaanian senator. Targeted by Vader for capture and interrogation. The Dark Lord of the Sith wanted her alive.

front.title: •Profundity
front.gametext: Deploys -2 to a system opponent occupies (-4 if opponent's system). May add 6 pilots, 8 passengers, 3 starfighters, 3 vehicles, and 1 corvette. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2.

front.title: ••Projection Of A Skywalker
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Your Force drains are +1 at holosites and opponent must lose an additional 1 Force to draw a card with Shot In The Dark. (Immune to Alter.) OR Deploy on any planet site. Opponent's Force drains are -1 here.
front.lore: 'Greetings, Exalted One. Allow me to introduce myself. I am Luke Skywalker, Jedi Knight and friend to Captain Solo.' Hologram.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Projection Of A Skywalker + a holosite

front.title: •Prophecy Of The Force
front.gametext: Deploy on a site. While at a battleground, adds one [Dark Side Force] icon and one [Light Side Force] icon here. Once per turn, if a player just Force drained at a site with total ability > 5, relocate this Effect to that site. Once per game, may retrieve a card with 'Anakin' in title into hand. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The turning of Vader and the loss of Palpatine was the beginning of a new era for the entire galaxy.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Protector
front.gametext: If Leia and Chewie are in a battle together, you may add two battle destiny. OR If Leia is participating in a battle, you may lose Chewie from hand to satisfy all battle damage and attrition against you. OR Cancel I'd Just As Soon Kiss A Wookiee or Frustration.
front.lore: 'Chewie, this won't help me. Hey! Save your strength. There'll be another time. The princess...you have to take care of her.'

combo: Leia + Han + Chewie + Obi-Wan + Luke + Skywalkers + Don't Get Cocky + Protector + Gift Of The Mentor + Rug Hug
cancels: I'd Just As Soon Kiss A Wookiee

front.title: •Protector (V)
front.gametext: USED: Raise your converted Kashyyyk system to the top. (Immune to Sense.)  STARTING: If Kashyyyk was your starting location, deploy from Reserve Deck Forest Depths, Grrrghrrrgh!, and up to two Effects that are always [Immune to Alter]. Place this Interrupt in hand."
front.lore: 'Chewie, this won't help me. Hey! Save your strength. There'll be another time. The princess...you have to take care of her.'

front.title: Proton Torpedoes
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your X-wing, Y-wing or B-wing. May target a starship using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Powerful ballistic projectiles. Carries proton-scattering energy warheads. Short range. Pierces energy shields, but blocked by particle shields.

pulledBy: Lieutenant s'Too Vees (when at a docking bay)
combo: Proton Torpedoes + Take This!

front.title: Proton Torpedoes
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your N-1 starfighter. May target a starship using 1 Force. Draw Destiny. Target hit if destiny > defense value. While on Bravo Fighter and you are attempting to 'blow away' Blockade Flagship, adds 2 to your total.
front.lore: Mainstay weapon of Naboo Defense Fighters. Anakin Skywalker used them to surprising effect, as soon as he found the trigger.

pulledBy: Lieutenant s'Too Vees (when at a docking bay)
combo: Proton Torpedoes (EP1) + Take This!

front.title: •Pucumir Thryss
front.gametext: While on Cloud City, adds 1 to your Force drains at Cloud City sites and adds 4 to destiny of each of your miners drawn for battle destiny. During your deploy phase, may deploy one non-unique Rebel to same Cloud City site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Former gas miner. One of the Rebellion's contacts on Cloud City before it was taken over by the Empire. Wishes to return to Bespin and retake the floating city.

pulls: One non-unique Rebel to same Cloud City site

front.title: •Pulsar Skate
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 6 passengers. May add ability of your (•) unique smuggler aboard to X on Kessel Run targeting that smuggler. When Booster, Mirax or Wedge piloting, Immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Owned by legendary Terrik family of smugglers. Used to chase down the pirates who killed Wedge's parents. On Corellian Security's most wanted list. 37.5 meters long.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
combo: Pulsar Skate + Mirax Terrik + Moving To Attack Position

front.title: •Punch It!
front.gametext: If Han or your Lando is piloting a starfighter which is defending a battle at a system, add one battle destiny (add two if starfighter is Falcon). Also, starfighter is immune to attrition for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Ever since Lando's 'little' maneuver at the Battle of Taanab, his piloting skills had become legendary.

combo: Captain Han Solo + Luke + Falcon + Punch It! + Out of Nowhere + Don't Get Cocky

front.title: •Put That Down
front.gametext: If one of your characters was just targeted by a weapon during battle, use 3 Force to cancel that targeting. OR Cancel Double Back or Res Luk Ra'auf.
front.lore: Lord Vader interceded between the trigger happy mercenary and his target.

cancels: Targeting of a character by a weapon

front.title: •Put That Down (V)
front.gametext: If your character or starship is about to be captured or lost during the weapons segment of a battle, it is hit instead and may not be captured or lost until the damage segment. OR If opponent just played an Interrupt during battle, activate 2 Force.
front.lore: Lord Vader interceded between the trigger happy mercenary and his target.

front.title: •Put That Down (V)
front.gametext: If your character or starship is about to be captured or lost during the weapons segment of a battle, it is hit instead and may not be captured or lost until the damage segment. OR If opponent just played an Interrupt during battle, activate 2 Force.
front.lore: Lord Vader interceded between the trigger happy mercenary and his target.

front.title: Quad Laser Cannon
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your Corellian Corvette or Falcon. May target a starship using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 if targeting a starfighter. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Starship blaster, often slung in turret mounts to take advantage of light weight and quick targeting motions. Installed on many starships including the Millennium Falcon.

pulledBy: Lieutenant s'Too Vees (when at a docking bay)

front.title: •Queen Amidala
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Naboo. Amidala and your other Republic characters present are defense value +2, and immune to You Are Beaten, Sniper, and attrition < 3.
front.lore: Leader. Amidala was only twelve when she was elected Princess of Theed. Now at age fourteen, she is Naboo's Queen, and the savior of her planet.

combo: Queen Amidala + Jerus Jannick
Queen Amidala + Panaka, Protector Of The Queen While Panaka is with Amidala at a Naboo site, opponent may not target Amidala with weapons. Panaka deploys free to a Naboo site.
Queen Amidala + Panaka, Protector Of The Queen + We Don't Have Time For This If Amidala and Panaka are in a battle together, add two battle destiny.

front.title: •Queen Amidala (AI)
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Naboo. Amidala and your other Republic characters present are defense value +2, and immune to You Are Beaten, Sniper, and attrition < 3.
front.lore: Leader. Amidala was only twelve when she was elected Princess of Theed. Now at age fourteen, she is Naboo's Queen, and the savior of her planet.

front.title: •Queen Amidala, Ruler Of Naboo
front.gametext: Agendas: justice, peace. While in a senate majority, once during your control phase, may retrieve 1 Force for each Naboo site you control. May be placed on your Political Effect instead of a senator. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Naboo leader. Frustrated by the Trade Federation's control of her planet, Amidala came to the Senate to plead her case in person.

combo: Queen Amidala, Ruler Of Naboo + I Will Not Defer
Queen Amidala, Ruler Of Naboo + Supreme Chancellor Valorum
Queen Amidala, Ruler Of Naboo + Jerus Jannick

front.title: •Queen Amidala, Ruler Of Naboo (AI)
front.gametext: Agendas: justice, peace. While in a senate majority, once during your control phase, may retrieve 1 Force for each Naboo site you control. May be placed on your Political Effect instead of a senator. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Naboo leader. Frustrated by the Trade Federation's control of her planet, Amidala came to the Senate to plead her case in person.

front.title: •Queen's Royal Starship
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 5 passengers. Weapons may not deploy on this starship. While Ric piloting, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise, and immune to Lateral Damage and attrition < 4.
front.lore: Chromium-plated, sleek transport ship used by the royalty of the Naboo. Spaceframe was designed around a J-type configuration.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Qui-Gon Jinn
front.gametext: Deploys -2 to Tatooine. Power +1 at same site as Maul. Once during a duel Qui-Gon is in, may cancel a duel destiny just drawn and cause a redraw. Opponent's aliens are power -1 at same site. Immune to attrition.
front.lore: Accepted Obi-Wan Kenobi as his Padawan learner. Was given orders to protect Queen Amidala at all costs.

combo: Qui-Gon Jinn + A Jedi's Patience
cancels: A duel destiny to cause a redraw

front.title: •Qui-Gon Jinn (AI)
front.gametext: Deploys -2 to Tatooine. Power +1 at same site as Maul. Once during a duel Qui-Gon is in, may cancel a duel destiny just drawn and cause a redraw. Opponent's aliens are power -1 at same site. Immune to attrition.
front.lore: Accepted Obi-WanObi-Wan in Radiant VII  Kenobi as his Padawan learner. Was given orders to protect Queen Amidala at all costs.

front.title: •Qui-Gon Jinn With Lightsaber
front.gametext: Adds one battle destiny if with Maul. Permanent weapon is •Qui-Gon Jinn's Lightsaber (may target a character or creature for free; draw two destiny; target 'hit,' and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value).
front.lore: Jedi Master assigned to reveal the mysteries of the Sith. His quest has led him to the planet Naboo

combo: Qui-Gon Jinn With Lightsaber + Are You Brain Dead?!
Qui-Gon Jinn With Lightsaber + A Jedi's Resilience

front.title: •Qui-Gon Jinn, Jedi Master
front.gametext: Deploys -2 to Naboo. Qui-Gon's game text may not be canceled. When Qui-Gon wins a lightsaber combat, adds 2 to opponent's Force loss. Once per game, may lose 2 Force to deploy a lightsaber on Qui-Gon from Lost Pile. Immune to attrition.
front.lore: Jedi Master ordered by the Jedi Council to return to Naboo to seek out the mysterious 'dark warrior' that he had encountered on Tatooine.

pulls: A lightsaber from Lost Pile to deploy on him

front.title: •Qui-Gon Jinn's Lightsaber
front.gametext: Deploy on Qui-Gon. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Qui-Gon was forced to defend himself when Darth Maul tracked them down on Tatooine. He was barely able to escape, in order to fight another day.

pulledBy: Jedi Master when lightsaber is in Lost Pile

front.title: •Qui-Gon Jinn's Lightsaber (AI)
front.gametext: Deploy on Qui-Gon. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Qui-Gon was forced to defend himself when Darth Maul tracked them down on Tatooine. He was barely able to escape, in order to fight another day.

front.title: •Qui-Gon's Lightsaber
front.gametext: Deploy on Qui-Gon or [Episode I] Obi-Wan. Adds 1 to this character's lightsaber combat total. May target a character for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and it forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value (if hit target is a Dark Jedi, opponent also loses 1 Force).
front.lore: This lightsaber bore silent witness to the death of two great warriors in the same day. One a Jedi, one a Sith.

pulledBy: Jedi Master when lightsaber is in Lost Pile

front.title: Quick Draw
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Once during each of your draw phases, you may use 2 Force to search your Lost Pile. Take any one blaster you find there and immediately deploy it (for free).
front.lore: It's high noon on Dagobah, his droid's reined in and Luke's got a fistful of credits.

pulls: Any one blaster from Lost Pile
pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Quick Draw (V)
front.gametext: Unless Inner Strength on table, deploy on table.  Your lightsabers may target vehicles using 1 Force (each destiny draw is -2).  Once per turn, may lose 1 Force to deploy a character weapon (except a grenade) from Lost Pile.  Once per turn, may deploy [Virtual Block 1] Sai'torr Kal Fas from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: It's high noon on Dagobah, his droid's reined in and Luke's got a fistful of credits.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Lee Edwards - Florida State Winner 2004)

front.title: Quiet Mining Colony / Independent Operation
front.gametext: Quiet Mining Colony:Deploy Bespin system and one Cloud City battleground site.{While} this side up, once during each of your deploy phases, may use 1 Force to deploy a site (or cloud sector) to Bespin from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Opponent loses no more than 1 Force from each of your Force drains at Bespin locations.{Flip} this card if opponent controls no Bespin locations and you control Bespin: Cloud City and at least two Cloud City sites (one if Lando or Lobot on Cloud City).{Place} out of play if Bespin is 'blown away'Independent Operation:{While} this side up, your aliens, cloud cars and [Independent Starship] starships are immune to attrition < 4. At each Bespin location you control with an alien, your Force drains may not be modified or canceled by opponent. Your [Independent Starship] starships are deploy -1. Once during each of your deploy phases, you may deploy one docking bay from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if opponent controls Bespin system (or three Cloud City sites and/or Bespin cloud sectors).{Place} out of play if Bespin is 'blown away'.

back.title: Quiet Mining Colony / Independent Operation
back.gametext: Quiet Mining Colony:Deploy Bespin system and one Cloud City battleground site.{While} this side up, once during each of your deploy phases, may use 1 Force to deploy a site (or cloud sector) to Bespin from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Opponent loses no more than 1 Force from each of your Force drains at Bespin locations.{Flip} this card if opponent controls no Bespin locations and you control Bespin: Cloud City and at least two Cloud City sites (one if Lando or Lobot on Cloud City).{Place} out of play if Bespin is 'blown away'Independent Operation:{While} this side up, your aliens, cloud cars and [Independent Starship] starships are immune to attrition < 4. At each Bespin location you control with an alien, your Force drains may not be modified or canceled by opponent. Your [Independent Starship] starships are deploy -1. Once during each of your deploy phases, you may deploy one docking bay from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if opponent controls Bespin system (or three Cloud City sites and/or Bespin cloud sectors).{Place} out of play if Bespin is 'blown away'.

front.title: Quite A Mercenary
front.gametext: If Elis Helrot just completed a transport, use 2 Force. Elis and all character transported are lost. (Immune to Sense.) OR Prevent a just deployed smuggler from moving this turn.
front.lore: Smugglers and other rogues frequent spaceports along trade routes. 'Your friend is quite a mercenary. I wonder if he really cares about anything, or anybody.'

cancels: Makes all characters transported by Elis Helrot lost

front.title: •R-3PO (Ar-Threepio)
front.gametext: Once each turn, during your control phase, for each opponent's spy present opponent must lose 1 Force (2 if spy is a droid or is Undercover, 4 if both).
front.lore: Designed as a response to the threat of Imperial espionage droids. Joins a droid pool and uncovers spies. Has tattoo reading 'Thank The Maker' on left posterior plating.

front.title: •R-3PO (Ar-Threepio) (V)
front.gametext: Destiny +1 when drawn for weapon or battle destiny. During your control phase, if with opponent's Undercover spy, opponent loses 2 Force (may not be reduced). If a spy here 'breaks cover' or is lost, may place R-3PO in Used Pile.
front.lore: Designed as a response to the threat of Imperial espionage droids. Joins a droid pool and uncovers spies. Has tattoo reading 'Thank The Maker' on left posterior plating.

front.title: •R-3PO (Ar-Threepio) (V)
front.gametext: Destiny +1 when drawn for weapon or battle destiny. During your control phase, if with opponent's Undercover spy, opponent loses 2 Force (may not be reduced). If a spy here 'breaks cover' or is lost, may place R-3PO in Used Pile.
front.lore: Designed as a response to the threat of Imperial espionage droids. Joins a droid pool and uncovers spies. Has tattoo reading 'Thank The Maker' on left posterior plating.

front.title: R2 Sensor Array
front.gametext: Deploy on any R-unit droid. Your character present may move as a 'react' from a creature attack. Also, adds 3 to search party destiny draws at same and adjacent sites.
front.lore: Popular R2 astromech accessory manufactured by Industrial Automation. Can monitor radiation levels and detect nearby lifeforms.

front.title: •R2-D2 & •C-3PO
front.gametext: If about to be leave table (even from Overwhelmed) from Tatooine system and Stolen Data Tapes deployed on this character, may instead be relocated to Dune Sea. Immune to A Gift, Firepower, devices, and opponent's Interrupts.
front.lore: Stranded in the Dune Sea, R2-D2 insisted on heading into rocky canyons where he thought settlements were likely to exist. Threepio had other ideas.

combo: R2-D2 & C-3PO + Chewie With Blaster Rifle Chewie With Blaster Rifle adds one battle destiny if with C-3PO.

front.title: •R2-D2 (Artoo-Detoo)
front.gametext: While aboard any starfighter, adds 2 to power, maneuver and hyperspeed (3 on Red 5). If at a Scomp link when opponent draws destiny of: 1-3, you may activate one Force; 4-6, you may draw top card from Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Fiesty. Loyal. Heroic. Insecure. Rebel spy. Excels at trouble. Incorrigible counterpart of a mindless philosopher. Has picked up a slight flutter. A bit eccentric.

combo: R2-D2 (Artoo-Detoo) + Double Agent
canceledBy: Game text canceled by Commander Praji

front.title: •R2-D2 (Artoo-Detoo) (V)
front.gametext: While aboard a starfighter, adds 2 to power, maneuver, and hyperspeed. While with a Scomp Link, adds one [Light Side Force] and, once per game, if about to be lost, may place in Used Pile. Immune to Fire Extinguisher and Restraining Bolt.
front.lore: Fiesty. Loyal. Heroic. Insecure. Rebel spy. Excels at trouble. Incorrigible counterpart of a mindless philosopher. Has picked up a slight flutter. A bit eccentric.

front.title: •R2-D2 (Artoo-Detoo) (V)
front.gametext: While present with a Scomp Link, adds one [Light Side] icon here. While aboard a starfighter, adds 2 to power, maneuver and hyperspeed. Immune to Fire Extinguisher.
front.lore: Fiesty. Loyal. Heroic. Insecure. Rebel spy. Excels at trouble. Incorrigible counterpart of a mindless philosopher. Has picked up a slight flutter. A bit eccentric.

combo: R2-D2 (Artoo-Detoo) (V) + Double Agent
canceledBy: Game text canceled by Commander Praji

front.title: •R2-D2, Subversive Droid
