front.gametext: Captured if an Imperial controls this site.  While present with a scomp link at a battleground (or mobile) site, your total power at adjacent sites is +2 and, once per turn, may use 1 Force to add or subtract 1 from opponent's just drawn destiny.
front.lore: Spy.

front.title: R2-X2 (Artoo-Extoo)
front.gametext: While aboard any starfighter, adds 1 to power, maneuver, and hyperspeed.
front.lore: Typical starfighter pilot assistant. Contains ten coordinates for hyperspace jumps. Built-in tools and computer interfaces. R2-X2 was assigned to Red 10 at Yavin Base.

front.title: •R3-A2 (Arthree-Aytoo)
front.gametext: When in battle aboard your capital starship at a system or sector, adds 1 to total attrition against opponent for each of your piloted starfighters present in that battle.
front.lore: Special-purpose astromech capable of coordinating piloting coordinates and approach angles during combat.

front.title: •R3-T2 (Arthree-Teetoo)
front.gametext: While aboard your capital starship, adds 1 to power and 2 to hyperspeed, and that starship is immune to attrition < 4. While at Central Core, Death Star requires +2 to move.
front.lore: Expanded memory capacity. Escaped from pirates based in Mos Eisley. Programmed with the ability to both enhance and sabotage hyperdrive systems.

front.title: R4-E1 (Arfour-Eeone)
front.gametext: While aboard a non-creature vehicle, adds 1 to power, maneuver and landspeed. May drive transport vehicles.
front.lore: One of numerous vehicle computer operation droids, manufactured by Industrial Automation. This unit, R4-E1, is a companion of BoShek. Rambunctious. Fiercely independent.

front.title: R5-D4 (Arfive-Defour)
front.gametext: While aboard any starship, adds 1 to power and maneuver. During your control phase, if aboard your starship damaged by an ion cannon, restores armor/maneuver and hyperspeed.
front.lore: Cheap astromech droid commonly referred to as 'Red.' Purposely blew his motivator to prevent splitting up R2-D2 and C-3PO on Tatooine. Poor navigator but skilled mechanic.

front.title: R5-M2 (Arfive-Emmtoo)
front.gametext: When aboard a capital starship, adds 1 to power and hyperspeed and that starship is immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Programmed to pilot sublight tactical courses. R5 units are in high demand for combat starships. R5-M2 helped plan evacuation routes from Echo Base. Owned by Shawn Valdez.

front.title: R5-M2 (Arfive-Emmtoo) (V)
front.gametext: Your capital starships are deploy -1 and are destiny +2 when drawn for weapon or battle destiny. Once per game, Shawn Valdez may deploy for free to same site.
front.lore: Programmed to pilot sublight tactical courses. R5 units are in high demand for combat starships. R5-M2 helped plan evacuation routes from Echo Base. Owned by Shawn Valdez.

front.title: RA-7 (Aray-Seven)
front.gametext: May transfer character weapons (for free) to or from your other characters present. May carry up to four such weapons at one time.
front.lore: The RA line of servant droids has fifth-degree primary programming. Low intelligence with capabilities for mental labor only. Common among nobles and high-ranking officials.

front.title: •Rabin
front.gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each Light side icon at same Endor site. Where present, may substitute for a character just selected to be attacked by a creature. When attacking or being attacked, power +2 and may add one destiny.
front.lore: Ewok. Tamer of beasts. Thief. Loner. Hunter. Survivor.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.title: Racing Skiff
front.gametext: May deploy with a non-unique alien driver as a 'react'. May add 1 driver and 3 passengers. May move as a 'react'. If lost, any characters aboard may 'jump off' (disembark).
front.lore: Repulsor lift skiffs are used by traders and merchants to safely cross the deserts of Tatooine. Young thrill seekers sometimes upgrade them with high-powered engines.

front.title: Radar Scanner
front.gametext: If you have at least one vehicle or starship on table, use 1 Force to glance at the cards in the opponent's hand for 10 seconds. You may move each Jawa (except Dathcha) and Tusken Raider you find there to opponent's Used Pile.
front.lore: Sensor on Luke's landspeeder. Many possible settings. Can scan for life forms, movement or concentrations of metal. Used for traffic control on settled worlds.

combo: Radar Scanner + Sensor Panel

front.title: •Radiant VII
front.gametext: May add 3 pilots and 3 passengers. Has ship-docking capability. While Madakor or Williams piloting, immune to Lateral Damage and attrition < 5.
front.lore: Optimized for diplomatic missions with sensor-proof pods that have ejection capabilities. Easily identified by its red coloration.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Radiant VII + Captain Madakor + Lieutenant Williams + I'll Take The Leader
Radiant VII + Captain Madakor + Lieutenant Williams + We Can Still Outmaneuver Them

front.title: •Rahm Kota, Blind Jedi
front.gametext: [Episode I] Jedi are lost. At battlegrounds, Insurgents are immune to attrition < 5. Once per turn, may peek at top card of your Reserve Deck (or if Galen on table, any Reserve Deck); may place that card on top of owners Used Pile. May not carry weapons.
front.lore: Insurgent leader.

front.title: •Raithal
front.gametext: Light: : If you control, all opponent's troopers are forfeit and destiny -1.

front.title: •Ralltiir
front.gametext: Light: : Your starships may move here as a 'react.'

front.title: Ralltiir Freighter Captain
front.gametext: Power +2 at a Ralltiir site. Adds 2 to power and 1 to maneuver of anything he pilots. When piloting a starship and Ralltiir on table, may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. When making a Kessel Run from Ralltiir, doubles X.
front.lore: After Ralltiir's fall to the Empire, many former members of its defense force became smugglers and scouts. Hoping to liberate their planet.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
combo: Ralltiir Freighter Captain + Kessel + Ralltiir

front.title: Ralltiir Operative
front.gametext: While at a Ralltiir site: adds 1 to your Force drains there, is forfeit +1 (and power +1 if your trooper is on Ralltiir) and, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one site to Ralltiir from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: During the Battle of Ralltiir, many Alliance soldiers participated in the defense of the planet from the Empire. Many of Ralltiir's population feel indebted to the Rebellion.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: •Rapid Deployment
front.gametext: At the beginning of your deploy phase, if you occupy an Endor or rebel base site, deploy up to 5 troopers there from Reserve Deck(those troopers deploy -1) and reshuffle. You may not deploy any other characters or starships this turn.
front.lore: General Solo's strike team was made up of the Alliance's finest ground troops.

pulls: Up to 5 Troopers at deploy cost -1

front.title: •Rapid Deployment (V)
front.gametext: Target a site. At same and related sites, Rebel scouts deploying from hand are deploy -2 (and they may not battle or move) for remainder of turn. OR Deploy a Rebel scout (deploy +2) to a site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: General Solo's strike team was made up of the Alliance's finest ground troops.

front.title: Rapid Fire
front.gametext: If a battle was just initiated, deploy (for free) a vehicle weapon or starship weapon from hand (or Reserve Deck; reshuffle) on your participating vehicle or starship.
front.lore: Rebel engineers at Echo Base quickly armed T-47 snowspeeders with harpoon guns in preparation for the impending attack.

front.title: •Rayc Ryjerd
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (or 4 if trained by Rycar Ryjerd). Any starfighter Rayc pilots is immune to Tallon Roll and is not lost if an asteroid sector is drawn for asteroid destiny.
front.lore: An 'honest' smuggler. Working for Jabba to pay off debts for his ship. Rycar's son. Even more of an idiot.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
combo: Rayc Ryjerd + Rycar Ryjerd

front.title: •Rayc Ryjerd (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. Twice per game, may take one Big One, Kessel Run, or Rycar's Run into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per game, may double the value of X for Kessel Run or Rycar's Run. Rayc is a matching pilot for any freighter or yacht.
front.lore: An 'honest' smuggler. Working for Jabba to pay off debts for his ship. Rycar's son. Even more of an idiot.

front.title: •Rebel Aces
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Your Sandwhirl is canceled.  At battleground systems where you have a Rebel of ability = 2 piloting a starfighter, and you have no Force drain bonus (except from the system card itself), your Force drains are +1.  Your starfighters with a pilot character aboard are immune to attrition < 4.  Once per turn, may deploy Close Air Support from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  Your Rebel starfighters without astromech capacit (except Falcon or Artoo-Detoo In Red 5) gain 'May add 1 astromech.'

front.title: Rebel Ambush
front.gametext: If a battle was just initiated at a site, each of your troopers present is power +1 (+2 if at a Rebel Base site) and immune to attrition for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Entrenched Rebel troops defend their ground with surprising fierceness.

front.title: ••Rebel Artillery
front.gametext: During your control phase, if you have a weapon (except a lightsaber, or [Permanent Weapon]) at a battleground you control, opponent loses one Force. OR If you just used a weapon (except a lightsaber, or [Permanent Weapon]) to hit a character or starship, opponent loses one Force. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: The Rebel Alliance utilizes every piece of equipment, ammunition and personnel it can muster.

front.title: Rebel Barrier
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to prevent any character or starship just deployed by the opponent from battling or moving for the remainder of this turn.
front.lore: While being chased through the Death Star, Luke and Leia disabled the blast doors behind them in order to slow down pursuing stormtroopers.

front.title: <>Rebel Cell - Hidden Landing Site
front.gametext: Light: : Your starfighters may deploy here (for -1 Force), and take off and land here for free.  Incom Corporation may deploy here (once per game, may use 2 Force to deploy it here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle).

front.title: <>Rebel Cell - Monitoring Station
front.gametext: Light: : Deploys only to same planet system as Rebel Cell - Hidden Landing Site. While you occupy, your Force drains may not be modified by opponent's objective.

front.title: <>Rebel Cell - Perimeter
front.gametext: Light: : Your [Hoth] artillery weapons at Rebel Cell sites are powered, forfeit +2, fire for free, and are placed in Used Pile when forfeited.

front.title: <>Rebel Cell - Refugee Quarter
front.gametext: Light: : While [Virtual Block 4] Hidden Base on table, your unique (*) aliens are deploy -1 (to a maximum of -1).

front.title: <>Rebel Cell - Situation Room
front.gametext: Light: : Deploys only to same planet system as Rebel Cell - Hidden Landing Site. For each of your characters here, your power is +1 at related system.

front.title: Rebel Commander
front.gametext: Adds 1 to forfeit of each of your other Rebels (except leaders) at same site. Bothan spies deploy free to same location.
front.lore: Commander Bob Hudsol. Typical of hard-line Corellian officers known for caution in battle. Leader of resistance in Bothan space. Developed strong ties to Bothan spynet.

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

front.title: •Rebel Fleet
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Once per turn, you may cancel a Force drain by placing here from hand any non-unique starfighter. Starfighters may deploy here as if from hand (if Effect canceled by opponent, any starfighters here may immediately deploy for free.)
front.lore: To avoid unnecessary Imperial entanglements, the Rebel fleet is continuously on the move.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Rebel Flight Suit
front.gametext: Deploy on your pilot character. While piloting any starfighter, combat vehicle or shuttle vehicle, that character is considered to be the 'matching pilot' (pilot adds 2 to maneuver (limit +2) and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise).
front.lore: Pilot fatigues feature digital technology which can be customized for particular starfighters. Increases interface efficiency with a newly assigned craft.

front.title: Rebel Flight Suit (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on a Rebel (or Resistance) pilot. Any starfighter or vehicle character pilots is power +2. If present at a site, may use 1 Force to place this device in Used Pile. Once per game, if character is piloting in battle, may cancel a non-[S] Interrupt.
front.lore: Pilot fatigues feature digital technology which can be customized for particular starfighters. Increases interface efficiency with a newly assigned craft.

cancels: One interrupt that is not immune to Sense

front.title: Rebel Guard
front.gametext: Power +4 when defending a battle. Cannot move.
front.lore: Galen Torg was selected for honor guard duty during ceremony following the Battle of Yavin. He is typical of the hard-working, unsung heros in the Rebel Alliance.

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

front.title: •Rebel Gunrunner
front.gametext: Deploy on table; and stack a non-lightsaber weapon (without 'lost' in game text) here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. If a battle was just initiated, may deploy weapon here on a participating card. Return weapon here at end of weapons segment (if possible), at end of battle, or if it is about to leave table, be stolen, or become inactive. (Immune to Alter).
front.lore: Smugglers from many worlds are hunted by the Empire for providing arms and supplies to the Alliance. The Outer Rim is their refuge.

front.title: •Rebel Infantry
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Rebel scouts (except pilots) are troopers. Rebel troopers have armor = 4 and are immune to Physical Choke. Whenever you deploy a Rebel trooper, may immediately deploy a Blaster Rifle on that character from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Alliance lost many fine soldiers at conflicts such as the Battle of Hoth. The Rebel High Command is aware of the cost of freedom from Imperial tyranny.

front.title: Rebel Leadership
front.gametext: Each of your admirals and generals is foreit +1 for remainder of turn. OR If your admiral is in battle at a system (or your general, except Obi-Wan, is in battle at a site), you may either add one battle destiny or prevent opponent from drawing more that one battle destiny.
front.lore: In times of greatest need, the Rebellion relies on the brilliant leadership provided by commanders fighting for freedom.

front.title: Rebel Leadership (V)
front.gametext: Take an admiral or a non-Jedi general into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Once per game, deploy a war room from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR If your admiral or non-[Episode I] general is in battle, may add one battle destiny or prevent opponent from drawing more than one battle destiny (their battle destiny draws may not be canceled).
front.lore: In times of greatest need, the Rebellion relies on the brilliant leadership provided by commanders fighting for freedom.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Brad Eier - Michigan States 2005)"

front.title: Rebel Leadership (V)
front.gametext: Take an admiral or general into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR If your admiral is in battle at a system (or your general is in battle at a site), you may either add one battle destiny or prevent opponent from drawing more than one battle destiny.
front.lore: In times of greatest need, the Rebellion relies on the brilliant leadership provided by commanders fighting for freedom.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Brad Eier)"
combo: General Solo (V) can play Rebel Leadership (V) from reserve deck during battle.

front.title: Rebel Pilot
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots.
front.lore: Lt. Wenton Chan, from Corulag, is typical of the new pilots who volunteer for dangerous duty in the Rebellion. Few have Academy training. Most learn piloting on skyhoppers.

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

front.title: •Rebel Planners
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy at Massassi War Room or any docking bay. Adds X to your total power at the related system and related sectors, where X = the number of your starships present there.
front.lore: Rebel strategists worked under master tactician General Dodonna. They devised an unorthodox battle plan to destroy the Death Star at the Battle of Yavin.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Rebel Reinforcements
front.gametext: If Opponent outnumbers you in total characters and starships on table, use 1 Force to draw destiny. That number of Rebel Troopers and/or Y-Wings, may be retrieved from Lost Pile.
front.lore: Rebels rely on hidden 'cells' of undercover operatives. Striking from hidden bases, troops or starfighters can arrive in a battle zone at any time.

front.title: Rebel Reinforcements (V)
front.gametext: Once per game, if opponent has more cards with ability on table than you do, draw destiny and retrieve up to that number of Rebel characters and/or Rebel starships (may take one retrieved card into hand).
front.lore: Rebels rely on hidden 'cells' of undercover operatives. Striking from hidden bases, troops or starfighters can arrive in a battle zone at any time.

front.title: •Rebel Sacrifice
front.gametext: Deploy on table if Obi-Wan 'communing.' 'Tatooine' on Obi-Wan is treated as 'Death Star'. Your Death Star sites gain one [Light Side],and if opponent loses Force to battle damage (or a Force Drain) at such sites, stack the first card lost face-down here. Attack Run is canceled. [Immune to Alter]
front.lore: 'You can't win Darth. If you strike me down I shall become more powerful than you can possibly imagine.' Obi-Wan's sacrifice gave the Rebels time to escape.

front.title: •••Rebel Scout
front.gametext: May move as a 'react' (for free) to a battle where you have a Rebel of ability > 2 or a leader.
front.lore: A Rebel Scout such as Vidar Blin is usually assigned to recon missions. Trained in first-response tactics, many come to the Alliance with prior special forces experience.

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

front.title: •••Rebel Scout (V)
front.gametext: May deploy -1 as a 'react' to same site as a Rebel. When deployed, may peek at the top card of a Reserve Deck; may place that card on bottom of that Reserve Deck.
front.lore: A Rebel Scout such as Vidar Blin is usually assigned to recon missions. Trained in first-response tactics, many come to the Alliance with prior special forces experience.

cards.set: Empire Strikes Back Introductory Two Player Game

front.title: Rebel Snowspeeder
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.
front.lore: Technicians at the Rebel Base on Hoth modified T-47 airspeeders to fly in the frigid atmosphere of the ice planet. Enclosed.

front.title: Rebel Squad Leader
front.gametext: Adds 1 to forfeit of your other troopers and Rebel Guards at same site. When moving with a 'squad' of exactly three other troopers and/or Rebel Guards, all four move for 1 Force. Rebel Guards at same site may move.
front.lore: Lt. Pello Scrambas is a typical veteran officer in the Rebel forces. Loyally served the Organa family for nearly two decades as a guard for the Royal House of Alderaan.

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

front.title: Rebel Strike Team / Garrison Destroyed
front.gametext: Rebel Strike Team:Deploy Endor system and Rebel Landing Site.{While} this side up, opponent loses no more than 1 Force from each of your Force drains at Endor locations. Once during each of your deploy phases, may use 2 Force to take one Bunker or Deactivate The Shield Generator into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if Bunker 'blown away' or if, during your move phase, you control three exterior Endor sites (with two Rebel scouts at each).{Place} out of play if Endor 'blown away.'Garrison Destroyed:{While} this side up, at each Endor site where you have a Rebel scout, your Force drains may not be modified or canceled by opponent, except by a 'react'. Rebel scouts are immune to attrition < 4. Once during each of your draw phases, may retrieve one Rebel scout of ability < 3. Your Epic Event destiny draws are each +2.{Flip} this card (unless Bunker 'blown away') if, during an opponent's move phase, opponent controls three exterior Endor sites or Endor system.{Place} out of play if Endor is 'blown away'.

back.title: Rebel Strike Team / Garrison Destroyed
back.gametext: Rebel Strike Team:Deploy Endor system and Rebel Landing Site.{While} this side up, opponent loses no more than 1 Force from each of your Force drains at Endor locations. Once during each of your deploy phases, may use 2 Force to take one Bunker or Deactivate The Shield Generator into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if Bunker 'blown away' or if, during your move phase, you control three exterior Endor sites (with two Rebel scouts at each).{Place} out of play if Endor 'blown away.'Garrison Destroyed:{While} this side up, at each Endor site where you have a Rebel scout, your Force drains may not be modified or canceled by opponent, except by a 'react'. Rebel scouts are immune to attrition < 4. Once during each of your draw phases, may retrieve one Rebel scout of ability < 3. Your Epic Event destiny draws are each +2.{Flip} this card (unless Bunker 'blown away') if, during an opponent's move phase, opponent controls three exterior Endor sites or Endor system.{Place} out of play if Endor is 'blown away'.

front.title: Rebel Strike Team / Garrison Destroyed (V)
front.gametext: Rebel Strike Team:Deploy Endor system, Back Door and [Virtual Block 7] The Shield is Down!.{For} remainder of game, your [Episode I] characters and [Virtual Block 3] rifles are lost. Your force generation is +1 at your Endor Sites. May use 1 Force to take into hand an [Endor Icon] Epic Event; reshuffle.{While} this side up, your force drains on Endor are -1. Your Bunker gains one [Light Side Force]. If you occupy Bunker at the end of a battle you just won there, may use your [Endor Icon] Epic Event to attempt to 'blow away' Bunker.{Flip} this card if Bunker 'blown away'.Garrison Destroyed:{While} this side up, Endor Shield is canceled. May raise your converted Endor to the top. If Establish a Secret Base on Table, Force Generation at Endor Locations may not be canceled. At Endor sites you occupy with a scout, you force drains may not be modified by an opponent. Whenever you initate a battle with a scout, may retrieve 2 Force. Once per game, may deploy from Reserve Deck (or deploy from hand) a Rebel Starship for half it's printed deploy cost (round down); reshuffle.

back.title: Rebel Strike Team / Garrison Destroyed (V)
back.gametext: Rebel Strike Team:Deploy Endor system, Back Door and [Virtual Block 7] The Shield is Down!.{For} remainder of game, your [Episode I] characters and [Virtual Block 3] rifles are lost. Your force generation is +1 at your Endor Sites. May use 1 Force to take into hand an [Endor Icon] Epic Event; reshuffle.{While} this side up, your force drains on Endor are -1. Your Bunker gains one [Light Side Force]. If you occupy Bunker at the end of a battle you just won there, may use your [Endor Icon] Epic Event to attempt to 'blow away' Bunker.{Flip} this card if Bunker 'blown away'.Garrison Destroyed:{While} this side up, Endor Shield is canceled. May raise your converted Endor to the top. If Establish a Secret Base on Table, Force Generation at Endor Locations may not be canceled. At Endor sites you occupy with a scout, you force drains may not be modified by an opponent. Whenever you initate a battle with a scout, may retrieve 2 Force. Once per game, may deploy from Reserve Deck (or deploy from hand) a Rebel Starship for half it's printed deploy cost (round down); reshuffle.

front.title: •••Rebel Tech
front.gametext: When at your war room: Cumulatively adds 1 to total of Attack Run. OR Once during each of your control phases, may send this tech to your Used Pile and take Death Star: Trench into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Del Goren, typical expert in communications and scanner jamming, served aboard the Rebel privateer corvette Spiral before joining the Alliance High Command.

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

front.title: •••Rebel Tech (V)
front.gametext: While on Yavin 4: cancels Force drain bonuses from Yavin sites' game text, your Attack Run total is cumulatively +1, and during your deploy phase, may place this character in Used Pile to take one Advance Preparation or Death Star: Trench into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Del Goren, typical expert in communications and scanner jamming, served aboard the Rebel privateer corvette Spiral before joining the Alliance High Command.

front.title: Rebel Trooper
front.gametext: Deploys free to same site as one of your Rebels with ability > 2.
front.lore: Corellian Corvette trooper Ensign Chad Hilse, an Alderaanian, typifies the loyal Rebel volunteers dedicated to defeating the Empire. Trained in starship and ground combat.

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)
combo: Rebel Trooper + CZ-3

front.title: Rebel Trooper (V)
front.gametext: When drawn for weapon or battle destiny, destiny +2. While present at a site and armed with a blaster rifle, forfeit +2 and draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.
front.lore: Corellian Corvette trooper Ensign Chad Hilse, an Alderaanian, typifies the loyal Rebel volunteers dedicated to defeating the Empire. Trained in starship and ground combat.

front.title: Rebel Trooper Recruit
front.gametext: Deploys free to same site as a Rebel leader. When forfeited at same site as a Rebel 'veteran' (a leader or non-recruit trooper), also satisfies all remaining attrition against you. Once per turn, may target a non-unique Rebel warrior present; target is power +1 for remainder of turn.
front.lore: New Rebel troopers gain invaluable experience while acting as support for seasoned troops. The Alliance prefers to assign rookies to soldiers on a one-to-one basis.

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

front.title: •••Rebel Trooper Reinforcements
front.gametext: May deploy as a 'react' to a site. Deploys -2 to a site where opponent has more characters than you. Ambush is a Used Interrupt.
front.lore: Rebels rely on hidden 'cells' of undercover operatives. Striking from hidden bases, troops or starfighters can arrive in a battle zone at any time.

front.title: •Rebellions Are Built on Hope
front.gametext: Deploy on Table. Your Force generation is +1 at docking bays you occupy. Once per game, may take into hand one Dantooine, Mon Calamari or Yavin 4 system or Profundity from reserve deck; reshuffle. Staging Areas is canceled. (Immune to Alter.)

front.title: Recoil In Fear
front.gametext: Use 3 Force. Each player places hand onto Reserve Deck (if possible), then places Used Pile onto Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Each player then draws cards from Reserve Deck equal to the number of cards just placed from hand onto Reserve Deck (if any).
front.lore: In combat, a bold and unexpected move can change the entire situation.

front.title: Rectenna
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your starship. You may deploy cards as a 'react' to a battle at same system or sector.
front.lore: Fabritech communications and sensor array. Features active/passive scanners, powerful jamming system, ship-to-ship transmitters and short-range target acquisition program.

front.title: •Red 1
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot.
front.lore: Lead fighter of Red Squadron at Battle of Yavin. Flown by Garven Dreis. Also served at main Rebel base on Dantooine.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
combo: Red 1 + Organized Attack

front.title: •Red 1 (V)
front.gametext: May add Red Leader as pilot. X-wings are immune to Tallon Roll. Once per turn, may use 1 Force to take a unique (•) Red Squadron X-wing (except Red 5) into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Lead fighter of Red Squadron at Battle of Yavin. Flown by Garven Dreis. Also served at main Rebel base on Dantooine.

front.title: •Red 1 (V)
front.gametext: May add Red Leader as pilot. X-wings are immune to Tallon Roll. Once per turn, may use 1 Force to take a unique (•) Red Squadron X-wing (except Red 5) into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Lead fighter of Red Squadron at Battle of Yavin. Flown by Garven Dreis. Also served at main Rebel base on Dantooine.

front.title: •Red 10
front.gametext: Deploys free to Ord Mantell. May add 1 pilot. Proton Torpedoes deploy and fire free aboard. Immune to attrition < 4 when matching pilot aboard.
front.lore: Theron Nett's X-wing. Assigned to be Red Leader's wingman during the second attack run on the Death Star.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
combo: Red 10 + Organized Attack

front.title: •Red 2
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 1 astromech. Immune to attrition < 3 if Wedge piloting.
front.lore: Wedge's X-wing at Battle of Yavin. Wedge had to nurse the fighter home after a hit in the Death Star trench destroyed its micro-maneuvering controls.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
combo: Red 2 + Organized Attack
Red 2 + Wedge Antilles + Moving To Attack Position

front.title: •Red 3
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 1 astromech.
front.lore: Biggs Darklighter's fighter at Battle of Yavin. Part of Ecliptic Evaders squadron near Sullust until transferred to Yavin Base.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
combo: Red 3 + Organized Attack

front.title: •Red 3 (V)
front.gametext: May add Biggs as pilot.  If Red 3 is about to be lost before the damage segment, it is instead 'hit.'  If targeted by Darklighter Spin, it is a Used Interrupt.  Immune to Lateral Damage and attrition < 4.
front.lore: Biggs Darklighter's fighter at Battle of Yavin. Part of Ecliptic Evaders squadron near Sullust until transferred to Yavin Base.

front.title: •Red 5
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 1 astromech. Immune to attrition < 4 if Luke piloting. When firing in an Attack Run, adds 1 to total.
front.lore: Luke's Incom T-65 X-wing at the Battle of Yavin. Instrumentation similarities between Red 5 and the T-16 skyhopper allowed Luke to play a pivotal role in the conflict.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
combo: Red 5 + Organized Attack

front.title: •Red 5 (V)
front.gametext: May add Luke as pilot and [A New Hope] R2-D2 (may deploy here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle). During battle, may cancel a starfighter's game text here (except related to capacity, ability, and identity of permanent pilot). Immune to attrition < 6.
front.lore: Luke's Incom T-65 X-wing at the Battle of Yavin. Instrumentation similarities between Red 5 and the T-16 skyhopper allowed Luke to play a pivotal role in the conflict.

front.title: •Red 5 (V)
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 1 astromech. While Luke piloting: maneuver +2, immune to attrition, and you may initiate battles and Force drains here regardless of Objective restrictions.
front.lore: Luke's Incom T-65 X-wing at the Battle of Yavin. Instrumentation similarities between Red 5 and the T-16 skyhopper allowed Luke to play a pivotal role in the conflict.

front.title: •Red 6
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. Opponent may add 2 to destiny drawn for I've Got A Problem Here when targeting Red 6.
front.lore: Jek Porkins' X-wing at Battle of Yavin. Instrumental in success of strafing attacks against Death Star. Skipped last inspection of computer and flight control systems.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
combo: Red 6 + Organized Attack
Red 6 + Corran Horn (or any other spy with pilot ability) Deploy Corran Horn on Red 6 to any system even without presence or Force icons.

front.title: •Red 7
front.gametext: Deploys free to Ralltiir. May add 1 pilot. Proton Torpedoes deploy and fire free aboard. Immune to attrition < 4 when matching pilot aboard.
front.lore: Flown by Elyhek Rue. X-wing that participated in an attack on the Devastator at Ralltiir.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
combo: Red 7 + Organized Attack

front.title: •Red 8
front.gametext: Deploys free to Raithal. May add 1 pilot. Adds 1 to total weapon destiny when firing X-wing Laser Cannons. Immune to attrition < 4 when matching pilot aboard.
front.lore: X-wing assigned to Bren Quersey by Wedge Antilles. Scored a hit on Black 2.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
combo: Red 8 + Organized Attack

front.title: •Red 8 (V)
front.gametext: May deploy as a 'react'. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. When deployed (except as a 'react'), may play a Defensive Shield from under your Starting Effect (as if from hand).
front.lore: X-wing assigned to Bren Quersey by Wedge Antilles. Scored a hit on Black 2.

front.title: •Red 8 (V)
front.gametext: May deploy as a 'react'. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. When deployed (except as a 'react'), may play a Defensive Shield from under your Starting Effect (as if from hand).
front.lore: X-wing assigned to Bren Quersey by Wedge Antilles. Scored a hit on Black 2.

front.title: •Red 9
front.gametext: Deploys free to Clak'dor VII. May add 1 pilot. Adds 1 to total weapon destiny when firing X-wing Laser Cannons. Immune to attrition < 4 when matching pilot aboard.
front.lore: Part of the relief fleet sent to Clak'dor VII. Had extra cargo room installed. Flown by Lieutenant Naytaan.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
combo: Red 9 + Organized Attack

front.title: •Red Leader
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 1, also adds 1 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. Adds 1 to forfeit of each other Red Squadron pilot at same location.
front.lore: X-wing pilot Garven Dreis. Led Red Squadron at the Battle of Yavin, and fired an unsuccessful shot at the Death Star thermal exhaust port. Served at Dantooine Rebel base.

front.title: •Red Leader (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting at Dantooine system, when opponent deploys a character to a related site, they choose: opponent must lose 1 Force. OR that character may not battle or move this turn.
front.lore: X-wing pilot Garven Dreis. Led Red Squadron at the Battle of Yavin, and fired an unsuccessful shot at the Death Star thermal exhaust port. Served at Dantooine Rebel base.

front.title: •Red Leader In Red 1
front.gametext: Permanent pilot aboard is •Red Leader, who provides ability of 2, adds 2 to power and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: Called 'Boss' or 'Chief' by his squadron, Garven Dreis was the first pilot to fire proton torpedoes at the Death Star's exhaust port during the Battle of Yavin.

front.title: •Red Squadron 1
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. [Death Star II] Wedge deploys -2 aboard (for free if deploying to Endor). When Wedge piloting, immune to attrition < 5 and adds 6 to total when targeted by Tallon Roll.
front.lore: Flown by Wedge Antilles as Red 2 at the Battle of Yavin. Redesignated at Endor. Rugged Incom fighter. Victory markers show it role in the attack on the first Death Star.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
combo: Red Squadron 1 + X-wings + Organized Attack

front.title: •Red Squadron 4
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. Hobbie deploys -2 aboard. When firing X-wing Laser Cannons, may use 2 Force to make X = 3. When Hobbie piloting, maneuver +2 and immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Flown by Derek 'Hobbie' Klivian during the attack on the second Death Star. Second-highest mission total of any X-wing in service for the Alliance.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
combo: Red Squadron 4 + X-wing + Organized Attack

front.title: •Red Squadron 6
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. While Ello Asty piloting, attrition against opponent is +1 here.
front.lore: Blank.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Red Squadron 7
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. Keir Santage deploys -2 aboard. Your other Red Squadron starfighters at same location are maneuver +1.
front.lore: Incom starfighter flown by Keir Santage. Flew twelve sorties against Imperial shipyards at Fondor.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
combo: Red Squadron 7 + X-wing + Organized Attack

front.title: •Red Squadron 7 (V)
front.gametext: Heroic. May add 1 pilot. Once per game may place a non-[Immune to Alter] Effect at same system in owner's Used Pile. Corran Horn and Keir Santage deploy -1 aboard; while either piloting, immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Incom starfighter flown by Keir Santage. Flew twelve sorties against Imperial shipyards at Fondor.

front.title: •••Red Squadron X-wing
front.gametext: Deploy -2 at Yavin 4 or to same location as Red Leader. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2 and adds 2 to power. Proton Torpedoes deploy and fire free aboard.
front.lore: Most Red Squadron pilots trained under Garven Dreis. Flew top cover during the Battle of Yavin. Became famous for Red 5's historic attack run.

combo: Red Squadron X-wing + X-wing + Organized Attack

front.title: •Redeemed Apprentice
front.gametext: If you just forfeited a character (or opponent just drew destiny for Elis Helrot) deploy on table. Whenever you must lose Force from a (Virtual Block 4) objective targeting your non-jedi character, reduce that loss by 1. Elis Herlot and Nabrun Leids are canceled. (Immune to Control).
front.lore: 'I know there is good in you. The Emperor hasn't driven it from you fully.'

front.title: •Redemption
front.gametext: May add 4 pilots and 4 passengers. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Your medical droids and Bacta Tank 'patients' may deploy aboard for free.
front.lore: Nebulon-B frigate used as a mobile medical facility. Extra cargo space and weapon batteries have been modified to allow for more armor and more recovery areas.

front.title: •Redemption (V)
front.gametext: May add 4 pilots and 4 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Bacta Tank deploys for free and is lost if Redemption lost. X on Bacta Tank is -2.
front.lore: Nebulon-B frigate used as a mobile medical facility. Extra cargo space and weapon batteries have been modified to allow for more armor and more recovery areas.

front.title: •Redemption (V)
front.gametext: May add 4 pilots and 4 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. When deployed, may deploy a non-[maintenance] Rebel aboard from your Lost Pile.
front.lore: Nebulon-B frigate used as a mobile medical facility. Extra cargo space and weapon batteries have been modified to allow for more armor and more recovery areas.

front.title: •Redemption: Command Post
front.gametext: Light: : During your move phase, may relocate your leader here to a site you occupy.

front.title: •Reflection
front.gametext: Deploy on Leia. Once during each of your control phases, you may use 3 Force to retrieve 1 Force. Also, when an apprentice, adds 1 to her training destiny.
front.lore: It was hard to imagine the enormous losses the Alliance suffered during the Battle of Hoth. Leia contemplated what she could do to help the Rebellion recover.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Reflection (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on [Endor] Leia. Leia's training destiny draws are +1. During your control phase, may use 3 Force (if Save You It Can on table, may use 1 Force instead) to retrieve 1 Force (cannot be reduced).
front.lore: It was hard to imagine the enormous losses the Alliance suffered during the Battle of Hoth. Leia contemplated what she could do to help the Rebellion recover.

front.title: •Relatively Unprotected
front.gametext: Deploy on table. While you occupy two battlegrounds (or opponent's site), you lose no more than 1 Force to Carbon-Freezing or That Thing's Operational. (Immune to Alter.) OR Deploy on a Star Destroyer or vehicle; its immunity to attrition is -4 and it may not 'react'.
front.lore: 'With the Imperial Fleet spread throughout the galaxy in a vain effort to engage us, it is relatively unprotected.'

front.title: Remote
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy at any site. Moves like a character at normal use of the Force. Once during each of your control phases, may: Select one character present to be power or forfeit +1 for remainder of turn. OR Use 2 Force to cancel any seeker present.
front.lore: Tshhhh. Tshhhh. Zap! 'Look...good against remotes is one thing. Good against the living, that's something else.'

front.title: •Rendezvous Point
front.gametext: Light: : Your starships deploy -2 here and are hyperspeed +2 when moving to or from here. Neither player may Force drain here.

front.title: Rendezvous Point On Tatooine
front.gametext: During your control phase, use 1 Force to move one of your [Cloud City] characters of ability > 1 to any [Jabba's Palace] location where you have presence. If moving to any Jabba's Palace site, this movement is free and you do not need presence.
front.lore: 'When we find Jabba the Hutt and that bounty hunter, we'll contact you.'

front.title: Rendezvous Point On Tatooine (V)
front.gametext: LOST: Deploy a Tatooine battleground from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  STARTING: If you have deployed a Jabba's Palace site, deploy Seeking An Audience and up to two Effects that deploy on table and are always immune to Alter. Place Interrupt in hand."
front.lore: 'When we find Jabba the Hutt and that bounty hunter, we'll contact you.'

front.title: •Rennek
front.gametext: Creatures at same site (except Sarlacc) do not attack and cannot be attacked. Up to three times per turn, may use 1 Force to cumulatively add 1 to his power for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Nerf herder. Personally oversees the herding of Jabba's nerfs. Scruffy-looking appearance conceals his expertise in unusual combat techniques.

combo: Rennek + Who's Scruffy-Looking?

front.title: •Rennek (V)
front.gametext: May be stacked on I Know That Laugh from hand for 2 force. While stacked on I Know That Laugh, stack face-up and during any battle may draw destiny. If destiny < number of your aliens in battle, reduce a participating character's forfeit to 0.
front.lore: Nerf herder. Personally oversees the herding of Jabba's nerfs. Scruffy-looking appearance conceals his expertise in unusual combat techniques.

front.title: •Rep Been
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to an underwater site. While at Boss Nass' Chamber: your Force generation here is +1 for each Gunganpresent, and once per game, may take an underwater site into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Member of Boss Nass' Rep Council. His responsibilities include maintaining a record of Gungan history as well as preserving ancient records of Gungan civilization.

combo: Rep Been + Wesa Gotta Grand Army Make opponent's undercover spy lost.

front.title: •Report To Lord Vader
front.gametext: If you just won a battle, deploy on Vader. Target an Imperial involved in that battle. Vader and target are power and forfeit -4. When target reaches Vader, lose Utinni Effect and draw destiny. If destiny > 2, target lost.
front.lore: An evil Lord of the Sith, Darth Vader used fear as a powerful motivational factor. The Emperor demanded results. Vader settled for no less.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Republic At War / Aggressive Negotiations
front.gametext: Republic At War:Deploy Forward Base and Begun, The Clone War Has.{For} remainder of game, Rebels and Rebel starships are lost. You may forfeit non-lightsaber weapons (using forfeit value = 3); place your forfeited weapon in Used Pile. Your Destiny is suspended. You lose no Force to Vengeance Of The Dark Prince.{While} this side up, once per turn, may deploy an [Episode I] battleground from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if you have one 'complete' [Clone Army] Mission on table.Aggressive Negotiations:{Immediately} place X cards from hand on bottom of Force Pile then draw up to X+1 cards from Reserve Deck once per game.{While} this side up, opponent's battle destiny draws are -1. During your control phase, may use 2 Force to take into hand a [Clone Army] character, starship or vehicle from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Your total power in battles is +Y, and whenever you win a battle, retrieve up to Y Force, where Y = the number of 'complete' [Clone Army] Missions on table..{Flip} this card if you have no 'complete' [Clone Army] Missions on table.

back.title: Republic At War / Aggressive Negotiations
back.gametext: Republic At War:Deploy Forward Base and Begun, The Clone War Has.{For} remainder of game, Rebels and Rebel starships are lost. You may forfeit non-lightsaber weapons (using forfeit value = 3); place your forfeited weapon in Used Pile. Your Destiny is suspended. You lose no Force to Vengeance Of The Dark Prince.{While} this side up, once per turn, may deploy an [Episode I] battleground from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if you have one 'complete' [Clone Army] Mission on table.Aggressive Negotiations:{Immediately} place X cards from hand on bottom of Force Pile then draw up to X+1 cards from Reserve Deck once per game.{While} this side up, opponent's battle destiny draws are -1. During your control phase, may use 2 Force to take into hand a [Clone Army] character, starship or vehicle from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Your total power in battles is +Y, and whenever you win a battle, retrieve up to Y Force, where Y = the number of 'complete' [Clone Army] Missions on table..{Flip} this card if you have no 'complete' [Clone Army] Missions on table.

front.title: Republic Corvette
front.gametext: May add 3 Republic pilots and 4 passengers. Quad Laser Cannons may not deploy aboard. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. While with an Imperial-class Star Destroyer, power +1.
front.lore: Multi-purpose Rebel Blockade Runner. Modular interior designed for troop or cargo transport. 150 meters long. Used by Rebels, pirates, corporations and the Empire.

front.title: Republic Cruiser
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 3 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Has ship-docking capability. While at same system as opponent's battleship, opponent's battle destiny draws are each -1 here.
front.lore: Manufactured by Corellian Engineering Corporation, this consular ship design serves the Republic for a variety of dignitary transportation and diplomatic missions.

combo: Republic Cruiser + Docking And Repair Facilities

front.title: ••Republic Gunship Wing
front.gametext: Permanent pilots provide total ability of 6. At cloud sectors: power and maneuver +3, may deploy as a 'react', and may move and be targeted by weapons like a starfighter. Immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Enclosed

front.title: •Republic Logistics
front.gametext: Deploy on table. If A Jedi's Plans not on table, may deploy it from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per turn, you may place a non-unique card with ability from your Lost Pile out of play to retrieve any one unique (•) character of ability < 5, starship, or vehicle (except one with a [Permanent Weapon] or [Maintenance]). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Maintaining unimpeded control of vital transportation channels can strengthen and secure surrounding areas.

front.title: Republic Starfighter
front.gametext: Permanent pilot provides ability of 1.  May add 1 pilot (suspends permanent pilot).  Pilots deploy -1 aboard (-2 if a Jedi).  May be revealed or deployed using Get To Your Ships!.

front.title: Republic Trooper With Blaster Rifle
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to same site as your Republic leader. Permanent weapon is blaster rifle (may target a character or creature for free; draw destiny; target hit, and forfeit -2, if destiny +1 > defense value).

front.title: •Rescue In The Clouds
front.gametext: USED: If you have a character on Weather Vane, place that character on your Used Pile.  LOST: Deploy one or more vehicles, starfighters and pilots (at normal use of the Force) as a 'react' to a cloud sector."
front.lore: 'I know where Luke is.'

front.title: •Rescue In The Clouds (V)
front.gametext: USED: Peek at the top 3 cards of your Reserve Deck and take one into hand; reshuffle. OR Cancel a just drawn destiny targeting the ability or defense value of your non-Undercover character of ability < 5 at a system or mobile location.  LOST: Cancel Close Call."
front.lore: 'I know where Luke is.'

front.title: •Rescue On Geonosis
front.gametext: Deploy on Begun The Clone War Has. Once per turn, may take Amidala into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Petranaki Arena is a prison. May deploy Amidala imprisoned there (for free) from hand or Lost Pile and, unless this Mission 'complete', Amidala lost if not imprisoned there and she may not be transferred while imprisoned. If you just initiated a Force drain at Petranaki Arena, release a captive there (Mission 'complete').

front.title: Rescue The Princess / Sometimes I Amaze Even Myself
front.gametext: Rescue The Princess:Deploy Detention Block Corridor (with Leia of ability < 4 imprisoned there), Docking Bay 327, Yavin 4: Docking Bay and Yavin 4: War Room.{While} this side up, your spies, 8D8, Revolution, Death Star Plans and Detention Block Control Room may not deploy to Death Star. Cards that release captives are immune to Sense and Alter. May not play Nabrun Leids.{Flip} this card if you move Leia to Yavin 4: War Room.{Place} out of play if Leia is lost from table (you may not deploy Death Star Plans for remainder of game).Sometimes I Amaze Even Myself:{While} this side up, for opponent to initiate a Force drain, opponent must use +1 Force. During battle, opponent's unique (•) characters, vehicles and starships lost from table are placed out of play; Leia adds one battle destiny; attrition against opponent is +2; and Imperials, Dark Jedi and Imperial starships lose all immunity to attrition.{Flip} this card if Leia is captured.

back.title: Rescue The Princess / Sometimes I Amaze Even Myself
back.gametext: Rescue The Princess:Deploy Detention Block Corridor (with Leia of ability < 4 imprisoned there), Docking Bay 327, Yavin 4: Docking Bay and Yavin 4: War Room.{While} this side up, your spies, 8D8, Revolution, Death Star Plans and Detention Block Control Room may not deploy to Death Star. Cards that release captives are immune to Sense and Alter. May not play Nabrun Leids.{Flip} this card if you move Leia to Yavin 4: War Room.{Place} out of play if Leia is lost from table (you may not deploy Death Star Plans for remainder of game).Sometimes I Amaze Even Myself:{While} this side up, for opponent to initiate a Force drain, opponent must use +1 Force. During battle, opponent's unique (•) characters, vehicles and starships lost from table are placed out of play; Leia adds one battle destiny; attrition against opponent is +2; and Imperials, Dark Jedi and Imperial starships lose all immunity to attrition.{Flip} this card if Leia is captured.

front.title: •Restore Freedom To The Galaxy
front.gametext: Deploy on Yavin 4.  Once per turn, may deploy a battleground system or an interior Yavin 4 site.  Whenever you Force drain at another battleground system, may draw destiny.  Add 1 for each Yavin 4 site on table (2 if you occupy).  If total destiny > 6, stack top card from either player's Reserve Deck there (limit one per system) to 'liberate' the system.  At 'liberated' systems: Force drains are +1, and at same and related locations your total power is +3 and you draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.  If opponent Force drains at a 'liberated' system, place stacked card in owner's Used Pile.

front.title: •Restore Freedom To The Galaxy
front.gametext: If Yavin 4 on table, deploy on table. If you just initiated a Force drain at a battleground system (except a 'liberated' system), may draw destiny. Add 1 for each piloted unique (•) snub fighter present at that system. If total destiny > 5, opponent loses 1 Force and stacks lost card face down there (while that card stacked there, system is 'liberated'). If opponent Force drains at a 'liberated' system, place stacked card in owner's Used Pile. At each 'liberated' system, your Force drains are +1 and opponent's starships are deploy +1.

front.title: Restraining Bolt
front.gametext: Deploy on any droid at any site. Droid cannot move and cannot utilize its 'game text.' During your deploy phase, Restraining Bolt may be transferred (for free) to another droid at same site.
front.lore: Fits in a special socket on a droid's body. When installed, restricts actions of droids, forcing them to follow orders. Can be operated remotely by a 'caller.'

front.title: •Restricted Deployment
front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on opponent's side of table. All opponent's warriors are deploy +1.
front.lore: The Empire is too bureaucratic to deploy troops efficiently except under favorable circumstances. Rebel actions across the galaxy force Imperials to split their forces.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Retractable Arm
front.gametext: Deploy on any R-unit droid to give that droid thief skill. Once during each of your control phases, you may use 1 Force to target a weapon or device present. Draw destiny. If destiny > 2, target is 'stolen.' Target may then be transferred for free. Droid may not be Disarmed.
front.lore: 2 kilo lifting capacity and 85 meter reach. Better than 1 micrometer placement accuracy. Feisty Rebel droids can use this tool for sneaky purposes.

front.title: Return Of A Jedi
front.gametext: If Obi-Wan is lost, use 1 Force to retrieve him from the Lost Pile. OR Use 3 Force to search through your Reserve Deck and take Obi-Wan into your hand. Shuffle deck, cut and replace.
front.lore: 'Where did you dig up that old fossil?' 'I don't think he exists anymore.' 'Surely he must be dead by now.' 'I can't believe he's gone.' 'Oh, he's not dead, not yet.' Obi's back!

front.title: Return Of A Jedi (V)
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy (or retrieve) Obi-Wan, Obi-Wan's Cape, or Obi-Wan's Lightsaber from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Unless Inner Strength on table, use 1 Force to cancel a just drawn weapon destiny targeting Obi-Wan (or a just drawn duel or lightsaber combat destiny if Obi-Wan is participating).
front.lore: 'Where did you dig up that old fossil?' 'I don't think he exists anymore.' 'Surely he must be dead by now.' 'I can't believe he's gone.' 'Oh, he's not dead, not yet.' Obi's back!

front.title: Return Of The Jedi
front.gametext: Deploy on a site to cancel a Force drain there.  Skywalkers are power +1 here.  At end of your turn, place this Effect in Lost Pile.  OR  At any time, deploy on Sidious or [Virtual Block 3] Emperor.  Opponent's Interrupts with 'Emperor' in game text are canceled and Sidious may not place Jedi out of play. (Immune to Control.)
front.lore: 'The Emperor knew, as I did, if Anakin were to have any offspring, they would be a threat to him.'

front.title: •Reveal Ourselves To The Jedi
front.gametext: Use 5 Force to reveal opponent's hand. If opponent has no duplicate cards there, place this Interrupt in Used Pile. Otherwise USED: place a card revealed in opponent's Used Pile,LOST: all cards opponent has two or more of are lost. (Immune to Sense.)"
front.lore: Darth Maul was eager to make his presence known.

front.title: •Revealed
front.gametext: Place one opponent's Undercover spy in opponent's Used Pile. OR If opponent just deployed a spy to a site where opponent has no presence or Force icons, return spy to hand. Any Force used to deploy spy remains used and that card may not deploy this turn.
front.lore: 'Where am I?' 'Jabba's palace.' 'Who are you?'

front.title: Revolution
front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on any location. Rotate the location so that icons and game texts switch direction. (If Expand the Empire present, it also switches.) If Revolution later canceled, location rotates back again.
front.lore: Spies and informants gave Rebels vital data to plan strategic turnabouts, create local insurgencies, and hamper Imperial activities.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Revolution + any Hut Significant Force drain bonus.
canceledBy: Imperial Justice makes a location immune to Revolution
Set Your Course For Alderaan/The Ultimate Power In The Universe

front.title: •Rey
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything she pilots. When deployed, may take any card from Used Pile into hand; reshuffle. Your total battle destiny here is +1. Once per turn, may draw bottom card of your Force Pile. Immune to attrition < 3 (< 6 if on Jakku).
front.lore: Female scavenger.

front.title: •Rey (AI)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything she pilots. When deployed, may take any card from Used Pile into hand; reshuffle. Your total battle destiny here is +1. Once per turn, may draw bottom card of your Force Pile. Immune to attrition < 3 (< 6 if on Jakku).
front.lore: Female scavenger.

front.title: •Rey With Lightsaber
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots. Permanent weapon is •Anakin's Lightsaber (may target a character for free; draw two destiny; target hit, its forfeit = 0, and you may retrieve 1 Force, if total destiny > defense value).
front.lore: Female.

front.title: •Ric in Queen's Royal Starship
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 5 passengers. Permanent pilot is *Ric, who provides ability of 3. R2-D2 deploys -2 aboard. While We'll Need a New One on table, adds one battle destiny. Immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Chromium-plated, sleek transport ship used by the royalty of the Naboo. Spaceframe was designed around a J-type configuration.

front.title: •Ric Olie
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots (or adds 4 if Queen's Royal Starship). While piloting Queen's Royal Starship, once during a battle Ric is in, may use X Force to reduce attrition against you by X.
front.lore: Leader of Bravo Squadron. Piloted Amidala's Royal Starship from Naboo so that she could plead her case to the Senate. Was able to break the blockade with a little help.

combo: Ric Olie + Queen's Royal Starship

front.title: •Ric Olie, Bravo Leader
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting during a battle at a system where you have two piloted Bravo Squadron starfighters, adds two battle destiny.
front.lore: Leader of Bravo Squadron's attack on the Trade Federation Droid Control Ship at the Battle of Naboo. With the assistance of Anakin Skywalker, his squadron succeeded.

combo: Ric Olie, Bravo Leader + Bravo 1 + one other piloted Bravo Squadron starfighter Draws three battle destinies.

front.title: •R'kik D'nec, Hero Of The Dune Sea
front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Jawa weapons deploy free on R'kik, when firing one, may add up to 3 to the total weapon destiny just drawn. When he playing Dune Sea Sabacc and wins, wins double.
front.lore: A tribe of Tusken Raiders, a herd of angry banthas, a raging Krayt Dragon and R'kik. Minutes later, the Jawa emerged from the Dune Sea, a bantha tusk over his shoulder.

pulledBy: Aved Luun to deploy to same location

front.title: •R'kik D'nec, Hero Of The Dune Sea (V)
front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Once per game, may deploy Jawa Ion Gun (for free) on R'kik from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. When defending a battle at Dune Sea or a desert, and all your ability here is provided by Jawas, opponent may not draw battle destiny here.
front.lore: A tribe of Tusken Raiders, a herd of angry banthas, a raging Krayt Dragon and R'kik. Minutes later, the Jawa emerged from the Dune Sea, a bantha tusk over his shoulder.

front.title: •Roche
front.gametext: Light: : During your deploy phase, you may deploy Big One and/or Asteroid Cave to this system from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

pulls: Big One: Asteroid Cave or Space Slug Belly
combo: A New Secret Base (V) + Roche + Blue Squadron B-wing + Slayn & Korpil Facilities: Deploy -2 at any system and download a weapon when deployed

front.title: •Roche (V)
front.gametext: Light: : Unless opponent controls this system, Commence Primary Ignition may not target it.

front.title: •Rogue 1
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers. Immune to attrition < 3 if Luke piloting. May move as a 'react' only to Hoth sites.
front.lore: Designated Rogue Leader. Led snowspeeder attack during the Battle of Hoth. Enclosed. Piloted by Commander Skywalker, with Dack Ralter as tailgunner.

combo: Rogue 1 + Maneuvering Flaps (V)  Reveals one unpiloted combat vehicle from hand to take its matching pilot character from Reserve Deck (or vice versa) and deploys both.

front.title: •Rogue 2
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers. Immune to attrition < 3 if Zev piloting. May add 2 to search party destiny draw if all pilots aboard are part of that search party.
front.lore: Enclosed. First snowspeeder to be successfully adapted to Hoth's environment. Piloted by Zev Senesca. Led team in search of Captian Solo and Commander Skywalker.

combo: Rogue 2 + Maneuvering Flaps (V) Reveals one unpiloted combat vehicle from hand to take its matching pilot character from Reserve Deck (or vice versa) and deploys both.

front.title: •Rogue 3
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers. Immune to attrition < 3 if Wedge piloting. May move as a 'react' only to Hoth sites.
front.lore: Enclosed. Piloted by Commander Wedge Antilles. Successful walker tripper. Abandoned during the Rebel evacuation of Echo Base.

combo: Rogue 3 + Maneuvering Flaps (V) Reveals one unpiloted combat vehicle from hand to take its matching pilot character from Reserve Deck (or vice versa) and deploys both.

front.title: •Rogue 4
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers. May move as a 'react' only to Hoth sites. Dual Laser Cannon deploys and fires free aboard. Immune to attrition < 3 when Hobbie piloting.
front.lore: Enclosed snowspeeder piloted by Derek 'Hobbie' Klivian. Wingman of Rogue Leader at the Battle of Hoth. Laser cannons modified for improved recharge rate.

combo: Rogue 4 + Maneuvering Flaps (V) Reveals one unpiloted combat vehicle from hand to take its matching pilot character from Reserve Deck (or vice versa) and deploys both.

front.title: <>Rogue Asteroid
front.gametext: Deploy on an asteroid sector and specify starting direction. Every move phase, moves to next adjacent asteroid sector (reversing direction as necessary). Where present, adds 2 to asteroid destiny. May be targeted by starship weapons (defense value = 3).
front.lore: 'Considering the amount of damage we've sustained, they must have been destroyed.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Rogue Bantha
front.gametext: May add 2 'riders' (passengers). Bantha ability = 1/2. May move as a 'react.' Whenever a battle was just initiated at same site, one Tusken Raider present (your choice) is 'trampled' (immediately lost).
front.lore: Fled into the wilderness after mistreatment by a young Tusken Raider. Raised by moisture farmer. Friendly toward strangers, but attacks Tusken Raiders on sight.

combo: Rogue Bantha + Cal Alder

front.title: Rogue Gunner
front.gametext: Adds 1 to weapon destiny draws of anything he is aboard as a passenger.
front.lore: Tailgunners such as Kesin Ommis from Coruscant are posted to aft gunnery stations on vehicles and starships. Highly trained in weapons operations.

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

front.title: •Rogue Insertion
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Canceled if your Senate or [Reflections II] objective on table. Unless your character of ability > 4 at a site, Rogue Squadron pilots are power +1 (power +2 if ability < 3), and armor = 4. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Each Rebel soldier is driven by bravery and a belief in the Rebel Alliance's ideal of freedom. Courageous and quick-thinking Rebels often defeat Imperial legions.

front.title: •Rogue One
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 4 passengers. May deploy with a pilot to a system without presence or Force icons. Spies deploy -1 aboard. Immune to attrition < 6 at opponent system (unless a Dark Jedi here).

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Rogue Squadron Tactics
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per game, may take into hand one non-[Virtual Block 1] Alderaan or Dressel, and/or a [Death Star II] Rogue Squadron pilot (except Tycho) from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per turn, if you just Force drained at a battleground system, may draw top card of Reserve Deck. Immune to Alter.
front.lore: 'I'm going to cut across the axis and try and draw their fire.'

front.title: Rogue Squadron X-wing
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 1 astromech.  While Rebel Aces on table, pilot is forfeit +2 and this starship may not be lost before the damage segment of battle.  Matching starship for any Rogue Squadron pilot.

front.title: •Romas 'Lock' Navander
front.gametext: Adds 1 to power and maneuver of anything he pilots. Opponent may not 'react' to or from same location.
front.lore: Corellian pilot. Defected from the Empire shortly after graduation from the Academy. Tech communications officer at Echo Base. Relays orders to nearby Rebel starships.

front.title: •Romas 'Lock' Navander (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. During your deploy phase, if present with a scomp link, may deploy a battleground system on table from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. If at Echo Command Center, may use 1 Force to suspend 'Hoth Energy Shield Rules' until start of your next turn.
front.lore: Corellian pilot. Defected from the Empire shortly after graduation from the Academy. Tech communications officer at Echo Base. Relays orders to nearby Rebel starships.

front.title: •Romba
front.gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each Light side icon at same Endor site. When on Endor, adds 1 to your Force generation at each Endor site with an Ewok present.
front.lore: Proud Ewok scout. Defended his tribe against the Empire's war machines and stormtroopers.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.title: Ronto
front.gametext: May add 2 'riders' (passengers). Ability=1/4. When 'ridden' by a Jawa, moves for free and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: Creatures used as beasts of burden by Jawas. Tremendous strength makes them excellent pack animals. Very skittish around repulsorlift vehicles.

front.title: •Rose Tico
front.gametext: If Finn is about to be lost from same site, may place him in your Used Pile instead. During your control phase, if present at a battleground site, and another Resistance character on table (or Paige out of play), may retrieve 1 Force.
front.lore: Female.

front.title: Royal Naboo Security Officer
front.gametext: Power -1 while not on Naboo. While you have at least three other non-unique Royal Naboo Security Officers at related Naboo sites, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.
front.lore: The Royal Naboo Security Forces are used to protect Naboo's planetary rulers at all times. Commanded by Panaka, these volunteers have dedicated their lives to their homeland.

front.title: •Rug Hug
front.gametext: If Luke and Chewie are in a battle together, you may add two battle destiny. OR If you have a Rebel and an alien in a battle together, you may add 4 to power only.
front.lore: Wookiees are known to be creatures of great emotion and are very protective of family and friends. Chewbacca has come to treat Luke as a member of his own family.

front.title: •Rug Hug (V)
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to move one of your characters as a 'react' to a battle opponent just initiated. OR If Luke (or a Jedi) and your alien are in battle together, add one battle destiny. OR Once per game, activate X Force, where X = the number of aliens you have on table.
front.lore: Wookiees are known to be creatures of great emotion and are very protective of family and friends. Chewbacca has come to treat Luke as a member of his own family.

front.title: •Run Luke, Run!
front.gametext: At any time, move Luke as a regular move (using landspeed for free) to a battle just initiated at an adjacent site. Luke is power +2 during that battle, unless Vader is present or adjacent to the battle site. OR You may cancel Vader's Obsession.
front.lore: After seeing Vader strike down Obi-Wan, Luke attacked recklessly until he heard the old Jedi Master's voice warn, 'Run Luke, Run!'

combo: Run Luke, Run! + Son Of Skywalker

front.title: •Run Luke, Run! (V)
front.gametext: USED: During battle, if Obi-Wan out of play, cancel an attempt to target a Rebel with a weapon.  LOST: During battle at a site, place non-[Episode I] Obi Wan out of play (even from hand); Your other characters there may move away for free."
front.lore: After seeing Vader strike down Obi-Wan, Luke attacked recklessly until he heard the old Jedi Master's voice warn, 'Run Luke, Run!'

front.title: Rycar Ryjerd
front.gametext: Deploy on your non-smuggler to give that character smuggler skill. OR Deploy on your smuggler. That character is power +1. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: A Bimm trader and smuggler of starship weapons. Trusts no one. Does business with anyone. Teaches smuggler apprentices. Has mastered Jawa language.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Rycar Ryjerd (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. If your character is about to be lost from table, place all devices and Effects on that character in owner's Used Pile. Twice per game, may take a device (or an Effect) that deploys on a character into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: A Bimm trader and smuggler of starship weapons. Trusts no one. Does business with anyone. Teaches smuggler apprentices. Has mastered Jawa language.

front.title: •Rycar's Run
front.gametext: Deploy on a Big One. X = twice the number of asteroid sectors at that system. Target a starfighter at related planet system. When reached by target, relocate Utinni Effect to planet system. When target returns to system, lose Utinni Effect. Retrieve X Force.
front.lore: The infamous smuggler Rycar Ryjerd does this all the time. He's an idiot.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Ryle Torsyn
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Gold 3 during battle, adds one destiny to total power only. When at Dantooine system, adds 1 to each of your Force drains there.
front.lore: Piloted Gold 3 at the Battle of Yavin. Recruited by Garven Dreis. Found hidden Imperial tracking device that forced the evacuation of Rebel base on Dantooine.

front.title: •S-foils
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once during each of your control phases, may use 1 Force: until beginning of your next turn, each of your X-wings and B-wings is power +2 and hyperspeed=0, and adds 1 to each weapon destiny. (Immune to Alter if Red Leader on table.)
front.lore: 'Lock S-foils in attack position.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •S-foils (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on a Rebel Base system.  Each time you deploy a Rebel starfighter simultaneously with a pilot character, may retrieve 1 Force and/or draw top card from Reserve Deck.  Suspended if Death Star 'blown away.' (Immune to Alter and Crossfire while you occupy this system.)
front.lore: 'Lock S-foils in attack position.'

front.title: •Sabe
front.gametext: While at same site as Amidala, Sabe is power +2 and Amidala is immune to attrition. When at a site, during your deploy phase may place Sabe out of play to deploy Amidala to that site (for free) from your Reserve Deck (reshuffle) or Lost Pile.
front.lore: Female chosen as a handmaiden by Panaka due to her resemblance to Amidala. Trained to play the role of the Queen whenever it is considered that Amidala may be at risk.

front.title: •Sabine Wren
front.gametext: Once per turn, when firing a blaster or rifle, may target for free and add 2 to total weapon destiny. While with an Imperial (or two Rebels), whenever you win a battle here, opponent loses 2 Force. Immune to Hidden Weapons.
front.lore: Female Mandalorian. Scout.

front.title: •Sabotage
front.gametext: During your control phase, target one weapon, device or vehicle at same site as your Undercover spy. Draw destiny. If destiny > target's deploy cost, target is lost (may be stolen instead if spy also a thief). OR Cancel Informant.
front.lore: Poorly equipped Rebels must rely on clandestine strikes against the massive Imperial military. Computer 'slicing' and system tampering have proven most effective.

combo: Sabotage + Boushh
Sabotage + TK-422

front.title: •Sabotage (V)
front.gametext: Target an opponent's device or non-superlaser weapon card. Draw destiny. Target lost if destiny -X < target's destiny number, where X = the number of your spies on table. OR Cancel the targeting of a [Permanent Weapon] weapon at same site as your spy.
front.lore: Poorly equipped Rebels must rely on clandestine strikes against the massive Imperial military. Computer 'slicing' and system tampering have proven most effective.

front.title: •Sabotage (V)
front.gametext: Target an opponent's non-superlaser weapon card. Draw destiny. Subtract 1 if your spy on table. Target lost if total destiny < target's destiny number. OR Cancel an attempt to use a [Permanent Weapon] weapon to target your spy (or any card with your spy).
front.lore: Poorly equipped Rebels must rely on clandestine strikes against the massive Imperial military. Computer 'slicing' and system tampering have proven most effective.

cancels: The targeting of a permanent weapon at same site as your spy

front.title: •Sache
front.gametext: While at same site as Amidala, Sache is power +2 and Amidala is defense value +2. If just lost during a battle, may use 2 Force to take Sache into hand.
front.lore: Handmaiden chosen by Captain Panaka for her strength and loyalty to Naboo. Willing to protect the Queen, even with her life.

front.title: •Saelt-Marae
front.gametext: During battle, if an opponent's alien present, may use 3 Force to peek at top card of any Reserve Deck. While at Audience Chamber, all your other Yarkora are power and forfeit +2.
front.lore: Male Yarkora. Mysterious member of Jabba's court. Posing as an alien artifact trader. Associates with the B'omarr monks at Jabba's palace. No one knows his true motivations.

combo: Saelt-Marae + Kal'Falnl C'ndros

front.title: Sai'torr Kal Fas
front.gametext: Deploy on your non-warrior character (except droids) to give that character [Warrior] skill. OR Deploy on your warrior. That character is power +1. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Saurin female from planet Durkteel. Bodyguard of Hrchek, a Saurin droid trader. Sai'torr will teach battle skills to those who prove themselves worthy.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Sai'torr Kal Fas (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per turn, may / a matching weapon on your unique (•) character present at a site. [Immune to Alter.]
front.lore: Saurin female from planet Durkteel. Bodyguard of Hrchek, a Saurin droid trader. Sai'torr will teach battle skills to those who prove themselves worthy.

front.title: Sai'torr Kal Fas (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. During your deploy phase, if you just deployed a unique (•) character, may deploy a matching weapon on that character from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Saurin female from planet Durkteel. Bodyguard of Hrchek, a Saurin droid trader. Sai'torr will teach battle skills to those who prove themselves worthy.

pulls: A matching weapon on a just deployed character
pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Sandcrawler
front.gametext: Deploys only to a Tatooine site. May add 1 driver and 7 passengers. May relocate only to planet sites. Adds 1 to forfeit of each Jawa at same exterior site.
front.lore: Warren-like enclosed homes for Jawa tribes. Protects against Tatooine predators. Originally mining vehicles. Jawas claimed them when mines abandoned. No two look alike.

front.title: Sandcrawler (V)
front.gametext: Permanent driver provides no ability. May add 7 passengers. Jawas at same site are power +1 and forfeit +2. During your deploy phase, may deploy a Jawa here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Warren-like enclosed homes for Jawa tribes. Protects against Tatooine predators. Originally mining vehicles. Jawas claimed them when mines abandoned. No two look alike.

front.title: •••Sandcrawler: Loading Bay
front.gametext: Light: : Deploy on your sandcrawler. Each Jawa is forfeit +2 here. 'Nighttime conditions' here.

front.title: •Sando Aqua Monster
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Cancels Opee Sea Killer and Colo Claw Fish. While no card here, you may draw destiny and place it face-up here. If you are about to draw a card for weapon or battle destiny, you may instead use card here, then place it in Lost Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The sando aqua monster is quite a mystery to Naboo oceanographers. A reclusive predator by nature, this undersea giant appears to have no natural enemies.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Sandspeeder
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. May move as a 'react' to Tatooine or desert sites.
front.lore: Enclosed Incom T-47 airspeeder adapted for use in hot, dry conditions. Maximum speed 600 kilometers per hour. Drive section left exposed for easier maintenance.

front.title: <>Sandwhirl
front.gametext: Deploy on a Desert. Specify starting direction. All characters (except Jawas and Tusken Raiders) present at same non-interior site are missing. During your control phase, moves to next adjacent site (reversing directions as necessary), but lost if at an interior site.
front.lore: Jawa shamans often predict when and where a sandstorm is going to take place. Even when caught in such a storm, the Jawas know how to avoid misfortune.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Sandwhirl + Kitonaks

front.title: •••Saurin
front.gametext: At any time, may use 1 Force to remove (lose) a Restraining Bolt at same site. Receives an extra power +1 when 'protected' by Sai'torr Kal Fas.
front.lore: Hrchek Kal Fas, a male Saurin from Durkteel, is a typical droid trader. Scours the 'invisible market' for the best droid prices. Guarded by his cousin Sai'torr.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: •Saw Gerrera
front.gametext: Attrition against opponent is +1 here for each of their characters present. Opponent may not reduce your Force drains here. Once per game, if in battle with an Imperial or Rebel, may lose top card of Reserve Deck to cancel a non-[Immune to Sense] Interrupt.
front.lore: Leader.

front.title: Scanner Techs
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Radar Scanner is immune to Sense. If Radar Scanner is played against an opponent who has more than 13 cards in hand, opponent loses all Jawas, Tusken Raiders and stormtroopers found there.
front.lore: Specialized scanner technicians examine scanner output to identify the presence of life forms. Experienced operators can even identify species and gender.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Scanner Techs (V)
