front.gametext: Deploy on table. During opponent's move phase, may use 3 Force to peek at opponent's hand or place a Political Effect (and all cards on it) in owner's Used Pile. Unless you have 13 or more cards in hand, opponent may not place those cards in Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Specialized scanner technicians examine scanner output to identify the presence of life forms. Experienced operators can even identify species and gender.

front.title: •Scarif
front.gametext: Light: : While Rogue One is piloted by a Rebel here, it is immune to attrition.

front.title: •Scarif: Beach
front.gametext: Light: : Your combat vehicles, scouts, and spies are each power +1 here. Force drain +1 here.

front.title: •Scarif: Data Vault
front.gametext: Light: : While opponent occupies, Stardust (and any character it is on) may not move from here.

front.title: •Scarif: Landing Pad Nine (Docking Bay)
front.gametext: Light: : Your docking bay transit to or from here requires +1 Force (+4 Force if Shield Gate on table).

front.title: •Scarif: Turbolift Complex
front.gametext: Light: : During your move phase, may move free between here and any related site.

front.title: Scomp Link Access
front.gametext: If one of your 'R' unit droids is at any Scomp link, you may: glance at the cards in any Reserve Deck for 20 seconds. Shuffle, cut and replace. OR If also at a Death Star site, cancel We're All Gonna Be A Lot Thinner or Boring Conversation Anyway.
front.lore: A computer connection access port used mainly by droids to plug into database networks and locate information, evaluate threats, execute diagnostics or perform maintenance.

cancels: We're All Gonna Be A Lot Thinner!

front.title: Scomp Link Access (V)
front.gametext: USED: Take a non-[Episode I] droid (except IL-19) into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Place a card from hand on Used Pile.  STARTING: Deploy from Reserve Deck two always [Immune to Alter] Effects. If you have only one location (with less than 3 [Light Side Force]) (except Massassi Throne Room) on table, may deploy a [Cloud City] site. Place this Interrupt in hand.
front.lore: A computer connection access port used mainly by droids to plug into database networks and locate information, evaluate threats, execute diagnostics or perform maintenance.

cards.conceptBy: (Original Concept by Mike Tomashweski - PC Volunteer Award 2006)"

front.title: •Scoundrel's Bravado
front.gametext: Deploy from under Scoundrel's Luck on a scoundrel. Scoundrel (or starship they pilot) is defense value +2 and immune to attrition <5 (or adds 2 to immunity). Once per turn may lose 1 Force to add a battle destiny anywhere (you draw no more than two battle destiny there).
front.lore: Blank

front.title: •Scoundrel's Charm
front.gametext: Deploy from under Scoundrel's Luck on a scoundrel. Once per turn, may peek at the top 3 cards of your Force pile and take one into hand; reshuffle. Once per turn, may use 1 Force to add or subtract 1 from an opponent's just-drawn destiny.
front.lore: Sarcastic, Sardonic, Irreverent. Impertinent. Exasperating. Disrespectful. Outrageous and charming. Han was a scoundrel but Leia began to realize that she loved him.

front.title: •Scoundrel's Ingenuity
front.gametext: Deploy from under Scoundrel's Luck on a scoundrel. Scoundrel is power +2 and adds 1 to his total weapon destiny. During your control phase, may draw destiny. If destiny > 3, your Force drains at same and related locations are +1 for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Blank

front.title: •Scoundrel's Luck
front.gametext: Deploy on Infiltration with three [Scoundrel] cards from Reserve Deck face down under here. Once during your turn, at any time, may deploy a [Scoundrel] Effect from here. If a [Scoundrel] Effect just left table, stack it under here. At the start of your turn, stack all [Scoundrel] Effects under here. Once per turn, may place any card in Lost Pile out of play to deploy a character weapon (except a grenade) from Lost Pile. While two non-droid scoundrels present at battlegrounds, Their Fire Has Gone Out Of The Universe flips and may not flip back. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'You said you wanted to be around when I made a mistake, well, this could be it, sweetheart.'

front.title: •Scramble
front.gametext: Deploy on opponent's side of table. Opponent's pilots (except Vader) present at sites may not use ability to draw battle destiny. Effect canceled when opponent has no pilots at sites.
front.lore: Pilots at ground bases throughout the Empire were immediately recalled to their ships to assist in the capture of the Rebels fleeing Echo Base on Hoth.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Scrambled Transmission
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Shocking Information is immune to Sense. Any interrupt that examines cards in your Used or Force Pile is lost. Once during each of your control phases, may take one Shocking Information into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Rebel Alliance employs sophisticated jamming technology to block Imperial communications.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Scrambled Transmission (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Unless you have 13 or more cards in hand, opponent may not peek at or remove those cards (except with Monnok). Once per turn, may take Logistical Delay into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle, peek at a card placed face down by You're A Slave?, or lose 2 Force to cancel a Political Effect. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Rebel Alliance employs sophisticated jamming technology to block Imperial communications.

front.title: Scurrier
front.gametext: Habitat: planet sites. Landspeed=2. Ferocity +2 when present at Mos Eisley or any _ spaceport site.
front.lore: Considered to be a nuisance. Feeds on garbage. Its only defense is its speed. Nasty bite attack when surprised or cornered. Grow as big as 1.2 meters long.

combo: Clipbrd

front.title: Secure Route
front.gametext: Deploy on a docking bay you control. No Force drains here. Trample may not target a character at this site. Your Force drains are +2 at adjacent non-docking bay battleground sites. Place Effect in Used Pile if opponent controls this location.
front.lore: Maintaining unimpeded control of vital transportation channels can strengthen and secure surrounding areas.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Security Breach
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Cancels game text of [Reflections III] Naboo sites.  Unless present with 3 other characters, Derdram's and Ephant Mon's game texts are canceled.  Once per game, may place this Effect out of play to reduce your battle damage by 4. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Rebellion's limited resources force it to consider the wisdom of any military encounter. In many cases, retreat or deception is a preferable recourse.

front.title: •Security Control
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Your unique (•) Republic characters of ability < 4 are forfeit +2. Unless Insurrection on table, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one docking bay from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Actions borne of the love for one's planet can heavily outweigh those generated from simple battle orders.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •See You Around, Kid
front.gametext: Cancel a just-deployed First Order character's game text until end of turn. OR Destiny draws during battles at sites may not be canceled this turn. OR During any draw phase, place a card from hand under Used Pile to take any one card into hand from Force Pile; reshuffle.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •See-Threepio
front.gametext: Deploys only to a Jabba's Palace site. Once per game, when replacing another C-3PO, retrieve 3 Force. When in battle with your other droid and a Rebel, adds one battle destiny. R2-D2 deploys and moves for free to same location.
front.lore: C-3PO was Jabba's 'khan chita,' or translator. Survived more battles than most members of the Alliance. Wasn't informed of R2-D2's role in the rescue of Han.

front.title: •See-Threepio (V)
front.gametext: Unless Jabba on table: you must first use 3 Force to play How Did We Get Into This Mess?; and, once per turn, if with R2-D2 at a Jabba's Palace site, may place your hand in Used Pile to draw the same number of cards from Reserve Deck.
front.lore: C-3PO was Jabba's 'khan chita,' or translator. Survived more battles than most members of the Alliance. Wasn't informed of R2-D2's role in the rescue of Han.

front.title: •Seeking An Audience
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once during each of your turns, may deploy one Underworld Contacts, [JP] Lando, [JP] Leia, R2-D2, or C-3PO from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Also, while Luke is at a Jabba's Palace site, opponent's aliens there must use +1 Force to use their landspeed.
front.lore: 'With your wisdom, I'm sure that we can work out an arrangement which will be mutually beneficial and enable us to avoid any unpleasant confrontation.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
You Will Take Me To Jabba Now (V)

front.title: •Seeking An Audience (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Once per turn, while You Can Either Profit By This... or Or Be Destroyed on table, may use 2 Force to deploy one C-3PO, Chewie, Lando, Leia, or R2-D2 from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  Once per game, may place this Effect out of play to take a character from Lost Pile into hand. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'With your wisdom, I'm sure that we can work out an arrangement which will be mutually beneficial and enable us to avoid any unpleasant confrontation.'

cards.conceptBy: (Original Concept by Brian Fred - DPC Chicago 2002 Runner-Up)

front.title: •Seeking An Audience (V)
front.gametext: If a Jabba's Palace site on table, deploy on table. His Name Is Anakin is canceled. Once per turn, if Han frozen, may use 2 Force to deploy a non-[Reflections 3]: C-3PO, Chewie, Lando, Leia or R2-D2 from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per game, may place this Effect out of play to retrieve an alien or [Independent] starship into hand. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'With your wisdom, I'm sure that we can work out an arrangement which will be mutually beneficial and enable us to avoid any unpleasant confrontation.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Sei Taria
front.gametext: Agendas: peace, taxation. If with Valorum, your Force generation at this location is +1. While in a senate majority, your Force drains are +1 at battleground systems while you control a battleground site.
front.lore: Valorum's female administrative aide who has studied the taxation bills. After Valorum was voted out of his position as Chancellor, Sei chose to leave political life.

combo: Sei Taria + Might Of The Republic

front.title: •Senate Hovercam
front.gametext: Deploy on Galactic Senate. Amidala is politics +1 here. While you have a senate majority, your Force generation here is +3. Place Effect in Lost Pile if opponent controls this location.
front.lore: Senate hovercams report back to Chancellor Valorum at the conclusion of a Senate session. Mysteriously, the droid monitoring Amidala in the Senate never reported back.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Senator Jar Jar Binks
front.gametext: Agendas: justice, order. At same and related sites, vehicle weapon destiny draws are -2. Once per turn, may deploy an electropole, a [Coruscant] Naboo location, or a [Theed Palace] vehicle from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. If at Senate, may place Jar Jar and a [Coruscant] Political Effect out of play.
front.lore: Gungan.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Brian Herold - Minnesota States 2006)"

front.title: •Senator Jar Jar Binks (AI)
front.gametext: Agendas: justice, order. At same and related sites, vehicle weapon destiny draws are -2. Once per turn, may deploy an electropole, a [Coruscant] Naboo location, or a [Theed Palace] vehicle from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. If at Senate, may place Jar Jar and a [Coruscant] Political Effect out of play.
front.lore: Gungan.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Brian Herold - Minnesota States 2006)"

front.title: •Senator Leia Organa
front.gametext: Agendas: justice, rebellion. When deployed, may play a Defensive Shield from under your Starting Effect (as if from hand). While aboard Alderaan Consular Ship, it is Immune to Lateral Damage and attrition. Attrition against opponent is +2 here.
front.lore: Adopted by Bail Organa. Former senator of Alderaan. Natural leader. Helped steal the Death Star plans. A key figure in the Rebel Alliance.

front.title: •Senator Mon Mothma
front.gametext: Agendas: order, peace.  Emperor may not target characters with politics here.  Once per turn, if in a senate majority, may take your just drawn battle destiny into hand.  Once per game, may deploy a battleground (except Endor system) from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Native of Chandrila. Leader of the Alliance. A former member of the Imperial Senate where she was a formidable opponent of then-Senator Palpatine. Friend of Bail Organa.

cards.conceptBy: (Original Concept by Brandon Schele - World Champion 2004)

front.title: •Senator Mon Mothma
front.gametext: Agenda: rebellion. Deploys -1 aboard your capital starship. Once per turn, while in a senate majority (or Stolen Data Tapes on table), may take your just drawn battle destiny into hand. Once per game, may / Chandrila.
front.lore: Native of Chandrila. Leader of the Alliance. A former member of the Imperial Senate where she was a formidable opponent of then-Senator Palpatine. Friend of Bail Organa.

combo: Mon Mothma + Chandrila Mon Mothma deploys -2 at any Chandrila location.

front.title: •Senator Padme Amidala
front.gametext: Agendas: justice, rebellion. Once per turn, if at Senate with Bail, may lose 1 Force to deploy a unique (•), non-[Maintenance] Rebel of ability < 4 from Lost Pile. If just lost from same site as Vader, place her out of play; opponent loses 4 Force.
front.lore: Leader. Senator.

front.title: •Senator Palpatine
front.gametext: Agendas: ambition, peace, order. While in a senate majority, once per turn, if opponent just drew battle destiny, use 1 Force to add its destiny number to your total power in that battle (you may not cancel that draw). Amidala is politics +1 here.
front.lore: Senator for the Naboo. Advised Amidala on actions required to highlight their conflict with the Trade Federation. Watches young Skywalker's future with great interest.

combo: (Might Of The Republic +) Senator Palpatine + I've Decided To Go Back

front.title: •Senator Palpatine (AI)
front.gametext: Agendas: ambition, peace, order. While in a senate majority, once per turn, if opponent just drew battle destiny, use 1 Force to add its destiny number to your total power in that battle (you may not cancel that draw). Amidala is politics +1 here.
front.lore: Senator for the Naboo. Advised Amidala on actions required to highlight their conflict with the Trade Federation. Watches young Skywalker's future with great interest.

front.title: Sense
front.gametext: If opponent just played an Interrupt (or just initiated a 'react'), target one of your characters on table. Draw destiny. If destiny < ability of target, that Interrupt (or 'react') is canceled. OR Cancel Alter.
front.lore: Yoda calls upon the Force often to try and foresee what destiny has in store.

front.title: Sense
front.gametext: Cancel one Interrupt (or one 'react') by drawing a destiny < ability of your highest-ability character on table. OR Cancel one Alter card just played.
front.lore: Users of the Force can sense impending danger by feeling the way the Force flows in others. Cataclysmic events can be sensed (as when Obi- Wan felt Alderaan's destruction).

front.title: Sense & Recoil In Fear
front.gametext: USED: Target your highest-ability character and one just-played Interrupt. Draw destiny. If destiny < ability of target character, cancel target Interrupt.  LOST: Use 3 Force. Each player places hand onto Reserve Deck (if possible), then places Used Pile onto Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Each player then draws cards from Reserve Deck equal to the number of cards just placed from hand onto Reserve Deck (if any)."

front.title: •Sensor Panel
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your non-creature vehicle. Adds 1 to power and landspeed. Once per turn, when you play Radar Scanner, you may use 1 Force to move one additional Effect or Interrupt card found in opponent's hand to Used Pile.
front.lore: Monitors all nearby traffic in exterior locations. Takes advantage of multiple backup systems to minimize breakdowns under harsh conditions.

combo: Sensor Panel + Radar Scanner

front.title: •Sergeant Brooks Carlson
front.gametext: Landspeed=2. Allows your other scouts present at same exterior site to move with him (using landspeed=2) for free. Adds 1 to immunity to attrition of all your scouts present at same exterior site who have immunity.
front.lore: Veteran pathfinder. Defected with General Madine. Recruited as a Scout for the newly-formed commando unit.

front.title: •Sergeant Bruckman
front.gametext: When opponent has just initiated a battle at same exterior site and all your ability here is provided by scouts, may reveal top card of Reserve Deck. If that card is a scout, may deploy it here for free (otherwise, replace on top of Reserve Deck).
front.lore: Corellian Scout who served as point man for General Solo's strike team. Recruited by General Madine for the Alliance commando unit.

front.title: •Sergeant Doallyn
front.gametext: When Doallyn is on Tatooine, Tusken Breath Mask may target one of your characters on Tatooine, is immune to Alter, is not unique, doubles its power and forfeit bonuses and provides protection from Gravel Storm and Sandwhirl.
front.lore: Humanoid mercenary. Gambler. Blackmailed into working for Jabba. Friend of Yarna d'al' Gargan. Expert in breathing apparatus. Needs Hydron 3 cartridges to breathe.

combo: Sergeant Doallyn + Sandwhirl

front.title: •Sergeant Doallyn (V)
front.gametext: Heroic. Smuggler. When deployed, may play a Defensive Shield from under your Starting Effect (as if from hand). Vibro-Ax is a matching weapon for (and deploys for free on) Doallyn, and when using it, it fires for free. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Humanoid mercenary. Gambler. Blackmailed into working for Jabba. Friend of Yarna d'al' Gargan. Expert in breathing apparatus. Needs Hydron 3 cartridges to breathe.

front.title: •Sergeant Edian
front.gametext: Deploys free on Cloud City if your Lando is at a related location. Power +2 on Cloud City. When in a battle at a Cloud City site, adds 1 to your total battle destiny for each of your other Cloud City troopers in that battle.
front.lore: Veteran of the Cloud City security forces. Loyal to Administrator Calrissian. Disdainful of the corruption of other Cloud City troopers.

front.title: •Sergeant Edian (V)
front.gametext: Deploys free to Cloud City. Power +2 in battles you initiate. While present at a battleground, if you just drew an alien (or [Independent] starship for destiny anywhere, may take that card into hand to cancel and redraw that destiny.
front.lore: Veteran of the Cloud City security forces. Loyal to Administrator Calrissian. Disdainful of the corruption of other Cloud City troopers.

front.title: •Sergeant Hollis
front.gametext: When in battle with another Echo Base trooper, adds one battle destiny. Once during each of your control phases, may take one Rebel Ambush into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Power -1 when not on Hoth.
front.lore: Trooper stationed at Echo Base during the Battle of Hoth. Distinguished himself with several acts of valor, earning the Kenobi Medallion.

front.title: •Sergeant Junkin
front.gametext: When at Bunker, adds 1 to Deactivate The Shield Generator total for each Explosive Charge here. When Junkin uses a Concussion Grenade, all your characters are immune to that grenade and you may add or subtract 1 from weapon destiny draw.
front.lore: Demolitions expert and scout. Supervises explosives preparations for covert operations. Consulted with General Madine to plan placement of explosives within control bunker.

front.title: •Shasa Tiel
front.gametext: Power +1 at any swamp. During opponent's control phase, may use 3 Force to examine the cards in opponent's Force Pile, reorder however you wish and replace. While at Audience Chamber, all your other Ishi Tibs are power and forfeit +2.
front.lore: Ishi Tib accountant. One of Mosep's assistants. Formerly worked for SoroSuub Inc. Blackmailed into working for Jabba. Hates her job. Searching for a means of escape.

combo: Shasa Tiel + Frozen Assets

front.title: •Shawn Valdez
front.gametext: Whenever you just initiated a battle at same site as Shawn, your troopers at adjacent sites who have not already battled this turn may immediately move to same site (as a regular move).
front.lore: Experienced evacuation officer. Charismatic leader of Echo Base troopers. Trained to expedite the evacuation of Rebel installations with maximum efficiency. Poetic musician.

front.title: •••Shistavanen Wolfman
front.gametext: May move to an adjacent site as a 'react'.
front.lore: Lak Sivrak is a typical Shistavanen male. Ferocious, but not aggressive. Often trained as scouts at Imperial academies, but they despise the ambitions of the New Order.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: •Shmi Skywalker
front.gametext: Deploys for free to Slave Quarters. Once per game may take [Tatooine] Threepio into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While in a battle at a site, subtracts one from each of opponent's battle destiny draws.
front.lore: Mother of Anakin Skywalker. As Anakin grew, Shmi realized her son was special. Did her best to hide his abilities from Watto.

combo: Shmi + Threepio With His Parts Showing Destiny tracking never so easy.

front.title: •Shocking Information
front.gametext: Target a location. Scomp links there cannot be used for remainder of turn. OR If opponent is about to scan or otherwise look through your hand (unless using Monnok), opponent continues but must lose 4 Force plus the card allowing the scan.
front.lore: 'R2-D2, you know better than to trust a strange computer.'

combo: Shocking Information + Destiny adders

front.title: •Shocking Information & •Grimtaash
front.gametext: USED: Target a location. Scomp links there cannot be used for remainder of turn. OR If opponent is about to scan or otherwise look through your hand (unless using Monnok), opponent continues but must lose 4 Force plus card allowing scan. OR If opponent has 13 or more cards in hand, place all but 8 (random selection) in Used Pile.  LOST: Use 4 Force to reveal opponent's hand. All cards opponent has two or more of in hand are lost."

front.title: •Shocking Information (V)
front.gametext: Unless you have a senate majority, if opponent just took a character into hand from Reserve Deck, deployed a character from Reserve Deck (except with an Effect with 'matching' in game text), or just drew a card from Reserve Deck using a character's game text, they must place 2 other cards from hand on Used Pile (if possible).
front.lore: 'R2-D2, you know better than to trust a strange computer.'

front.title: •Shoo! Shoo!
front.gametext: If you have a droid on table: Cancel an attack just initiated by a creature. OR Immediately move one opponent's creature (except an attached creature) to an adjacent location (habitat permitting).
front.lore: 'Oh! Go away! Go away! Beastly thing!'

canceledBy: Shut Him Up Or Shut Him Down
cancels: An attack just initiated by a creature

front.title: •Shoo! Shoo! (V)
front.gametext: Relocate an opponent's ferocious creature to a related location (habitat permitting). OR During any move phase, initiate an attack against a creature. OR Cancel an attempt by Reegesk to steal a card; Reegesk is lost. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: 'Oh! Go away! Go away! Beastly thing!'

front.title: Sic-Six
front.gametext: Subtracts 2 from forfeit of each opponent's pilots at same site. Prevents characters from moving to or from same or adjacent sites using Elis Helrot or Nabrun Leids.
front.lore: Gifted engineers. Sic-six believe their technology is superior. Have a poison stinger. Spin vast and intricate webs which create a hazard for landing starships. Avoided by pilots.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: •Simple Tricks And Nonsense
front.gametext: Plays on table.  While you occupy a battleground and opponent occupies less than two battlegrounds, cancel opponent's Force drains at non-battleground locations and opponent's Force retrieval.
front.lore: 'Et tu taka bu Jabba now.'

front.title: •Simple Tricks And Nonsense
front.gametext: Plays on table.  While you occupy a battleground and opponent occupies less than two battlegrounds, cancel opponent's Force drains at non-battleground locations and opponent's Force retrieval.
front.lore: 'Et tu taka bu Jabba now.'

front.title: •Sio Bibble
front.gametext: Agenda: order. While at same site as Amidala, your Force generation is +2 here. While on Naboo, subtracts one from opponent's Force drains at adjacent sites, and your other Republic characters present are power +1.
front.lore: Governor of Naboo. After initially opposing Amidala in her campaign to become Naboo's elected ruler, Sio Bibble is now one of her most ardent supporters.

front.title: Size Matters Not
front.gametext: Deploy on Dagobah: Swamp or Dagobah: Bog Clearing. Target a mentor on Dagobah and an apprentice who has completed Jedi Test #3. Attempt when apprentice is present at the beginning of your control phase. Draw training destiny. If destiny + apprentice's ability > 15, test completed: Place on apprentice. Immune to attrition < 3. Once during each of your control phases, you may use 2 Force to search your Reserve Deck and take any one card you find there into hand. Shuffle, cut and replace.

front.title: Skiff
front.gametext: Deploy -1 to a Tatooine site. May add 1 driver and 5 passengers. May move as a 'react.' If lost, any characters aboard may 'jump off' (disembark).
front.lore: Top speed of 250 kph. Repulsorlift engine. Equipped with two electromagnetic load lifters. Frequently used by shipping companies to transfer cargo between freighters.

front.title: •Skull
front.gametext: During a battle or attack, place out of play one non-droid character, creature or creature vehicle from your Lost Pile. Add its destiny number to your total power. OR Search your Reserve Deck, take Fallen Portal or Blast the Door, Kid! into hand and reshuffle.
front.lore: Bidlo Kwerve was involved in both the procurement and (posthumously) the loss of the rancor.

combo: Skull + Fallen Portal -- This combo is obvious, but is very helpful. Fallen Portal is a powerful card, especially if you can lure your opponent into one of the sites mentioned on the card. With the low-ability aliens running around, Fallen Portal can be a surprisingly effective way of taking out your opponent's characters.

front.title: •Skull (V)
front.gametext: During opponent's control phase, your pack attacks. Weapons may only target the lead creature. Pack may then move to an adjacent site. OR If a card was just 'eaten,' card's owner loses 2 Force. OR Use 3 Force to retrieve a creature.
front.lore: Bidlo Kwerve was involved in both the procurement and (posthumously) the loss of the rancor.

front.title: •Skywalkers
front.gametext: If Luke and Leia are in a battle together, you may add two battle destiny OR Cancel Imperial Barrier or Wrong Turn or Retract The Bridge.
front.lore: Luke and Leia escaped to an unused portion of the Death Star, evading security checkpoints. At a retracted bridge, they swung across on a grappling line through enemy fire.

front.title: •Slayn & Korpil Facilities
front.gametext: Deploy on Roche system. Once during each of your deploy phases, you may deploy a starship weapon from Reserve Deck on your B-wing; reshuffle. Also, retrieve 2 Force whenever your starfighter or vehicle 'hits' an opponent's starship or vehicle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Based in the Roche Asteroid Field. Worked with Admiral Ackbar to develop the B-wing fighter. Verpine owned, and that means quality.

pulls: A starship weapon on your B-wing
pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Slight Weapons Malfunction
front.gametext: If your weapon (except a lightsaber) was just fired during a battle, add one battle destiny.
front.lore: Han was gifted in the art of understatement.

combo: Starfighter or Vehicle + Rapid Fire + Slight Weapons Malfunction

front.title: •Smoke Screen
front.gametext: During a battle at a site, if you are about to draw a card for battle destiny, you may instead use the ability number of one of your characters involved in the battle.
front.lore: Warning: The Alderaanian Medical Association has determined that inhaling carbon-freezing smoke can be hazardous to your health.

combo: Smoke Screen + any high-ability character

front.title: •Smuggler's Blues
front.gametext: Deploy on a smuggler. May use 2 Force to cancel Limited Resources. Also, if 'trained' by Rycar Ryjerd and piloting as starship when that starship completes Kessel Run, Rycar's Run or The First Transport Is Away, any retrieved Force may be taken into hand.
front.lore: It's the lure of easy credits. It's got a very strong appeal. Perhaps you'd understand better wearing my flight suit. It's the ultimate special modification, it's the smuggler's blues.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Smuggler's Blues (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Opponent may not cancel or modify Force drains at any battleground where you have two musicians or two smugglers (or one of each). Once per turn, may take Han's Back, Han's Dice, Solo Han, Special Modifications, or Stay Sharp! into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: It's the lure of easy credits. It's got a very strong appeal. Perhaps you'd understand better wearing my flight suit. It's the ultimate special modification, it's the smuggler's blues.

front.title: Snivvian
front.gametext: May deploy as a 'react'. Power +2 under 'nighttime conditions'. When at a site, if opponent cancels Nightfall on related system, causes Effect to go to Used Pile and may retrieve 2 Force.
front.lore: Cadomai is the homeworld of the generally artistic Snivvians. Its cold, dark climate makes them excellent scouts.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: Snowspeeder
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1. May move as a 'react' to Hoth sites.
front.lore: Modified Incom T-47 airspeeder. Enclosed. Adapted to the cold by installation of regulator coil heaters. Rebels typically nickname converted speeders after the intended environment.

front.title: •Snowspeeder Garrison
front.gametext: Deploys -3 to Hoth. Permanent pilots provide total ability of 6. While on Hoth, defense value +2, immune to attrition < 4, and may move as a 'react' for +1 Force
front.lore: Snowspeeder attack plan devised by Commander Skywalker and Rebel tactician Beryl Chifonage. Single-file formation protects the squadron as the leader draws fire.

front.title: •So This Is How Liberty Dies
front.gametext: Deploy on Senate. Your [Coruscant] Political Effects are lost. While you have a character here with rebellion agenda, your Force drains at battlegrounds where you have a Rebel are +1 and may not be canceled. May not be canceled or placed in Used Pile.
front.lore: 'Vote now! Vote now! Vote now!'

front.title: •Solo
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. Deploys -1 to Falcon. Draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. Adds one battle destiny if with Chewie or Rey. Once per game, may play an Interrupt from Lost Pile as if from hand (then place that card out of play).
front.lore: Smuggler.

front.title: •Solo Han
front.gametext: If Han is defending a battle alone at a site, add two battle destiny. OR If any alien is defending a battle alone at a site, add one battle destiny.
front.lore: As a smuggler, Solo must always be alert for trouble, even when appearing relaxed. Bounty hunters are eager to claim the price on the Corellian pirate's head.

front.title: •Solo Han (V)
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy (or retrieve) non-[Permanent Weapon] Han (except Falcon) from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR If battle just initiated, and Han defending alone at a site, he is power +1 for each character and vehicle present, his forfeit cannot be reduced, he adds one destiny to power, and he draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: As a smuggler, Solo must always be alert for trouble, even when appearing relaxed. Bounty hunters are eager to claim the price on the Corellian pirate's head.

front.title: Solomahal
front.gametext: Deploy on your warrior to give that warrior scout skill. That warrior may move as a 'react.' OR Deploy on your scout. When that scout 'reacts,' it is power +2 for remainder of turn. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Veteran officer of the Old Republic who retired from active duty after the Clone Wars. Makes a living in the Outer Rim Territories passing on his scouting expertise.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Solomahal (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on your scout (except Luke). If scout (or starship they are aboard) was just targeted by a weapon, may place this Effect in Lost Pile to cancel that targeting.
front.lore: Veteran officer of the Old Republic who retired from active duty after the Clone Wars. Makes a living in the Outer Rim Territories passing on his scouting expertise.

front.title: Someone Who Loves You
front.gametext: If Han was just lost and Leia is on table (or vice versa), place the justlost character on your Used Pile instead. OR If Leia is present at a site where Han is captive, release Han. OR Cancel a Force drain at a prison.
front.lore: Han's appreciation toward his mysterious liberator was rather quickly overcome.

cancels: A Force drain at a prison

front.title: •Somersault
front.gametext: During a battle at a site, just before drawing battle destiny, if opponent has less than double your total power, use 4 Force to switch your total power with opponent's. OR If both players just drew one battle destiny, use 1 Force to switch numbers.
front.lore: Luke's sudden reversal of fortune allowed him to turn the tables on Vader.

combo: Somersault + Electrobinoculars

front.title: •Son Of Skywalker
front.gametext: Deploys only on Dagobah or Cloud City. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Once per game, during your deploy phase, a lightsaber may deploy on Luke (for free) from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Luke Skywalker. Son of Anakin. Seeker of Yoda. Levitator of rocks. Ignorer of advice. Incapable of impossible. Reckless is he.

combo: Son Of Skywalker + Encampment  Deploy regardless of location deployment restrictions.

front.title: •Son Of Skywalker (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots.  Luke's Lightsaber is immune to Overload.  May deploy Luke's Lightsaber from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  While on Dagobah, you lose no Force to Your Destiny or Vengeance Of The Dark Prince.  Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Luke Skywalker. Son of Anakin. Seeker of Yoda. Levitator of rocks. Ignorer of advice. Incapable of impossible. Reckless is he.

front.title: SoroSuub V-35 Landspeeder
front.gametext: May add 1 driver and 3 passengers. Moves free if Owen Lars, Beru Lars or Luke aboard. May move as a 'react'.
front.lore: Typical old model Courier landspeeder such as the one used by Lars family for trips to Anchorhead. Has cargo compartment. Enclosed seating.

front.title: •Sorry About The Mess
front.gametext: During your control phase, fire one of your weapons. If Han firing, may add 1 to each weapon destiny draw. (A seeker may be targeted by a character weapon, as if a character with defense value of 4.) Any 'hit' targets are immediately lost.
front.lore: 'I've been looking forward to this for a long time.' 'Yes, I'll bet you have.' Han abruptly ended his conversation with Greedo and flipped Wuher a credit to pay for the cleanup.

combo: Sorry About The Mess + Millennium Falcon or Corellian Corvette + Quad Laser Cannon
Sorry About The Mess + Han Solo + Han's Heavy Blaster Pistol

front.title: •Sorry About The Mess & •Blaster Proficiency
front.gametext: USED: If you just targeted with a blaster, add 3 to your total weapon destiny.  LOST: During your control phase, fire one of your weapons. Any 'hit' targets are immediately lost. OR Lose 1 Force to place opponent's just 'hit' character in Lost Pile."

combo: Sorry About The Mess & Blaster Proficiency + Impressive, Most Impressive (V): These two cards allow you to control the battle by eliminating one character before anything else happens.

front.title: •Soth Petikkin
front.gametext: Once during each of your control phases, when at a Jabba's Palace site you control, may use 1 Force to take one alien that is a smuggler, scout, thief or spy into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Persuasive recruiter from Tefau. Possesses limited precognition. Used his contacts in Jabba's desert stronghold to find support for the Rebellion.

front.title: •Sound The Attack
front.gametext: USED: Use 1 Force to take into hand one vehicle, weapon or interrupt with 'Ewok' in the title from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  LOST: If your Ewok is defending a battle, add one battle destiny."
front.lore: Ewok warriors on patrol use primitive animal horns to coordinate their defenses.

front.title: <>Space Slug
front.gametext: * Ferocity = two destiny. Habitat: Big One (Cave is now Belly). Attacks starfighters (defeated cards are eaten or relocated to Belly, opponent of victim chooses). Once per turn, may open or close mouth.
front.lore: Immense spaceborn predator. Consumes minerals, mynocks and the occasional passing starfighter. Lives in asteroid caves. Only one meter long at birth.

front.title: <>Spaceport City
front.gametext: Light: : If you have a non-unique Rebel leader at same or related site, Force drain +1 here. May not be deployed to Bespin, Dagobah, Endor, Hoth, Kashyyyk or Yavin 4.

front.title: <>Spaceport Docking Bay
front.gametext: Light: : Your docking bay transit from here requires 2 Force. Your starfighters deploy -1 (or 2 is freighter) here. May not be deployed to Bespin, Dagobah, Endor, Hoth or Yavin 4.

front.title: <>Spaceport Scoundrels Guild
front.gametext: Light: : Once per game, if top card of your Lost Pile is a Corellian (except Corran or Han), may exchange it with a card in hand.

cards.conceptBy: (Original Concept by Jonathan Murray - DragonCon Open 2009)"

front.title: •••Spaceport Speeders
front.gametext: Sell one of your vehicles or droids at Mos Eisley or same site as Wioslea. Draw two destiny (three destiny if vehicle is Luke's X-34 Landspeeder). The total is the 'offer,' which you must accept. Activate that much Force; then vehicle or droid is lost.
front.lore: Spacesport Speeders buys, trades and sells floater. Wioslea is known as a shrewd bargainer. Luke got 2,000 credits for his X-24 speeder.

front.title: <>Spaceport Street
front.gametext: Light: : During your move phase, may move free between here and any related _spaceport site. May not be deployed to Bespin, Dagobah, Endor, Hoth, Kashyyyk or Yavin 4.

front.title: •Speak With The Jedi Council
front.gametext: USED: If the Jedi Council Chamber is not on table, you may deploy it from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  LOST: Deploy one Jedi Council member to the Jedi Council Chamber from Reserve Deck; reshuffle."
front.lore: Qui-Gon knew that urgency was required. What had transpired on Tatooine demanded the attention of the Council.

combo: Speak With The Jedi Council + Coruscant: Jedi Council Chamber + Depa Bilaba + Podracing
Speak With The Jedi Council + Coruscant: Jedi Council Chamber + Plo Kloon

front.title: •Special Modifications
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on any starship to add 2 to its armor or maneuver. If on Falcon with Han, Lando or Chewie piloting, also adds 2 to power and forfeit.
front.lore: Han's 'special modifications' for Millennium Falcon included security mechanisms, deflector shields, hull plating, faster hyperdrive and enhanced weapons.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Special Modifications + Light Maneuvers Special Modifications is doubled until end of turn.

front.title: •Special Modifications (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  If your starship in battle is about to be lost before the damage segment, it is instead lost at end of battle (if forfeited, forfeit for 0).  May place this Effect in Lost Pile to make your starship immune to attrition for remainder of turn. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Han's 'special modifications' for the Millennium Falcon included security mechanisms, deflector shields, hull plating, faster hyperdrive and enhanced weapons.

front.title: Speeder Bike
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 1 passenger. May move as a 'react'. When piloted, vehicle and scouts aboard are immune to attrition < 4. Pilot's power = 0. If lost, characters aboard may 'jump off' (disembark).
front.lore: Aratech speeder bikes often found their way into Rebel hands. Stolen from troops operating far from Imperial maintenance facilities.

front.title: •Spiral
front.gametext: May deploy -3 as a 'react.' May add 3 pilots, 4 passengers and 1 vehicle. Has ship-docking ability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2.
front.lore: Has conducted several successful ambushes on Imperial convoys. Veteran crew. Has a reputation for arriving when least expected.

combo: Bright Hope (V) + Wedge Antilles, Red Squadron Leader + Spiral + Derek 'Hobbie' Klivian cancels one destiny and substracts another from opponent's total power and attrition.

front.title: •Squadron Assignments
front.gametext: Deploy on table. During your deploy phase, you may reveal one unpiloted starfighter from hand to take its matching pilot character from Reserve Deck (or vice versa) and deploy both simultaneously; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Rebel starfighter squadrons take great pride in their proficiency and dedication. Alliance pilots train relentlessly until man and machine function as one.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas

front.title: •Squadron Assignments (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. During your deploy phase, may reveal one unpiloted Red or Rogue squadron starfighter (or vehicle) from hand to take its matching pilot character (or vice versa) from Reserve Deck and deploy both simultaneously; reshuffle. [Immune to Alter.]
front.lore: Rebel starfighter squadrons take great pride in their proficiency and dedication. Alliance pilots train relentlessly until man and machine function as one.

front.title: Staging Areas
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Your Force generation is +1 at each docking bay you occupy (or +2 if you control). You non-unique Star Cruisers are deploy -1 and may deploy to same battleground system as any rebel starship. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Alliance carefully chooses docking bays from which to launch limited offensives.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas
canceledBy: Fanfare and Fanfare - Defensive Shield suspends Staging Areas while Light Side player occupies no battleground systems

front.title: •Star Destroyer!
front.gametext: If opponent just deployed or moved a Star Destroyer, say 'Star Destroyer!' After placing interrupt in Used Pile, may place Used Pile on top of Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Leia's perception increased as she became more attuned to the Force. She attained the uncanny ability to spot objects at long distances.

front.title: •Stardust
front.gametext: Deploy on Data Vault. At any time, may relocate Stardust to your spy present. During your control phase, if on your spy at a battleground you occupy, opponent loses 2 Force. If about to leave table, relocate to Data Vault (if possible). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: Starship Levitation
front.gametext: USED: Cancel Awwww, Cannot Get Your Ship Out.  LOST: Use 1 Force to draw destiny. If destiny < ability of your highest-ability character on table, search your Used Pile and take one starship into hand. Shuffle, cut and replace."
front.lore: A Jedi can move large objects with the power of the mind.

front.title: Starship Levitation (V)
front.gametext: USED: If you just drew a starship for destiny, take that starship into hand to cancel and redraw that destiny.  LOST: Use 3 Force to retrieve a non-[Maintenance] starship into hand."
front.lore: A Jedi can move large objects with the power of the mind.

front.title: Starship Levitation (V)
front.gametext: USED: If you just drew a starship for destiny, take that starship into hand to cancel and redraw that destiny.  LOST: Use 3 Force to retrieve a non-[Maintenance] starship into hand."
front.lore: A Jedi can move large objects with the power of the mind.

front.title: •Stay Here, Where It's Safe
front.gametext: Target your character with a peace or order agenda. Draw destiny. For remainder of turn, target is power + X (or politics +X if at Galactic Senate) and immune to attrition < X, where X = destiny number of the card drawn. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: Having enforced a momentous change upon the Senate, the headstrong Queen then wished to return to Naboo and do the same.

front.title: •Stay Sharp!
front.gametext: During your control phase, fire one of your starship weapons (for free). If Han or any gunner is aboard that starship, may add 2 to destiny draw. 'Hit' target is lost. OR If you just fired a weapon in battle, add that weapon's destiny number to your total power.
front.lore: 'Ha haaaaaa!'

front.title: •Steady Aim
front.gametext: Add X to one starship weapon destiny (before destiny is drawn) when targeting opponent's starship. USED: X=2.LOST: X=4."
front.lore: Although unfamiliar with the quad laser turrets on the Falcon, Luke quickly scored two hits.

front.title: •Steady, Steady
front.gametext: Deploy on table. If you have two Gungans with different card titles at Battle Plains, your Force drains are +2 there. While two underwater sites on table, your Gungans and creature vehicles are immune to attrition < 4 where your Fambaa is present. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Gungan army hoped that by initiating a conflict at the battle plains, they could draw the Trade Federation's forces away from Amidala's real plan.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Stolen Data Tapes
front.gametext: Deploy on R2-D2. If about to leave table (even from Overwhelmed),relocate to Dune Sea (if possible). If at Dune Sea, may relocate to your character there. If at Alderaan (or a 'blown away' system), tapes 'delivered'; relocate this Effect to table and may take any card into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'What's so important? What's he carrying?' 'The technical readouts of that battle station. I only hope that when the data is analyzed, a weakness can be found.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Stolen First Order TIE Fighter
front.gametext: May add Poe (or a spy) as a pilot and one passenger. Deploys free to opponent's system. While Poe piloting, maneuver +2. If Finn aboard, apply his ability towards drawing battle destiny.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: ••Stone Pile
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on any Dagobah site. Randomly select two cards from opponent's hand and place them, unseen, face down beneath Stone Pile. Cards return to opponent's hand if Effect leaves table. Canceled if opponent occupies this site.
front.lore: 'Use the Force. Yes... Now, the stone. Feel it.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Strangle
front.gametext: Target an escort alone and its captive. Draw destiny. Escort lost if destiny + captive's power > escort's ability + power. OR During a battle at a site where Leia is an escorted captive, add one battle destiny.
front.lore: 'Aacccck!'

combo: Strangle + Princess Leia Organa This is an obvious combo that is used quite often. As mentioned above, use this to either destroy Jabba during a critical turn, or to get your Leia out.

front.title: •Strike Blocked
front.gametext: Take top card of Force Pile into hand. OR If opponent just revealed a combat card, it is canceled (place in opponent's Used Pile) and opponent must draw destiny instead (that destiny is reduced by 1). OR Cancel Maul Strikes, Dark Strike, or You Are Beaten.
front.lore: At times it was calculated defense, at others it was simply survival.

front.title: •Strike Planning
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Twice per game, you may take one Mon Mothma or any general (except Obi-Wan) into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Opponent's Force generation at Endor system is canceled unless Endor Operations on table. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'General Solo, is your strike team assembled?'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas

front.title: •Strikeforce
front.gametext: Deploy on table. While you control a battleground site, your Force drain may not be modified or canceled at a system where you have a Star Cruiser or unique(•) starfighter, except by a 'react.' Place Effect in Used Pile if you lose a battle at a system.
front.lore: Admiral Ackbar's hit-and-fade tactics force the Imperial Navy to spread throughout the galaxy in a futile attempt to engage the Rebels.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas

front.title: •Strikeforce (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per game, if opponent just played an Interrupt, may stack it here. To play any new Interrupt of same name, players must first stack it here. May place this Effect in Lost Pile (place cards here in owners' Used Pile) to retrieve a starship. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Admiral Ackbar's hit-and-fade tactics force the Imperial Navy to spread throughout the galaxy in a futile attempt to engage the Rebels.

front.title: •Strikeforce (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per game, if opponent just played an Interrupt, may stack it here. To play any new Interrupt of same name, players must first stack it here. May place this Effect in Lost Pile (place cards here in owners' Used Pile) to retrieve a starship. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Admiral Ackbar's hit-and-fade tactics force the Imperial Navy to spread throughout the galaxy in a futile attempt to engage the Rebels.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas

front.title: •Strong Is Vader
front.gametext: If [Virtual] Mind What You have Learned on table, deploy on table with up to 6 Jedi Tests under here from outside your deck.  You may not Force drain at Dagobah locations or deploy asteroid sectors, [Maintenance] cards, or [Permanent Weapon] cards.  Whenever you draw training destiny, draw two and chose one.  You may retrieve 3 Force whenever you complete a Jedi Test.  Completed Jedi Tests are placed on table and are suspended (not lost) whenever character who completed them not on table.

front.title: Stun Blaster
front.gametext: Deploy on your warrior. May target a character or creature (except rancor or Sarlacc) using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Return character (and cards deployed on character) to owner's hand if destiny +1 > defense value. Creature lost if destiny +3 > defense value.
front.lore: Stolen Merr-Sonn blaster. Causes no permanent damage, though efficiently immobilizes its target. Effects are more severe on animals without a thick hide.

front.title: •Sullust
front.gametext: Light: : To move your starship between here and Death Star II, system it orbits, or Mon Calmari requires -1 Force.

front.title: •Superficial Damage
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Each turn, each of your characters, vehicles, and starships may forfeit one of its weapons (except a lightsaber) using forfeit value = 3. Also, your forfeited weapons go to Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Veteran Rebel engineers know that weapon systems positioned for adequate coverage are vulnerable themselves.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas

front.title: •Superficial Damage (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. You may forfeit non-lightsaber weapons (using forfeit value = 3); place your just forfeited weapon in Used Pile. During your deploy phase, if you just deployed a vehicle or starship, may deploy a weapon (for free) on that vehicle or starship from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Veteran Rebel engineers know that weapon systems positioned for adequate coverage are vulnerable themselves.

front.title: •Suppressive Fire
front.gametext: During your control phase, fire (for free) one of your blasters carried by a trooper or one of your automated weapons. 'Hit' target is lost.
front.lore: Echo Base heavy weapons units provided covering fire, allowing Alliance personnel to escape Hoth.

front.title: •Suppressive Fire (V)
front.gametext: Once per turn, if drawn for destiny, you may activate 1 Force. During battle at a site, choose: Your total power is +1 for each of your characters present. OR If you have a weapon present, opponent must use or lose 1 Force to draw their first battle destiny.
front.lore: Echo Base heavy weapons units provided covering fire, allowing Alliance personnel to escape Hoth.

front.title: •Supreme Chancellor Palpatine
front.gametext: Agendas: ambition, order. While on Coruscant, Ambush is a Used Interrupt and, each time you initiate a Force drain with a clone, may draw top card from Reserve Deck. During your turn, may make an additional regular move. Valorum is lost.
front.lore: Leader.

front.title: •Supreme Chancellor Valorum
front.gametext: Agendas: justice, order. While in a senate majority, once per turn may use 2 Force to cancel a battle destiny just drawn at another site where you have a Republic Character. Opponent may use X Force; Valorum is politics - X for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Although Finis Valorum maintains the Galactic Senate's ultimate title, his real power is mired by endless bureaucracy, petty corruption, and incessant plotting.

combo: Supreme Chancellor Valorum + General Solo + Chewbacca: cancel two battle destiny? I'm there!
Supreme Chancellor Valorum + Stay Here, Where It's Safe: Extra power, extra politics, and attrition immunity. No one is safe from Zod - er, Valorum!

front.title: •Supreme Chancellor Valorum (AI)
front.gametext: Agendas: justice, order. While in a senate majority, once per turn may use 2 Force to cancel a battle destiny just drawn at another site where you have a Republic Character. Opponent may use X Force; Valorum is politics - X for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Although Finis Valorum maintains the Galactic Senate's ultimate title, his real power is mired by endless bureaucracy, petty corruption, and incessant plotting.

front.title: •Supreme Chancellor Valorum (AI) (V)
front.gametext: Agendas: order. May be targeted by Might Of The Republic. Your characters with politics (except Wedge and senators) are deploy -1 and gain [Republic] here. During your turn, may use 1 Force to take into hand a card with 'Valorum', 'governor' or 'political' in lore from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Although Finis Valorum maintains the Galactic Senate's ultimate title, his real power is mired by endless bureaucracy, petty corruption, and incessant plotting.

front.title: •Supreme Chancellor Valorum (V)
front.gametext: Agendas: order. May be targeted by Might Of The Republic. Your characters with politics (except Wedge and senators) are deploy -1 and gain [Republic] here. During your turn, may use 1 Force to take into hand a card with 'Valorum', 'governor' or 'political' in lore from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Although Finis Valorum maintains the Galactic Senate's ultimate title, his real power is mired by endless bureaucracy, petty corruption, and incessant plotting.

front.title: Surface Defense Cannon
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your starfighter, free on Falcon. May target a character or creature at same site using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value.
front.lore: BlasTech Ax-108 'Ground Buzzer' blaster cannon. Designed to drop from a concealed gun pod on a starship. Targets using proximity motion sensors. Has 360-degree firing arc.

pulledBy: Lieutenant s'Too cVees (when at a docking bay)

front.title: Surprise Assault
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to cancel a Force drain at one location. Draw one destiny for each character, starship and vehicle the opponent has present. Compare your destiny total to opponent's power total. Player with lowest total loses Force equal to the difference.
front.lore: Imperial troops with strict orders are often caught off-guard by innovative Rebel ambushes, sneak attacks, or sabotage efforts.

cancels: Surprise Assault may not be played when The Way Of Things on table

front.title: Surprise Counter Assault
front.gametext: Cancel Counter Assault. OR Use 4 Force to cancel opponent's Force drain at an exterior Endor site. Deploy (for free) from Reserve Deck any number of non-unique Ewoks to that site (Dark Side characters, vehicles and starships here may 'escape' to Used Pile).
front.lore: Chief Chirpa led his Ewok warriors in a counterattack that captured many Imperial soldiers outside the Endor control bunker.

pulls: Any number of non-unique Ewok to an Endor site
combo: lotsa Ewok Sentries + Surprise Counter Assault + Endor: Hidden Forest Trail = the drain is cancelled, the Ewoks get deployed from Reserve Deck for free at a site with 2 Light Side icons, and if you scare the Dark Side characters to the Used Pile, then from the Forest Trail you can get them to any exterior Endor site you wish!

front.title: •Surreptitious Glance
front.gametext: If Lobot and your Lando are in a battle together, cancel one opponent's destiny draw immediately after it is revealed OR use 4 Force to cancel Daruk Deal.
front.lore: After working together for a long time, Lando and Lobot developed a speechless form of commnication.

front.title: •Surreptitious Glance (V)
front.gametext: If this card is lost from your Reserve Deck, it satisfies an additional 2 Force loss. If your Lando and Lobot are defending in a battle, add two destiny to power only and one battle destiny.
front.lore: After working together for a long time, Lando and Lobot developed a speechless form of commnication.

front.title: SW-4 Ion Cannon
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your Y-wing or B-wing. May target a starship using 1 Force. Draw destiny. If destiny > target's defense value, all starship weapons deployed on target are lost, armor or maneuver = 0 and hyperspeed = 0.
front.lore: ArMek SW-4 turret-mounted ion cannon. Bursts of ionized energy fuse and overload target's mechanical and computer systems. Allows ships to be captured and boarded.

pulledBy: Lieutenant s'Too Vees (when at a docking bay)

front.title: <>Swamp
front.gametext: Light: : Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one creature here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. May not be deployed to Bespin, Coruscant, Hoth, Kessel or Tatooine.

front.title: •••Swing-And-A-Miss
front.gametext: If opponent just used a lightsaber to target, draw one destiny and subtract that amount from opponent's weapon destiny. OR Cancel one Mostly Armless card just played. OR Cancel Dark Strike, End This Destructive Conflict or Focused Attack.
front.lore: It's the bottom of the ninth level of Cloud City. Vader steps up to the platform. Here's the delivery. . . oooh, he took a big cut there! The Force sure wasn't with him on that one!

front.title: T-47 Battle Formation
front.gametext: If your T-47s occupy three battleground sites on same planet, your Force drains at same and related battlegrounds this turn are +1 (or+2 if at Hoth). OR Cancel a Force drain at a site if your T-47 occupies an adjacent site. OR Cancel Walker Garrison.
front.lore: Airspeeders operate in coordinated patrols, supporting Rebel ground troops and denying infiltration of key planets.

cancels: A Force drain at a site if your T-47 occupies an adjacent site

front.title: Tagge Seeker
front.gametext: Deploys for 1 Force to an unoccupied site. Deploys and moves like an undercover spy. When present with Tagge (or warrior) of ability < 3, choose one to be immediately lost (treat as an 'all cards' situation). Seeker is also lost.
front.lore: Military version of a 'remote.' Programmed to stalk specific targets or secondary targets. Heat and light sensors track with fatal accuracy. Can stow away on starships.

combo: Tagge Seeker + Attark

front.title: •Taidu Sefla
front.gametext: When deployed (or just lost), may draw bottom card of Used Pile. During battle, may subtract X (limit 3) from a just drawn weapon or battle destiny, where X = number of your spies out of play. Your spies here are immune to Nevar Yalnal.
front.lore: Trooper.

front.title: •Take The Initiative
front.gametext: USED: If all of your ability in a battle is provided by scouts and/or spies, they each add 1 to your total battle destiny (limit +6).  LOST: For remainder of turn, your unique (•) scouts and unique (•) spies are each power +1 (or +2 while being attacked by a creature)."
front.lore: The ability to think and act independently gave the Rebels an advantage over their Imperial foes.

combo: Take The Initiative + Threepio + Ewok Sentries - the Sentries deploy (or move!) as a react, and each one adds 2 to attrition. Ouch time!

front.title: •Take This!
front.gametext: If you are about to draw weapon destiny for Proton Torpedoes, instead draw 3 and choose 1. OR For rest of turn, add 2 to any attempt to 'blow away' Blockade Flagship. OR Take Proton Torpedoes or Bravo Fighter into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: 'And this!'

combo: Take This! + Proton Torpedoes

front.title: •Taking Them With Us
front.gametext: Each player, if that player has a capital starship armed with a starship weapon in battle, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise and once per battle, may reduce the defense value of one opponent's capital starship present by 4 for remainder of the battle. At sites related to systems you occupy, your non-pilot warriors are deploy - 1, defense value +2 and forfeit +1.

front.title: •Taking Them With Us (V)
front.gametext: Each player may, once per battle at a system, lose 1 Force to target two participating unique (•) piloted starships with immunity to attrition (one from each player); both starships lose all immunity to attrition this turn. When deploying to capital starships, your Mon Calamari pilots are deploy = 1.

front.title: •Takodana
front.gametext: Light: : During your deploy phase, if you just deployed a Maz's Castle location, may draw top card of Reserve Deck.

front.title: •Takodana: Maz's Castle
front.gametext: Light: : Once per turn, may deploy a Maz's Castle site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

front.title: •Tala 1
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. May be carried like a vehicle. Power and maneuver +2 at opponent's system (except battlegrounds) or at any sector. Immune to attrition < 4 when Colonel Cracken piloting.
front.lore: Heavily modified Headhunter. Operationally assigned to support Madine's commando team. Hyperdrive added to allow it to operate independently of capital starship support.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Tala 2
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. May be carried like a vehicle. When your spy aboard, opponent's spies and scouts are deploy +2 to related sites. Immune to attrition < 4 when Lieutenant Blount piloting.
front.lore: Equipped with sophisticated sensor suite to monitor Imperial activity during Rebel commando operations. Hyperdrive allows longrange reconnaissance.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Tallie Lintra In Blue 1
front.gametext: Permanent pilot is •Tallie, who provides ability of 2. May move as a 'react' to same location as your [Episode VII] character. Characters here may not have their forfeit increased above their printed value.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Talon Karrde
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Once during each of your control phases, may peek at one card from opponent's hand or top card of opponent's Reserve Deck. At same location, your smugglers are each forfeit +2 and defense value +2.
front.lore: Smuggler and information broker. Operates intelligence network. Pragmatic businessman. Strong sense of personal honor. Bounty placed on his head by Grand Admiral Thrawn.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.title: •Talon Karrde (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. If your [Virtual Block 4] objective on table: aliens are forfeit +2 at Rebel Cell sites; Yerka Mig may deploy on a Rebel Cell site, ignores Jedi, is immune to Alter, and for remainder of game, you retrieve Force with it only once per turn.
front.lore: Smuggler and information broker. Operates intelligence network. Pragmatic businessman. Strong sense of personal honor. Bounty placed on his head by Grand Admiral Thrawn.

front.title: •••Talz
front.gametext: May forfeit in place of any other character hit by a weapon at same site, restoring that character to normal. Any Talz is power +2 under 'nighttime conditions'.
front.lore: Muftak is a typical male Talz from Alzoc III, a system enslaved by the Empire. A Talz's second pair of eyes provide excellent night vision. Muftak is a friend and protector of Kabe.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
combo: Talz + Nightfall + 2X-3KPR

front.title: •Tamizander Rey
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Your starships may move from same exterior site for free. While at Echo Docking Bay, once every turn, may allow one character on Hoth to be immune to The Shield Doors Must Be Closed.
front.lore: A native of Esseles. Resigned from Esselian defense force after the Imperial Senate was disbanded. Senior deck officer of Echo Base responsible for docking bay operations.

front.title: •Tamizander Rey (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While at a docking bay, power and defense value +2. Tamizander Rey's docking bay transit requires -3 Force.
front.lore: A native of Esseles. Resigned from Esselian defense force after the Imperial Senate was disbanded. Senior deck officer of Echo Base responsible for docking bay operations.

front.title: •Tamtel Skreej
front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Once per game, Undercover may deploy on Tamtel from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While at a site you control, Rebels are immune to None Shall Pass at that site.
front.lore: Gambler. Lando Calrissian posed as a guard for Jabba in order to spy on the Hutt. Feared that he would be recognized by some of Jabba's companions.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
combo: Tamtel Skreej + Undercover + Double Agent

front.title: •Tamtel Skreej (V)
front.gametext: Deploys only to a Tatooine site as an Undercover spy. Once during each control phase, if Undercover, may relocate your character at a related site to Lando's site (for free). Once per game, may deploy Vibro-Ax on Lando from Reserve Deck for free; reshuffle.
front.lore: Gambler. Lando Calrissian posed as a guard for Jabba in order to spy on the Hutt. Feared that he would be recognized by some of Jabba's companions.

front.title: •Tantive IV
front.gametext: May be deployed even without presence or Force icons. May add 3 pilots and 4 passengers. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2.
front.lore: Royal House of Alderaan consular ship. Used by Princess Leia for Imperial Senate business (and secret Rebel espionage). Captured by the Devastator over Tatooine.

front.title: •Tantive IV (V)
front.gametext: May deploy without presence or Force icons. May add 3 pilots and 4 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Adds one [Light Side Force] and one [Dark Side Force] at same Dark Side system.
front.lore: Royal House of Alderaan consular ship. Used by Princess Leia for Imperial Senate business (and secret Rebel espionage). Captured by the Devastator over Tatooine.

front.title: •Tantive IV (V)
front.gametext: May deploy without presence or Force icons. May add 3 pilots and 4 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Adds one [Light Side] icon here.
front.lore: Royal House of Alderaan consular ship. Used by Princess Leia for Imperial Senate business (and secret Rebel espionage). Captured by the Devastator over Tatooine.

front.title: •Tanus Spijek
front.gametext: When at a Yavin 4 site, adds 1 to your Force drains at Alderaan system for each Yavin 4 site you control. While at Audience Chamber, all your other Elom are power and forfeit +1.
front.lore: Male Elom. Former spy for the Rebellion. Hired by the Alliance to carry messages between Alderaan and the Rebel base on Yavin 4.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
combo: Tanus Spijek + Double Agent

Our Most Desperate Hour + Tatooine System + 3+ Ability Characters Since you're already playing the Alderaan system, why not use it to your advantage. Captain Han in the Falcon works well in pulling this one off, plus you can avoid all the nasty stuff down below by remaining in space and on Yavin 4. One of the easiest ways to retrieve Force.  Death Star Docking Bay + Death Star Trash Compactor + Death Star Plans + A Droid Fairly simple to pull off since you're playing all the Yavin 4 sites. Simple cards like Tunnel Vision or Hiding In The Garbage will help you get those Death Star sites.  Kessel System + Kessel Run + A Smuggler OK, I like to retrieve Force. A Force drain for three may be easier than usual because many Dark players are focused on capturing at sites with Bounty Hunters. Deploy another ship to the Alderaan system where Captain Han is hovering in the Falcon and send him to Kessel.  Effective Repairs + Utinni Effects Not only does it cancel the annoying Limited Resources, but this card also allows you to retrieve any Utinni Effect into your hand, which is what all those precious Force retrieval cards just happen to be.  Tanus Spijek doesn't actually play much of a part in the Force retrieval, but after reading his card I came up with all of this. The few card which his game text makes essential for a deck around him is so nicely complimented by the Force retrieval opportunities. This deck has already won a couple times for me and is a lot of fun to play. Your opponent begins to become angry the third or fourth time you've successfully retrieved your entire Lost Pile! If you're still worried about Dark Side spies popping up or other ways for the Dark player to infiltrate Yavin 4, a card like Houjix is excellent in case you get totally taken by surprise and majorly overpowered in a battle, but the deck is character-heavy and those high destinies on the Force retrieval cards will serve you well in firing weapons and battle destinies.

front.title: •Tanus Spijek (V)
front.gametext: Once per game, when deployed to a site, opponent loses 1 Force for each Dark Side character present. Draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.
front.lore: Male Elom. Former spy for the Rebellion. Hired by the Alliance to carry messages between Alderaan and the Rebel base on Yavin 4.

front.title: •Tarfful, Wookiee Insurgent
front.gametext: Occupy on Forest Depths is treated as 'control.' Non-unique Wookiees here are Heroic. Once per game, when deployed, may 'roar' to take one card into hand from Used Pile reshuffle, and/or stack a Wookiee from hand on Grrrghrrrgh!.
front.lore: Leader

front.title: Targeting Computer
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on any starship. Adds 1 to starship's maneuver. If this starship is using a weapon during a battle, you may fire that weapon twice, separately or combined. Subtract 1 from each destiny draw when firing.
front.lore: Specially designed for use on Rebel starfighters. Assists pilots on torpedo runs. Automatically locks on pre-programmed target points.

front.title: Tarkin Seeker
front.gametext: Deploys for 1 Force to an unoccupied site. Deploys and moves like an undercover spy. When present with Tarkin (or alien) of ability < 3, choose one to be immediately lost (treat as an 'all cards' situation). Seeker is also lost.
front.lore: Military version of a 'remote.' Programmed to stalk specific targets or secondary targets. Heat and light sensors track with fatal accuracy. Can stow away on starships.

combo: Tarkin Seeker + Attark

front.title: •Tatooine
front.gametext: Light: : Your movement from here using hyperspeed requires -1 Force.

combo: Opponent's Chimaera + Thrawn + Imperial Command + your Tatooine Still only one battle destiny for your opponent!

front.title: •Tatooine
front.gametext: Light: : If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Tatooine sites.

front.title: •Tatooine Celebration
front.gametext: Deploy on Tatooine system if you occupy at least two Tatooine battleground sites. During each of your control phases, retrieve 1 Force for each Tatooine battleground you occupy. Canceled if opponent controls this system. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Even in the Outer Rim, many fear the wrath of the Empire and pray for its destruction.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Tatooine Utility Belt
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on any Rebel or alien. While on Tatooine, that character's power and forfeit are +2.
front.lore: Survival gear, food and tools are stored in small compartments. Made from bantha hide. Used by Luke and other Tatooine inhabitants.

front.title: Tatooine Utility Belt (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on Han or a Lars. Character cannot be targeted by [Permanent Weapon] weapons or be captured. If just lost, place this device in Used Pile. Force loss from ...Or Be Destroyed must come from Reserve Deck (if possible) and may not be reduced below 2.
front.lore: Survival gear, food and tools are stored in small compartments. Made from bantha hide. Used by Luke and other Tatooine inhabitants.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Joe Olson - Alderaan Regionals 2006)"

front.title: •Tatooine: Anchorhead
front.gametext: Light: : During your move phase, may move your characters from here to Mos Eisley.

front.title: •Tatooine: Beggar's Canyon
front.gametext: Light: : T-16s deploy free (and are power +2) here. If you control with a T-16, Force drain +1 here.

combo: Tatooine: Beggar's Canyon + Tight Squeeze

front.title: •Tatooine: Cantina
front.gametext: Light: : Your aliens are each power +1.

front.title: •Tatooine: Cantina (V)
front.gametext: Light: : [Virtual Block 8] Scoundrels are smugglers. May use 1 Force to deploy Mose Eisley from reserve deck; reshuffle. Immune to Revolution.

front.title: •Tatooine: City Outskirts
front.gametext: Light: : Once per game, may deploy a Jedi here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

front.title: •••Tatooine: Desert
front.gametext: Light: : Your character movement from here (except for scouts) requires +1 landspeed.

combo: 2 Deserts -- With two of these in hand, you can effectively trap a character at a site. This is especially nasty if you can trap Vader or someone similarly important at a relatively harmless site such as the Dune Sea or the Jawa Camp. They can also help in trapping someone at the Jawa Camp if you have dreams of free Jawas streaming from your hand to defeat the Imperial Army. Just make sure you have a Sandcrawler!

front.title: •Tatooine: Docking Bay 94
front.gametext: Light: : Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.

front.title: •Tatooine: Dune Sea
front.gametext: Light: : -

front.title: •Tatooine: Hutt Canyon
front.gametext: Light: : If you occupy with a Jawa, opponent may not draw battle destiny here.

combo: Tatooine: Hutt Canyon + Jawa Camp + 2 Sandcrawlers -- Hordes of free Jawas simply streaming out of your hand as fast as you can draw them. Simply use a Jawa to drive the Sandcrawler over to the Jawa Camp, and wait a turn. Then deploy a Jawa horde, and move them to the Canyon, while the other Sandcrawler moves to the Jawa Camp for another army.

front.title: •Tatooine: Hutt Trade Route (Desert)
front.gametext: Light: : Your characters here aboard vehicles are each power +1.

combo: Bo Shuda + Uh-oh! + Tatooine: Jabba's Palace (LS)

front.gametext: Light: : Your Jawas deploy here for 1 Force from you only, for free if Sandcrawler present.

front.title: •Tatooine: Jawa Camp (V)
front.gametext: Light: : Your non-unique Jawas deploy for 1 Force from you only. Your deserts gain one [Light Side Force].

front.title: •Tatooine: Jawa Canyon
front.gametext: Light: : Your Jawas are each power +1 and forfeit +2 here.

front.title: •Tatooine: Jundland Wastes
front.gametext: Light: : If you control, Force drain +1 here (+2 if a Vaporator present).

combo: Tatooine: Jundland Wastes + Vaporator + Owen Lars + Beru Lars + Hydroponic Station Let's total it up... for 5 Force and 5 cards, that's ability 4, power 4, forfeit 9 and a Force drain of 3 (and draw the first 2 Force activated directly into your hand). Not bad for a couple of middle-aged Rebels.

Tatooine: Jundland Wastes + Vaporator + Luke Skywalker + Anakin's Lightsaber + Obi-Wan + Obi-Wan's Lightsaber + Lightsaber Proficiency + Chewbacca + Jedi Lightsaber A total ability of 12, power 14, forfeit 22 and a Force drain of 6! Talk about an Undercover spy magnet...

front.gametext: Light: : Beru Lars and Luke deploy -1 here.

front.title: •Tatooine: Lars' Moisture Farm (V)
front.gametext: Light: : Once per game, may deploy a non-[Reflections II] Lars here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While a Lars present here with a hydroponics station or vaporator, your Force generation here is +1 (+2 if with both).

front.title: •Tatooine: Lars' Moisture Farm (V)

front.title: •Tatooine: Marketplace
front.gametext: Light: : If you control, once during each of your control phases may use 2 Force to retrieve 1 Force.

front.title: •Tatooine: Mos Eisley
front.gametext: Light: : During your control phase, you may move free from here directly to Cantina (or vice versa).

combo: Tatooine: Mos Eisley + Tatooine: Cantina Keep the Dark Side troops away and Force drain while awaiting an opportune time to counter attack.

If you're going to play with Tatooine sites, these are a must. Cantina is a 2/2 site and Mos Eisley lets you move to and from there for free during your control phase. So, stack your characters on one of those two sites to better withstand a battle, then on your control phase move some of them over to the other, drain at both, and then move the ones you didn't move yet to re-consolidate your forces.
Tatooine: Mos Eisley + Spaceport Speeders Once you're there movement is free, so you don't need the speeder anymore. Why not sell it for 2 or 3 destiny worth of force?
Fun Combo: Everybody likes bar games. Toss down a Holoboard and play a little Dejarik while throwing back a little Blue Milk in the Cantina.
