front.title: Watch Your Step / This Place Can Be A Little Rough (V)
front.gametext: Watch Your Step:Deploy Corellia system (with an unpiloted freighter and a Corellian pilot there) and <>Spaceport City to Corellia.{For} remainder of game, Corellia sites are immune to No Escape.  For either player to deploy a card with ability (except a Corellian) to Corellia, that player must first place a card from hand on bottom of their Used Pile.{While} this side up, you may not Force drain at Corellia system. Once per turn, may use 1 Force to deploy a <> site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if you occupy Corellia system and control two Corellia battleground sites with Corellians.This Place Can Be A Little Rough:{While} this side up, non-blaster character weapon destiny draws are -2 at Corellia sites.  Your Force generation at Corellia spaceport sites is +1.  Your combat vehicles may deploy or move only to same Corellia site as opponent's vehicle.  'Audience Chamber' on Palejo Reshad is treated as 'Corellia'.  During your deploy phase, may deploy one BoShek or a Corellian of ability < 3 from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  At the end of each turn, you may use 1 Force to draw the bottom card of your Reserve Deck.{Flip} this card if you do not occupy two battlegrounds.

back.title: Watch Your Step / This Place Can Be A Little Rough (V)
back.gametext: Watch Your Step:Deploy Corellia system (with an unpiloted freighter and a Corellian pilot there) and <>Spaceport City to Corellia.{For} remainder of game, Corellia sites are immune to No Escape.  For either player to deploy a card with ability (except a Corellian) to Corellia, that player must first place a card from hand on bottom of their Used Pile.{While} this side up, you may not Force drain at Corellia system. Once per turn, may use 1 Force to deploy a <> site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if you occupy Corellia system and control two Corellia battleground sites with Corellians.This Place Can Be A Little Rough:{While} this side up, non-blaster character weapon destiny draws are -2 at Corellia sites.  Your Force generation at Corellia spaceport sites is +1.  Your combat vehicles may deploy or move only to same Corellia site as opponent's vehicle.  'Audience Chamber' on Palejo Reshad is treated as 'Corellia'.  During your deploy phase, may deploy one BoShek or a Corellian of ability < 3 from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  At the end of each turn, you may use 1 Force to draw the bottom card of your Reserve Deck.{Flip} this card if you do not occupy two battlegrounds.

front.title: •We Can Still Outmaneuver Them
front.gametext: USED: Search your Reserve Deck. Take one Collision! or Egregious Pilot Error into hand. Shuffle, cut and replace.  LOST: If opponent just initiated a battle with at least two capital starships at a system where you have a lone starfighter, add two battle destiny."
front.lore: They're as clumsy as they are stupid.

front.title: •We Didn't Hit It
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Your Force generation is +1 at systems you control. Opponent's non-unique starfighters are deploy +1 (or +2 to a system you occupy). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: When severely outnumbered by opponents, any help is good help.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •We Don't Have Time For This
front.gametext: If Amidala and Panaka are in a battle together, add two battle destiny.  OR  Target an interior Naboo site where opponent has a battle droid. Draw destiny. If destiny > number of battle droids at that site, one of them is lost (opponent's choice).
front.lore: Amidala and Panaka have the weapons training to pin down and remove the greatest combat threat.

combo: We Don't Have Time For This + Captain Panaka or Panaka, Protector Of the Queen + Queen Amidala

front.title: We Don't Need Their Scum
front.gametext: USED: Cancel Res Luk Ra'auf.  LOST: If two bounty hunters (or an Imperial and a bounty hunter) are in a battle together, use 2 Force to draw two destiny. Subtract total from opponent's attrition and total power (cannot fall below zero)."
front.lore: Bounty Hunters. Independent contractors. Highly competitive loners. Powerful. Deadly. Scum.

front.title: We Have A Plan / They Will Be Lost And Confused
front.gametext: We Have A Plan:Deploy Theed Palace Throne Room, Theed Palace Hallway, and Theed Palace Courtyard.{For} remainder of game, you may not deploy cards with ability except [Episode I] Jedi, aliens, [Episode I] vehicles, Republic characters and [Republic] starships. Your Destiny is suspended. You lose no Force to Vengeance Of The Dark Prince.{While} this side up, you may not deploy characters to interior Naboo sites. Once per turn, may activate 1 Force.{Flip} this card if you control Theed Palace Throne Room (with Amidala there).They Will Be Lost And Confused:{While} this side up, you lose no more than 2 Force to any Force drain. Your [Republic] starships are power +2 and immunity to attrition of [Trade Federation] starships is canceled. If opponent just drew a battle destiny greater than three, you may use 1 Force to cancel that battle destiny. During your control phase, opponent loses 2 Force for each battleground site you control with Amidala or Panaka.{Flip} this card if opponent controls Theed Palace Throne Room.

back.title: We Have A Plan / They Will Be Lost And Confused
back.gametext: We Have A Plan:Deploy Theed Palace Throne Room, Theed Palace Hallway, and Theed Palace Courtyard.{For} remainder of game, you may not deploy cards with ability except [Episode I] Jedi, aliens, [Episode I] vehicles, Republic characters and [Republic] starships. Your Destiny is suspended. You lose no Force to Vengeance Of The Dark Prince.{While} this side up, you may not deploy characters to interior Naboo sites. Once per turn, may activate 1 Force.{Flip} this card if you control Theed Palace Throne Room (with Amidala there).They Will Be Lost And Confused:{While} this side up, you lose no more than 2 Force to any Force drain. Your [Republic] starships are power +2 and immunity to attrition of [Trade Federation] starships is canceled. If opponent just drew a battle destiny greater than three, you may use 1 Force to cancel that battle destiny. During your control phase, opponent loses 2 Force for each battleground site you control with Amidala or Panaka.{Flip} this card if opponent controls Theed Palace Throne Room.

front.title: We Have A Plan / They Will Be Lost And Confused (V)
front.gametext: We Have A Plan:Deploy Coruscant system (may not be converted) and Blockade Flagship: Prison with Palpatine imprisoned there. May deploy Security Control.{For} remainder of game, your Force generation is +1 at Coruscant battlegrounds. Unless you have 13 or more cards in hand, clones are immune to Monnok.{While} this side up, at Blockade Flagship sites, imprisoned captives may not be transferred. Once per turn, may deploy a battleground site to Coruscant from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if Palpatine on Coruscant.They Will Be Lost And Confused:{Immediately} take any one card into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{While} this side up, whenever a card of ability > 2 is lost, its owner loses 1 Force. While you control two battlegrounds with clones, opponent must have two cards with ability (or two [Presence] droids) to initiate a Force drain. Once per turn, may deploy a clone from Lost Pile. Clones are immune to attrition < 4.{Flip} this card (and if possible, relocate Palpatine to a prison and imprison him there) if Palpatine is about to be captured, lost, missing, or removed from table.

back.title: We Have A Plan / They Will Be Lost And Confused (V)
back.gametext: We Have A Plan:Deploy Coruscant system (may not be converted) and Blockade Flagship: Prison with Palpatine imprisoned there. May deploy Security Control.{For} remainder of game, your Force generation is +1 at Coruscant battlegrounds. Unless you have 13 or more cards in hand, clones are immune to Monnok.{While} this side up, at Blockade Flagship sites, imprisoned captives may not be transferred. Once per turn, may deploy a battleground site to Coruscant from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if Palpatine on Coruscant.They Will Be Lost And Confused:{Immediately} take any one card into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{While} this side up, whenever a card of ability > 2 is lost, its owner loses 1 Force. While you control two battlegrounds with clones, opponent must have two cards with ability (or two [Presence] droids) to initiate a Force drain. Once per turn, may deploy a clone from Lost Pile. Clones are immune to attrition < 4.{Flip} this card (and if possible, relocate Palpatine to a prison and imprison him there) if Palpatine is about to be captured, lost, missing, or removed from table.

front.title: •We Wish To Board At Once
front.gametext: Use 3 Force to take one Effect of any kind into hand from your Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Take Radiant VII, or one Interrupt with the word 'Podracer(s)' in its game text, into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Ambassadors carry a certain amount of political power. Jedi ambassadors carry a lot more.

pulls: One Interrupt with Podracer(s) in game text
We Wish To Board At Once
pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Weapon Levitation
front.gametext: USED: Search your Used Pile, take one weapon into hand and reshuffle.  LOST: Cancel You Are Beaten. OR If a battle was just initiated, one of your characters of ability > 3 present may steal one character weapon present."
front.lore: A Jedi is taught to use the anger of his opponents (and their weapons) against them.

combo: Weapon Levitation + Sabacc -- Using these two strategies together, you can completely deprive your opponent of weapons, but there are more subtle parts to this strategy. Sabacc is a great way to manipulate your own Used Pile, so that if you draw Anakin's Lightsaber with Sabacc, you can use Weapon Levitation to get it back out of your Used Pile.

front.title: •Weapon Of A Fallen Mentor
front.gametext: If your non-[Permanent Weapon] lightsaber was just lost (or stolen) from a site, deploy on your character of ability > 4 at same site. Relocate that lightsaber to this character, who may use that lightsaber, and it may not be stolen. (Immune to Control.)
front.lore: Darth Maul's complacency in what seemed like imminent victory over the Padawan was his downfall. That, and the lightsaber of Obi-Wan's fallen teacher.

pulledBy: Don't Do That Again - Defensive Shield
Don't Do That Again (V) - Defensive Shield
We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Weapons Display
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Each of your starships with two or more starship weapons aboard is power +2. Once during each of your deploy phases, you may use 2 Force to deploy from Lost Pile one starship weapon, vehicle weapon or artillery weapon (for free).
front.lore: The X-wing's display panel allows for different firing patterns for different weapons. This gives the pilot the ability to switch weapon types with minimum time and energy loss.

pulls: One starship weapon from Lost Pile
One vehicle weapon from Lost Pile
One artillery weapon from Lost Pile
pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Weapons Display (V)
front.gametext: Plays on table. Whenever opponent excludes any character(s) from battle, they lose 2 Force. At end of opponent's turn, if you control two battlegrounds (a site and a system) and opponent deployed a card with ability and did not inititate a battle, may retrieve 1 Force.
front.lore: The X-wing's display panel allows for different firing patterns for different weapons. This gives the pilot the ability to switch weapon types with minimum time and energy loss.

front.title: •Weapons Display (V)
front.gametext: Plays on table. Whenever opponent excludes any character(s) from battle, they lose 2 Force. At end of opponent's turn, if you control two battlegrounds (a site and a system) and opponent deployed a card with ability and did not inititate a battle, may retrieve 1 Force.
front.lore: The X-wing's display panel allows for different firing patterns for different weapons. This gives the pilot the ability to switch weapon types with minimum time and energy loss.

front.title: •Weather Vane
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Any character here may be captured or rescued by a player's starship or vehicle controlling Cloud City during that player's control phase.  Character here lost if new character arrives.  Effect lost if Cloud City lost. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The metal rods extending from the bottom of Cloud City are part of the city's flotation system. Sensors detect the velocity of wind and the content of local clouds.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Weather Vane (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Character here lost if new character arrives.  Opponent generates no Force at your cloud sectors.  During owner's control phase, they must relocate character here to an unoccupied Cloud City site (place in Used Pile otherwise). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The metal rods extending from the bottom of Cloud City are part of the city's flotation system. Sensors detect the velocity of wind and the content of local clouds.

front.title: •WED-1016 'Techie' Droid
front.gametext: While at an exterior planet site or docking bay, once per turn may lose 1 Force to place a 'hit' starship or vehicle at same site, adjacent site, related system or related cloud sector in Used Pile instead of Lost Pile.
front.lore: Cybot Galactica starship maintenance droid. Repairs over 5,000 different onboard systems. Used by Rebel Alliance salvage teams.

front.title: •WED-9-M1 'Bantha' Droid
front.gametext: Adds immunity to attrition < 2 to all your vehicles and droids at same location. Also, if 'bantha' droid is at a docking bay, adds immunity to attrition < 3 to all your starfighters at the related system and related sectors and may cancel Lateral Damage.
front.lore: Unique treadwell droid cobbled together by Jawas. Now owned by the DeMaals, proprietors of Docking Bay 94. Nicknamed 'bantha' for its slow and stubborn personality.

front.title: •Wedge Antilles
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 2, also adds 2 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. May use 1 Force to take one Corellian Slip into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Highly decorated Corellian. Piloted Red 2 at the Battle of Yavin. A wealthy orphan, he bought a freighter with his inheritance. First joined the Alliance as a weapons smuggler.

combo: Wedge Antilles + Red 2 (or Pulsar Skate) + Moving To Attack Position

front.title: •Wedge Antilles (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting Pulsar Skate, it is maneuver +2 and Wedge draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. While at Tatooine (or with Booster, Luke, or Mirax), Set For Stun may not target characters here and Overwhelmed may not be played here.
front.lore: Highly decorated Corellian. Piloted Red 2 at the Battle of Yavin. A wealthy orphan, he bought a freighter with his inheritance. First joined the Alliance as a weapons smuggler.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by James Barnes - Texas States 2007)"

front.title: •Wedge Antilles (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting an [Independent] starfighter, it is maneuver +1 (+2 if Pulsar Skate) and Wedge draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. While with Booster or Mirax, your total battle destiny here is +1.
front.lore: Highly decorated Corellian. Piloted Red 2 at the Battle of Yavin. A wealthy orphan, he bought a freighter with his inheritance. First joined the Alliance as a weapons smuggler.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by James Barnes)"

front.title: •Wedge Antilles, Legendary Rogue
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots.  While piloting [A New Hope] Red 2: it gains [Nav Computer], it is maneuver and immunity to attrition +2, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise, and, if Wedge just forfeited, may use 1 Force to place him in Used Pile.
front.lore: Highly decorated Corellian. Piloted Red 2 at the Battle of Yavin. A wealthy orphan, he bought a freighter with his inheritance.

front.title: •Wedge Antilles, Red Squadron Leader
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots.  When piloting, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise (if Red 2, also adds 2 to maneuver).  When in battle with another Red or Rogue squadron pilot, once per battle may cancel one battle destiny just drawn.
front.lore: Corellian commander and leader of Rogue Squadron. Chose to have Rogue Squadron relaim the designation 'Red Squadron' at the battle of Endor.

front.title: •Wedge In Red Squadron 1
front.gametext: Permanent pilot is •Wedge, who provides ability of 3. During a battle with opponent's [Independent Starship] starship, may add one destiny to attrition or total power. Immune to Come With Me, Tallon Roll, and attrition < 4.
front.lore: Flown by Wedge Antilles as Red 2 at the Battle of Yavin. Redesignated at Endor. Rugged Incom fighter. Victory markers show its role in the attack on the first Death Star.

front.title: •Wedge In Red Squadron 1
front.gametext: Permanent pilot is •Wedge, who provides ability of 3. During a battle with opponent's [Independent Starship] starship, may add one destiny to total power or attrition. Immune to Come With Me, Tallon Roll, and attrition < 4.
front.lore: Flown by Wedge Antilles as Red 2 at the Battle of Yavin. Redesignated at Endor. Rugged Incom fighter. Victory markers show its role in the attack on the first Death Star.

front.title: •We'll Find Han
front.gametext: Deploy Han to same site as Chewie or your Lando (regardless of deployment restrictions). OR If Chewie and your Lando are in a battle together, subtract 3 from all attrition against you (cannot not fall below zero). OR Cancel I Had No Choice.
front.lore: 'I promise.' 'Auuuuuug!'

front.title: •We'll Find Han (V)
front.gametext: USED: Deploy Han (except Han, Chewie, And The Falcon) from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  LOST: Deploy Han (except Han, Chewie, And The Falcon) from your Lost Pile."
front.lore: 'I promise.' 'Auuuuuug!'

front.title: We'll Handle This / Duel Of The Fates
front.gametext: We'll Handle This:Deploy Theed Palace Generator Core, Theed Palace Generator, and Inner Strength.{While} this side up, opponent may not Force drain where opponent has a Dark Jedi, and your Force drains at Naboo sites where you have a Jedi may not be canceled.  Once during your control phase, may target one opponent's character present with your Jedi at an interior Theed Palace site.  Target is lost.{Flip} this card if an opponent's Dark Jedi is present at an interior Naboo battleground site.Duel Of The Fates:{While} this side up, you may not Force drain or initiate battle at any location where you have a Jedi.  Once during your move phase, your Jedi may initiate lightsaber combat against an opponent's Dark Jedi present: Each player draws 2 destiny.  Loser (lowest total) loses 2 Force (cannot be reduced).  If difference is 5 or greater, lost Force must come from Reserve Deck, and losing character is lost.{Flip} this card and retrieve 1 Force if opponent has no Dark Jedi present at any interior Naboo battleground.

back.title: We'll Handle This / Duel Of The Fates
back.gametext: We'll Handle This:Deploy Theed Palace Generator Core, Theed Palace Generator, and Inner Strength.{While} this side up, opponent may not Force drain where opponent has a Dark Jedi, and your Force drains at Naboo sites where you have a Jedi may not be canceled.  Once during your control phase, may target one opponent's character present with your Jedi at an interior Theed Palace site.  Target is lost.{Flip} this card if an opponent's Dark Jedi is present at an interior Naboo battleground site.Duel Of The Fates:{While} this side up, you may not Force drain or initiate battle at any location where you have a Jedi.  Once during your move phase, your Jedi may initiate lightsaber combat against an opponent's Dark Jedi present: Each player draws 2 destiny.  Loser (lowest total) loses 2 Force (cannot be reduced).  If difference is 5 or greater, lost Force must come from Reserve Deck, and losing character is lost.{Flip} this card and retrieve 1 Force if opponent has no Dark Jedi present at any interior Naboo battleground.

front.title: We'll Handle This / Duel Of The Fates (V)
front.gametext: We'll Handle This:Deploy Jedi Council Chamber.{For} remainder of game, you may not deploy Affect Mind, Senate, New Republic Characters, Rebel starships, or Rebels of ability > 2. You lose no Force to Vengeance Of The Dark Prince or Your Destiny. Jedi Survivor's [Maintenance] is canceled. Speak With The Jedi Council is a Used Interrupt.{While} this side up, Yoda is deploy -3 to Jedi Council Chamber. Your Force drains are -1.{Flip} this card if Yoda and two other Jedi are at Jedi Council Chamber.Duel Of The Fates:{While} this side up, Jedi are immune to attrition < 5 and ignore location deployment restrictions listed in their game text. Your lightsaber Force drain bonuses may not be canceled. You may not Force drain at Jedi Council Chamber. Whenever you initiate a battle with a Jedi, may retrieve 2 Force. Jedi Test #2 may deploy on any Jedi (as if completed), but applies only at that site.{Flip} this card (and place all Jedi Tests in Used Pile) if less than two Jedi at Jedi Council Chamber (unless Yoda there).

back.title: We'll Handle This / Duel Of The Fates (V)
back.gametext: We'll Handle This:Deploy Jedi Council Chamber.{For} remainder of game, you may not deploy Affect Mind, Senate, New Republic Characters, Rebel starships, or Rebels of ability > 2. You lose no Force to Vengeance Of The Dark Prince or Your Destiny. Jedi Survivor's [Maintenance] is canceled. Speak With The Jedi Council is a Used Interrupt.{While} this side up, Yoda is deploy -3 to Jedi Council Chamber. Your Force drains are -1.{Flip} this card if Yoda and two other Jedi are at Jedi Council Chamber.Duel Of The Fates:{While} this side up, Jedi are immune to attrition < 5 and ignore location deployment restrictions listed in their game text. Your lightsaber Force drain bonuses may not be canceled. You may not Force drain at Jedi Council Chamber. Whenever you initiate a battle with a Jedi, may retrieve 2 Force. Jedi Test #2 may deploy on any Jedi (as if completed), but applies only at that site.{Flip} this card (and place all Jedi Tests in Used Pile) if less than two Jedi at Jedi Council Chamber (unless Yoda there).

front.title: •We'll Take The Long Way
front.gametext: Deploy on a site. Your Republic characters may deploy here regardless of Objective deployment restrictions. Once per turn, if you just deployed a Republic character to an interior Naboo site, retrieve a non-character card into hand. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Actions borne of the love of one's planet can heavily outweigh those generated from simple battle orders.

front.title: •We'll Take The Long Way
front.gametext: If We Have A Plan on table, deploy on table. Imperials deploy +1 to Theed Palace Throne Room and, while you occupy that site, you may ignore your Objective's location deployment restrictions. Once per game, may take an [Episode I] system and/or a [Theed Palace] leader into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Actions borne of the love of one's planet can heavily outweigh those generated from simple battle orders.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: We're Doomed
front.gametext: If you have less than 15 Life Force, play during opponent's control phase. For remainder of turn, each time you must lose Force, the loss is cut in half (round up). If R2-D2 or C-3PO on table, round down.
front.lore: Threepio's many misadventures often threatened his continued operation. The luckless protocol droid developed a healthy sense of cynicism, and a keen grasp of the obvious.

front.title: •We're Leaving
front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on table. During the damage segment of a battle your opponent initiated, if you have no cards left that can be forfeited, you may place this Effect out of play to cancel all remaining battle damage. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Qui-Gon realized that sometimes it's best to just leave, before any more damage is done.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
cards.counterpart: Mind Tricks Don't Work On Me

front.title: •We're Leaving (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per game, may stack the top card of your Lost Pile beneath Credits Will Do Fine. May examine cards stacked beneath Credits Will Do Fine and place any two in owner's Lost Pile to take a starship into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle (or retrieve into hand).
front.lore: Qui-Gon realized that sometimes it's best to just leave, before any more damage is done.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Were You Looking For Me?
front.gametext: USED: Take one or two communications or protocol droids (or one of each) into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  LOST: Retrieve C-3PO. OR If C-3PO is in battle at a site, add one battle destiny (or two if with three Ewoks)."
front.lore: For the second time in the Endor mission, C-3PO saved the day.

front.title: •Wes Janson
front.gametext: Adds 1 to weapon destiny draws of anything he is aboard as a passenger (adds 3 if aboard Rogue 3 or with Wedge or Jek).
front.lore: Served for many years as a gunner with friend Jek Porkins in the Tierfon Yellow Aces. Expert marksmanship helped the Alliance earn some of its earliest victories.

front.title: •Wes Janson (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting Red 3, it gains [Nav Computer] and Wes draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. While aboard a starship or vehicle, its total weapon destiny is +1; if with Jek and it hits a target, opponent loses 1 Force from Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Served for many years as a gunner with friend Jek Porkins in the Tierfon Yellow Aces. Expert marksmanship helped the Alliance earn some of its earliest victories.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Alexander Sheynis - Berkeley V-Lite 2005)"

front.title: •Wes Janson, Rogue Veteran
front.gametext: Adds 2 to the power of anything he pilots. Once per turn may deploy from Reserve Deck (or deploy from hand) Disrupter Pistol for free on Wes; reshuffle. May fire Disruptor Pistol for 1 Force. Power and Forfeit +1 when with Hobbie or Wedge. If about to leave table place cards aboard Wes in owner's Used Pile.
front.lore: Served for many years as a gunner with friend Jek Porkins in the Tierfon Yellow Aces. Expert marksmanship helped the Alliance earn some of its earliest victories.

front.title: •Wesa Gotta Grand Army
front.gametext: USED: Take a Fambaa, Battle Plains, or Boss Nass' Chambers into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Subtract one from any just drawn weapon destiny.  LOST: Target an opponent's undercover spy with your Gungan. Target is lost."
front.lore: 'Gungans no die'n without a fight.'

combo: Wesa Gotta Grand Army + any Gungan Make opponent's undercover spy lost.

front.title: •Wesa Ready To Do Our-sa Part
front.gametext: Deploy on table. If your Gungan was just lost from a site, may place him here. Once per battle, may place one of your Gungans here out of play to add 4 to your total power during that battle.
front.lore: Every Gungan that died on the battle plains gave Amidala and her troops that much more time to capture the Viceroy.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Wesa Ready To Do Our-sa Part (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on Endor system or Naboo system. Your total power here is +1 for each Ewok or Gungan at related sites. Once per turn, may place your just lost Ewok or Gungan in Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Every Gungan that died on the battle plains gave Amidala and her troops that much more time to capture the Viceroy.

front.title: •WHAAAAAAAAAOOOOW!
front.gametext: If one of your characters was just defeated by a Dragonsnake, Rancor, Sarlacc, Dianoga or Wampa, instead of being 'eaten' that character is 'hurled' (relocated) to an adjacent site, if possible.
front.lore: 'You're lucky you don't taste very good.'

front.title: •What About That Blue One?
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Your total Force generation is +1. Once per game may take an astromech into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Fire Extinguisher may only cancel battles you initiate and [Virtual Block 4] Wokling is canceled. Once per game may retrieve a Rebel of ability < 5 or a Rebel starfighter. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'You haven't finished with me yet!'

front.title: •What Chance Do We Have?
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Whenever you lost Force (except from a Force drain or your card) during opponent's control phase, unless opponent occupies more battlegrounds that you, may reduce loss (to a minimum of 1) by the number of battlegrounds you occupy. (Immune to Alter.)

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •What Is Thy Bidding, My Master?
front.gametext: Deploy on Emperor or any system. Target one character whose lore uses the word 'Emperor.' Target cannot use ability to draw battle destiny and is excluded from being the 'highest-ability character.' Utinni Effect canceled when reached by target.
front.lore: Reaching across the galaxy, the Emperor uses his vast powers to require immediate submission and obedience. His minions frequently find this inconvenient.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •What Was It?
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a duel against one of your non-captive Jedi, deploy on that Jedi. Cancel the duel and relocate this Jedi to an adjacent site. Your duel destiny draws are each +1. (Immune to Control.)
front.lore: When Qui-Gon got away, Maul knew it would only be a matter of time until the two of them would meet again.

pulledBy: Don't Do That Again - Defensive Shield
Don't Do That Again (V) - Defensive Shield
We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •••What're You Tryin' To Push On Us?
front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on table and stack one just-played interrupt here. To play any new Interrupt of the same name, player must first stack it here and use +1 Force for each Interrupt in stack, even if Interrupt is normally free. (Immune to Control.)
front.lore: Moisture farmers like Own Lars must be on the lookout for repeated (and blatant) ploys by Jawas.

pulledBy: Don't Do That Again - Defensive Shield
Don't Do That Again (V) - Defensive Shield
We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Where's Han?
front.gametext: USED: Take Han's Dice or non-[Maintenance] Han into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. LOST: If you just lost a gambler, take that gambler into hand. OR Once per game, exchange a card in hand with a Resistance Agent or [Episode VII] Skywalker in Lost Pile."
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Whoooo!
front.gametext: Take a unique (•) N-1 starfighter into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR If a battle was just initiated at a system where opponent has a droid starfighter, all droid starfighters at that system are power -1 for remainder of turn.
front.lore: 'Look! One of ours, out of the main hold!'

front.title: Who's Scruffy-Looking?
front.gametext: Cancel Scruffy-Looking Nerf Herder or I'd Just As Soon Kiss A Wookiee or Furry Fury or This Is Just Wrong or Death Mark or Mournful Roar or Takeel or Ket Maliss. OR Double Rennek's power for remainder of turn.
front.lore: 'I must've hit pretty close to the mark to get her all riled up like that, huh kid?'

cancels: I'd Just As Soon Kiss A Wookiee

front.title: •Why Does Everyone Want To Go Back To Jakku?!
front.gametext: Deploy on table. May deploy Lor San Tekka from Resolve Deck; reshuffle. Once per turn, if you just lost a Resistance character from a Jakku site, may take a Resistance character of lesser ability into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Blank.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Wicket
front.gametext: Deploys only on Endor.  Power and forfeit +1 for each [Light Side Force] icon at same Endor site.  When in battle, may target one opponent's character present.  Draw destiny.  Target excluded from battle if destiny > ability.
front.lore: Ewok scout. Son of Shodu and Deej. Found Leia and befriended her. Persuaded his tribe to help.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.title: •Wicket (V)
front.gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Once per game, may use 3 Force to release a Rebel captive present on Endor. During your deploy phase, may use 1 Force to deploy an Ewok weapon or a unique (•) Ewok from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Ewok scout. Son of Shodu and Deej. Found Leia and befriended her. Persuaded his tribe to help.

front.title: •Wild Karrde
front.gametext: May add 3 pilots and 6 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. During battle, your total battle destiny is +1 for each smuggler aboard. Deploys and moves like a starfighter. Immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Wiorkettle
front.gametext: Power +1 if with Zutton. During your control phase, may use 1 Force to place one asteroid sector from hand onto Used Pile, search Reserve Deck, take one site into hand and reshuffle.
front.lore: A Snivvian on Cloud City, working for Planet Dreams, Inc. Terraforms asteroids, creating habitable atmospheres. Responsible for the aesthetics of the created environments.

pulls: One site when placing one asteroid sector onto Used Pile

front.title: •Wioslea
front.gametext: During your control phase, may use 1 Force to target an opponent's unoccupied transport vehicle or droid present. Draw destiny. If destiny > target's destiny number, use Force equal to target's deploy cost to 'purchase' target (use as if stolen).
front.lore: Bought Luke's landspeeder for Spaceport Speeders. A Vuvrian female. Gambler who owes Jabba 1,000 credits in wagering debts. Speaks many languages.

combo: Deploy her at the Cloud City: Incinerator and couple her with Spaceport Speeders and an R2-X2 (Artoo-Extoo) and you have a great combination which allows you to activate a lot of Force without losing any cards. Place her in a Cloud City Sabacc based deck and you have a gambler and a great draw during Sabacc games.
- Wioslea + Cloud City: Incinerator + Spaceport Speeders + R2-X2 (Artoo-Extoo)  Create a great Force generator!
- Wioslea + Cloud City Sabacc Helps you win Sabacc games!

front.title: •Wise Advice
front.gametext: Plays on table. Your Immediate Effects may play for free. Whenever opponent cancels your card with Sense or Alter, place that canceled card in Used Pile.
front.lore: The guidance of experienced Jedi allowed Luke to confront Vader.

front.title: •Wise Advice
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Your training destiny draws are each +1. Your Immediate Effects may deploy for free. Whenever opponent cancels your card with Sense or Alter, place that canceled card in Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The guidance of experienced Jedi allowed Luke to confront Vader.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Wokling
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on an Endor site where you have an Ewok.  Moves like a character.  Adds one [Light Side Force] icon while your Ewok is present.  Effect lost if you initiate a battle here or opponent controls this location.
front.lore: Every Ewok is taught to be protective of the younger members of their clan.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Wokling (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Your total Force generation is +1.  Once per game, may use 3 Force to take an Effect that has no deploy cost and deploys on another card into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  May place this Effect out of play to retrieve 1 Force. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Every Ewok is taught to be protective of the younger members of their clan.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Eric Hunter - Gen Con Winner 2002)"

front.title: •Wokling (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Your total Force generation is +1.  Once per game, may use 3 Force to take an Effect that has no deploy cost and deploys on another card into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  May place this Effect out of play to retrieve 1 Force. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Every Ewok is taught to be protective of the younger members of their clan.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Eric Hunter - Gen Con Winner 2002)"
pulls: An effect that has no deploy cost and deploys on another card
pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas

front.title: Wookiee
front.gametext: Power +1 at a jungle, forest or Kashyyyk site. Also power +1 at same site as any Imperial. Wookiee Strangle is a Used Interrupt. When Bowcaster is deployed on or fired by this Wookiee, X=1. Adds 3 to destiny of each of your bowcasters.
front.lore: Wookiees are known to be fierce warriors. Combine high technology with a primitive lifestyle. Escaped Imperial slavery after the Battle of Endor.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: Wookiee (V)
front.gametext: May move as a 'react'. While with another Wookiee, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. If about to be lost, may place any cards on him in owner's Used Pile and may draw top card from Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Wookiees are known to be fierce warriors. Combine high technology with a primitive lifestyle. Escaped Imperial slavery after the Battle of Endor.

front.title: •Wookiee Guide
front.gametext: Add 1 to landspeed of your scout at an exterior planet site for remainder of turn. OR If Han is with Leia or Chewie in battle, draw one destiny and subtract it from opponent's attrition against you.
front.lore: Chewie felt right at home in the forests of Endor, which closely resemble the environment on his homeworld of Kashyyyk.

front.title: •Wookiee Guide (V)
front.gametext: Stack a Wookiee from your Lost Pile on Grrrghrrrgh!. OR Deploy a Wookiee stacked on Grrrghrrrgh! to Kashyyyk (as if from hand). OR Once per game, draw X cards from top of Reserve Deck, where X = number of cards stacked on Grrrghrrrgh!.
front.lore: Chewie felt right at home in the forests of Endor, which closely resemble the environment on his homeworld of Kashyyyk.

front.title: •Wookiee Roar
front.gametext: If Chewbacca is defending a battle alone at a site, add two battle destiny.  OR  Use 3 Force to take Chewie into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  OR  Scare off (lose) one 'mouse' droid on table.
front.lore: 'GHRRRRAARRRRHG!'

front.title: •Wookiee Roar (V)
front.gametext: If a battle was just initiated involving a Wookiee, add one destiny to your total power (two if alone). That Wookiee is defense value +3 for remainder of turn. OR If you have 8 or more cards in hand, cancel a Force drain.
front.lore: 'GHRRRRAARRRRHG!'

front.title: •Wookiee Strangle
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to target an opponent's non-droid character present with one of your Wookiees. Both players draw destiny. Add ability and power. Target is lost if Wookiee's total destiny > target's total destiny.
front.lore: Wookiees have been known to dislocate more than just arms.

combo: Wookiee Strangle + any Chewbacca + Chewbacca's Bowcaster + Sorry About The Mess Your opponent has two characters less than he started the turn with - in your control phase.

front.title: •Wookiee Strangle (V)
front.gametext: Once per game, during your move phase, target opponent's character present with your Wookiee. Both players draw destiny. Add Wookiee's power; opponent adds target's defense value. Target lost if your total destiny +2 > opponent's total destiny.
front.lore: Wookiees have been known to dislocate more than just arms.

front.title: •Worrt
front.gametext: Habitat: planet sites (except Hoth). Does not attack your characters. When at a Tatooine site, prevents opponent's characters present from using their landspeed.
front.lore: Large, froglike creature often used by Jawas and other Tatooine denizens as guards. Keeps raiding parties and other unwelcomed guests at bay.

front.title: Wrist Comlink
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your Rebel. Your characters and vehicles at related sites may move as a 'react' to same or adjacent site.
front.lore: Favored by scouts and troopers over the hand-held model. Easy to operate in difficult environments.

front.title: •Wuta
front.gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each [Light Side Force] icon at same Endor site. Once during each of your deploy phases, if at an exterior Endor site, may use 2 Force to deploy an Endor site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Ewok explorer. Scout. Searches for fallen trees to make tools. Tracks predators. First to notice the Imperial presence on Endor.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
combo: Wuta + Ewok Sentry x2 + Sound The Attack Deploy Wuta and start pulling your sites. If the Dark Side player comes down for him, surprise them with two more Ewoks and an extra battle destiny.

front.title: •Wyron Serper
front.gametext: Once during each of your control phases, may peek at X cards randomly selected from opponent's hand, where X = number of [Dark Side Force] icons at same site. Also, when you are drawing destiny, adds 2 to the destiny of any card with 'scan' in the title.
front.lore: Rebel spy. Served undercover as a sensor specialist aboard the Star Destroyer Avenger. Assigned to scan for Imperial ships through the meteor activity of the Hoth system.

combo: Wyron Serper + Double Agent

front.title: •Wyron Serper (V)
front.gametext: Once per game, may take an Immediate Effect into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. If just forfeited from an opponent's starship site, may satisfy all remaining attrition and battle damage against you.
front.lore: Rebel spy. Served undercover as a sensor specialist aboard the Star Destroyer Avenger. Assigned to scan for Imperial ships through the meteor activity of the Hoth system.

front.title: X-wing
front.gametext: Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.
front.lore: Model T-65 by Incom Corporation. Delivered to Alliance by defecting design team. 12.5 meters long. Wings deploy in an 'X' position for better weapons coverage.

combo: X-wing + Organized Attack

front.title: X-wing Assault Squadron
front.gametext: *Replaces 3 X-wings at one location (X-wings go to Used Pile). Permanent pilots provide total ability of 3.
front.lore: A squadron of X-wings ran interference for Y-wings during their assault on the Death Star. Keeping a tight formation dramatically increased the squadron's efficiency.

front.title: X-wing Laser Cannon
front.gametext: Deploy on your X-wing. May target a starfighter using X Force, where X=0 to 3. Draw destiny. If destiny + X > defense value, target hit (lost instead if X=3).
front.lore: Quad Taim & Bak KX9 laser cannon. Fires singly or linked in groups of two or four. Smart pilots conserve energy and select only the cannons needed to score a hit.

pulledBy: Lieutenant s'Too Vees (when at a docking bay)

front.title: Y-wing
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.
front.lore: Rugged Rebel Alliance fighter. BTL-S3 has room for a second pilot to assist weapons operations. 16 meters long. Built by Koensayr.

combo: Y-wing + Organized Attack

front.title: Y-wing Assault Squadron
front.gametext: * Replaces 3 Y-wings at one location (Y-wings go to Used Pile). May add 3 pilots or passengers. Permanent pilots provide total ability of 3.
front.lore: The Rebel Alliance deploys starfighters in triangular formations to minimize exposure to enemy fire. Two function as wingmen to cover one leader.

front.title: •Yane
front.gametext: While at a Theed Palace site or same site as Amidala, opponent's Republic characters are deploy +1 here and Yane is forfeit +3. If just lost during a battle, may use 2 Force to place Yane in Used Pile.
front.lore: The youngest handmaiden, Yane stayed behind on Naboo while Amidala pleaded her case to the Galactic Senate. Musician.

front.title: •Yane (V)
front.gametext: Whenever opponent deploys a character to same or adjacent site, may activate 1 Force. While with Amidala, forfeit +1, and once per turn may peek at the top card of your Force Pile and Reserve Deck; return one card to each deck or pile.
front.lore: The youngest handmaiden, Yane stayed behind on Naboo while Amidala pleaded her case to the Galactic Senate. Musician.

front.title: •••Yarkora
front.gametext: If at same site as an Undercover spy during your control phase, may draw destiny. Each of your Yarkoras on table may cumulatively subtract one from that destiny. Spy's 'cover is broken' if destiny = spy's ability.
front.lore: Mysterious, secretive aliens. Tend to be found as couriers, scouts and t'bac farmers. Some have helped the Alliance's efforts at counterespionage.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
combo: Yarkora + Sorry About the Mess Though Yarkora is not a warrior, use Sai'torr Kal Fas or just combine him with another character who can carry a weapon. This will create a team that is sure to beat the spies.

front.title: •Yarna d'al' Gargan
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. While you have fewer than 13 cards in hand, your non-unique cards in hand (except Effects of any kind and Interrupts) are immune to Monnok. (Immune to Alter while you occupy two battlegrounds).
front.lore: Female dancer from Askajia. Very protective mother. Makes sure that all those she cares about are protected.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Yarna d'al' Gargan (V)
front.gametext: If Agents In The Court on table, deploy on table.  No Love For The Empire may not flip.  Bo Shuda may not be canceled.  Your characters at Jabba's Palace sites may not be attacked.  During your deploy phase, may use 1 Force to deploy a Tatooine battleground location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Female dancer from Askajia. Very protective mother. Makes sure that all those she cares about are protected.

front.title: •Yarna d'al' Gargan (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. While you have fewer than 13 cards in hand, non-unique aliens are immune to Monnok. Opponent may not increase deploy cost of your aliens. Once per turn, may deploy Arleil, Doallyn, Tessek, Wild Karrde, or a Tatooine battleground from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Female dancer from Askajia. Very protective mother. Makes sure that all those she cares about are protected.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Yarua
front.gametext: Agendas: justice, taxation. While in a senate majority, retrieve 1 Force when you initiate a Force drain at a battleground system. Once per turn, may use 1 Force to target a senator present with a wealth agenda. Target is politics -2 this turn.
front.lore: Kashyyyk's senior Wookiee senator. Believes that a thorough taxation plan will assist funding of other worthwhile Republic programs. Despises the corruption around him.

front.title: •Yarua (V)
front.gametext: Agenda: taxation. All Nudjs are lost. At end of your deploy phase, if with a Wookiee on Kashyyyk and you have 8 or more cards in hand, opponent loses 1 Force. Your Wookiees on Kashyyyk move for free using their landspeed.
front.lore: Kashyyyk's senior Wookiee senator. Believes that a thorough taxation plan will assist funding of other worthwhile Republic programs. Despises the corruption around him.

front.title: •Yavin 4
front.gametext: Light: : If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Yavin 4 sites.

front.title: •Yavin 4 (V)
front.gametext: Light: : Once per game, if a Critical Mission is deployed here may deploy from reserve deck an Effect on Yavin 4; reshuffle.

front.title: •Yavin 4 (V)
front.gametext: Light: : If Haven is canceled, place it in your Used Pile.

front.title: Yavin 4 Base Operations / The Time To Fight Is Now
front.gametext: Yavin 4 Base Operations:Deploy Yavin 4 system and Massassi War Room. May deploy Restore Freedom To The Galaxy.{While} this side up, once per turn, may use 1 Force to deploy a battleground system from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if Rebels control two battleground systems (or if four Rebels are on table).The Time To Fight Is Now:{While} this side up, during battles at sites related to systems you occupy, for each piloted unique (•) snub fighter present at that system, your total power is +2. Once during your draw phase, if a system is 'liberated', may place a card from your Lost Pile out of play to retrieve 1 Force.{Flip} this card if you do not occupy two battlegrounds (unless four Rebels are on table).

back.title: Yavin 4 Base Operations / The Time To Fight Is Now
back.gametext: Yavin 4 Base Operations:Deploy Yavin 4 system and Massassi War Room. May deploy Restore Freedom To The Galaxy.{While} this side up, once per turn, may use 1 Force to deploy a battleground system from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if Rebels control two battleground systems (or if four Rebels are on table).The Time To Fight Is Now:{While} this side up, during battles at sites related to systems you occupy, for each piloted unique (•) snub fighter present at that system, your total power is +2. Once during your draw phase, if a system is 'liberated', may place a card from your Lost Pile out of play to retrieve 1 Force.{Flip} this card if you do not occupy two battlegrounds (unless four Rebels are on table).

front.title: Yavin 4 Trooper
front.gametext: Deploys only to a Yavin 4 site or any jungle. Power -1 when not at a Yavin 4 site. Warrior's Courage and Blast The Door, Kid! played at same site are Used Interrupts. Forfeit +2 when present with a Rebel leader.
front.lore: Elite troop force assigned to Massassi Base in the jungles of Yavin 4. Responsible for monitoring the perimeter of the Rebel outpost.

front.title: •Yavin 4: Briefing Room
front.gametext: Light: : If you control, with a leader here, may add 1 to total of Attack Run.

front.title: •Yavin 4: Docking Bay
front.gametext: Light: : Your docking bay transit from here is free.

front.title: •Yavin 4: Jedi Academy
front.gametext: Light: : If a Dark Jedi on table, Force drain -1 here. Once per game, may deploy Jedi Luke here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Charles Clarkson - New York States 2006)"

front.title: •Yavin 4: Jungle
front.gametext: Light: : A Rebel alone here battles at power +2 and is immune to attrition.

front.title: •Yavin 4: Massassi Headquarters
front.gametext: Light: : May not be separated from interior Yavin 4 sites. If you control, Attack Run total is +2.

front.title: •Yavin 4: Massassi Ruins
front.gametext: Light: : If you control, with a leader here, your starships are each power +1 at Death Star system.

front.title: •Yavin 4: Massassi Ruins (V)
front.gametext: Light: : If Yavin 4 'blown away', Force loss is reduced by 4.

front.title: •Yavin 4: Massassi Throne Room
front.gametext: Light: : If this is your starting location, Light Side goes first in game.

front.title: •Yavin 4: Massassi War Room
front.gametext: Light: : If you control, with a leader here, all Stormtroopers and TIEs on table are forfeit -1.

front.title: •Yavin 4: Massassi War Room (V)
front.gametext: Light: : Once per game, may take into hand Rebel Aces from Reserve Deck; reshuffle and/or exchange a card in hand with top card of Force Pile.

front.title: •Yavin 4: Massassi War Room (V)
front.gametext: Light: : Once per game, may deploy a Rebel leader here from Reserve deck; reshuffle.

front.title: •Yavin Sentry
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy at any Yavin 4 site. Declare one of the following to affect that site and adjacent sites while 'sentry' present: Opponent's deploy +1. OR Opponent's ability required for battle destiny +1. OR Your total power +1.
front.lore: Rebel sentries are stationed on raised sensor platforms. On watch for Imperial scouts and other hazards, they supplement data gathered by Yavin Base's main sensors.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Yavin Sentry + Grondorn Muse

front.title: •Yavin Sentry (V)
front.gametext: Plays on table.  Colo Claw Fish is canceled.  Opponent must first use X Force to deploy a non-unique card (except a Jawa or Tusken Raider) to a location, where X = the number of copies of that card at that location.  [Reflections III] lightsaber weapon destiny draws cannot be increased above their printed value.
front.lore: Rebel sentries are stationed on raised sensor platforms. On watch for Imperial scouts and other hazards, they supplement data gathered by Yavin Base's main sensors.

front.title: •Yavin Sentry (V)
front.gametext: Plays on table. Colo Claw Fish is canceled. Opponent must first use X Force to deploy a non-unique card (except a Jawa or Tusken Raider) to a location, where X = the number of copies of that card at that location.

front.title: •Yerka Mig
front.gametext: Deploy at any location. You may move Mig like a character. Target an opponent's character, who may apprehend (cancel) Mig by reaching same location. Until then, during all battles at same and adjacent sites to Mig, opponent's total power is -1.
front.lore: An Imperial bureaucrat with high security clearance who resigned and fled in remorse after the occupation of his home planet, Ralltiir. Now a fugitive from the ISB.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Yerka Mig (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on Cantina. While all your ability on table is provided by aliens and [Independent Starship] starship pilots: whenever you deploy a unique (•) alien to a battleground, may retrieve 1 Force; and, during battle, your total power is +3. If opponent controls this location, this Effect lost.
front.lore: An Imperial bureaucrat with high security clearance who resigned and fled in remorse after the occupation of his home planet, Ralltiir. Now a fugitive from the ISB.

front.title: •Yoda
front.gametext: Deploy on Dagobah I must, but move elsewhere I may, yes. When the mentor, 1 to training destiny I add. Where present am I, battles and attacks happen not unless present a Dark Side character of ability > 3 there is. To attrition, immune am I.
front.lore: Help you I can, yes. For 800 years have I trained Jedi. Judge me by my size do you? Mm? And well you should not! For my ally is the Force... and a powerful ally it is.

combo: Yoda + Encampment Deploy regardless of location deployment restrictions.

front.title: •Yoda (V)
front.gametext: May deploy to Dagobah.  Prevents attacks at same Dagobah site.  Your training destiny draws are +1. Once per turn, may deploy (as if from hand) a Jedi Test from under Strong Is Vader. Once per game, may take The Way Of Things into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  Immune to attrition.
front.lore: Help you I can, yes. For 800 years have I trained Jedi. Judge me by my size do you? Mm? And well you should not! For my ally is the Force... and a powerful ally it is.

front.title: •Yoda (V)
front.gametext: May deploy to Dagobah. Prevents attacks at same Dagobah site. Your training destiny draws are +1. If Great Warrior on table, once per turn may take your just-drawn destiny into hand to chancel and redraw that destiny. Immune to attrition.
front.lore: Help you I can, yes. For 800 years have I trained Jedi. Judge me by my size do you? Mm? And well you should not! For my ally is the Force... and a powerful ally it is.

front.title: •Yoda Stew
front.gametext: During opponent's turn, take up to four cards from your hand and place them on top of your Force Pile.
front.lore: 'For the Jedi it is time to eat as well.'

front.title: •Yoda Stew & •You Do Have Your Moments
front.gametext: USED: During opponent's turn, take up to 4 cards from your hand and place them on top of your Force Pile.  LOST: At the start of the damage segment during a battle, before any cards have been forfeited, cause all attrition for both sides to be reduced to 0."

front.title: •Yoda, Great Warrior
front.gametext: Deploys only to battlegrounds. Power +3 when defending a battle. You may not deploy [Episode I] Jedi. While with a Wookiee, adds one battle destiny. Once per game, may lose 2 Force from Force Pile to cancel a non-[Immune to Sense] Interrupt. Immune to attrition.
front.lore: 'You must feel the Force around you. Here, between you, me, the tree, the rock, everywhere! Yes, even between the land and the ship.'

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Steven Lewis - Tennessee States 2006)

front.title: •Yoda, Keeper Of The Peace
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Coruscant. May lose 1 Force to cancel Force Lightning targeting your character present. Neither player may draw more than one battle destiny here (those destiny draws may not be modified or canceled). Immune to attrition.
front.lore: Yoda calls upon the Force often to try and foresee what destiny has in store.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Sean Miller)"

front.title: •Yoda, Master Of The Force
front.gametext: Deploys only to Naboo or Coruscant. Once per game, may take a Sense, Control, or Alter into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Your Jedi present are immune to attrition < 4 (or < 5 if a Jedi Council member). Immune to attrition.
front.lore: Jedi Council Member. 'More to say have you?'

combo: Yoda, Master Of The Force + Are You Brain Dead?! Yoda, Master Of The Force + Encampment Deploy regardless of location deployment restrictions.

front.title: •Yoda, Senior Council Member
front.gametext: Deploys only to Jedi Council Chamber. While at Jedi Council Chamber, you lose no Force from Dagobah: Cave and, during your move phase, may use 4 Force to relocate your other Jedi here to any site you occupy. Immune to attrition.
front.lore: Senior Jedi Council member. Responsible for the early training of Obi-Wan Kenobi. When Qui-Gon brought Anakin before the Council, Yoda voted not to train the boy.

combo: Yoda, Senior Council Member + Coruscant: Jedi Council Chamber For Force activation.
Yoda, Senior Council Member + Speak With The Jedi Council
Yoda, Senior Council Member + Are You Brain Dead?!
Yoda, Senior Council Member + Encampment Deploy regardless of location deployment restrictions.

front.title: •Yoda, Senior Council Member (AI)
front.gametext: Deploys only to Jedi Council Chamber. While at Jedi Council Chamber, you lose no Force from Dagobah: Cave and, during your move phase, may use 4 Force to relocate your other Jedi here to any site you occupy. Immune to attrition.
front.lore: Senior Jedi Council member. Responsible for the early training of Obi-Wan Kenobi. When Qui-Gon brought Anakin before the Council, Yoda voted not to train the boy.

front.title: •Yoda, Senior Council Member (V)
front.gametext: Deploys only to [Episode I] sites. While at Jedi Council Chamber, immune to attrition, Jedi are deploy -2 here, and (unless a Dark Jedi here) other Jedi may treat 'Jedi Council Chamber' in their game text as '[Episode I] battleground sites.'
front.lore: Senior Jedi Council member. Responsible for the early training of Obi-Wan Kenobi. When Qui-Gon brought Anakin before the Council, Yoda voted not to train the boy.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Jacob Taylor - PC Volunteer Award 2005)"

front.title: •Yoda, Senior Council Member (V) (AI)
front.gametext: Deploys only to [Episode I] sites. While at Jedi Council Chamber, immune to attrition, Jedi are deploy -2 here, and (unless a Dark Jedi here) other Jedi may treat 'Jedi Council Chamber' in their game text as '[Episode I] battleground sites.'
front.lore: Senior Jedi Council member. Responsible for the early training of Obi-Wan Kenobi. When Qui-Gon brought Anakin before the Council, Yoda voted not to train the boy.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Jacob Taylor - PC Volunteer Award 2005)"

front.title: •Yoda, You Seek Yoda
front.gametext: If Yoda is lost, use 1 Force to retrieve him from the Lost Pile. OR Use 3 Force to search through your Reserve Deck and take Yoda into your hand. Shuffle, cut and replace.
front.lore: 'Take you to him I will.'

front.title: •Yoda's Gimer Stick
front.gametext: Deploy on Yoda.  You may initiate battles and attacks where present.  OR  Use 2 Force to deploy on one of your characters of ability > 3.  Immune to attrition.  Where present, no battles or attacks may be initiated unless an opponent's character of ability > 3 present.
front.lore: A symbol of the Jedi Master and his ancient wisdom. Speak softly you may but a big stick you must carry, yes.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Yoda's Hope
front.gametext: Deploy on a character. When on the mentor, adds 1 to training destiny draws. If on Yoda, you may lose Effect to search your Reserve Deck and take into hand one card with 'levitation' in the title. Shuffle, cut and replace.
front.lore: 'You must feel the Force around you. Here, between you, me, the tree, the rock, everywhere! Yes, even between the land and the ship.'

pulls: One card with 'levitation' in the title
pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Yotts Orren
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Opponent's combat vehicles are each power -2 at same site. Once per game, may take Mechanical Failure and/or Free Ride into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Kadas'sa'Nikto. Smuggler who stole from shipments going in and out of Jabba's Palace. Part of Jabba's sail barge crew. Not trusted by anyone.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.title: •You Assume Too Much
front.gametext: Deploy on table. If no senator here, you may place a senator here from hand to draw two cards from top of Reserve Deck. If an order or rebellion agenda here, once during your draw phase may place all cards on your Political Effects in Used Pile.
front.lore: 'This is your arena. I feel I must return to mine.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: You Can Either Profit By This... / Or Be Destroyed
front.gametext: You Can Either Profit By This...:Deploy Tatooine:Jabba's Palace and Audience Chamber (with Han frozen there, he may not be moved when frozen). Opponent may deploy up to two aliens at Audience Chamber.{While} this side up, opponent may not Force Drain at Audience Chamber and you may not Force drain at Tatooine locations. You may not play Frozen Assets. Luke, C-3PO and R2-D2 are deploy -2 at Jabba's Palace sites (Master Luke deploys for free instead).{Flip} this card if Han is on Tatooine and not a captive.{Place} out of play if Tatooine is 'blown away.'Or Be Destroyed:{Immediately} retrieve 5 Force (or 10 if Han has power < 4) once per game.{While} this side up, cancels the game text of Bad Feeling Have I. Your unpiloted starfighters may deploy to exterior Tatooine locations. During your control phase, opponent loses 1 Force for each battleground location occupied by Han, Luke, Leia, Chewie, or Lando.{Flip} this card if Han is captured or not on table.{Place} out of play if Tatooine is 'blown away.'

back.title: You Can Either Profit By This... / Or Be Destroyed
back.gametext: You Can Either Profit By This...:Deploy Tatooine:Jabba's Palace and Audience Chamber (with Han frozen there, he may not be moved when frozen). Opponent may deploy up to two aliens at Audience Chamber.{While} this side up, opponent may not Force Drain at Audience Chamber and you may not Force drain at Tatooine locations. You may not play Frozen Assets. Luke, C-3PO and R2-D2 are deploy -2 at Jabba's Palace sites (Master Luke deploys for free instead).{Flip} this card if Han is on Tatooine and not a captive.{Place} out of play if Tatooine is 'blown away.'Or Be Destroyed:{Immediately} retrieve 5 Force (or 10 if Han has power < 4) once per game.{While} this side up, cancels the game text of Bad Feeling Have I. Your unpiloted starfighters may deploy to exterior Tatooine locations. During your control phase, opponent loses 1 Force for each battleground location occupied by Han, Luke, Leia, Chewie, or Lando.{Flip} this card if Han is captured or not on table.{Place} out of play if Tatooine is 'blown away.'

front.title: •You Do Have Your Moments
front.gametext: At the start of the damage segment during a battle, before any cards have been forfeited, cause all attrition for both sides to be reduced to zero.
front.lore: Sarcastic, Sardonic, Irreverent. Impertinent. Exasperating. Disrespectful. Outrageous and charming. Han was a scoundrel but Leia began to realize that she loved him.

front.title: •You Do Have Your Moments (V)
front.gametext: USED: Cancel and redraw a just drawn destiny.LOST: A just drawn battle destiny is +3."
front.lore: Sarcastic, Sardonic, Irreverent. Impertinent. Exasperating. Disrespectful. Outrageous and charming. Han was a scoundrel but Leia began to realize that she loved him.

front.title: You Have Failed Me For The Last Time
front.gametext: If Vader is on table when opponent has just initiated a battle, target one opponent's leader of ability < 6 involve in that battle. If opponent does not win battle, target is forfeit = 0 and is immediately lost (placed out of play if Ozzel).
front.lore: 'Lord Vader, the fleet has moved out of lightspeed and we're preparing to aah...ukh...uh...uuuuukkk!'

front.title: You Must Confront Vader
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Target a Skywalker who has completed Jedi Test #5.  While target on Dagobah, 'move phase' on Save You It Can may be treated as 'deploy phase.'  Until Jedi Test completed, battles you initiate at Vader's site are canceled and opponent loses 2 Force at start of your turn unless Vader is at a battleground site.  Attempt during your move phase when Vader with target (even as a non-frozen captive).  Vader and target duel: Each player draws destiny.  Add ability.  Highest total wins.  If target wins, test completed:  Leave on table.  Add one battle destiny in every battle.  Also, target is immune to attrition < 5.

front.title: You Will Go To The Dagobah System
front.gametext: During your control phase, use 1 Force to move any one of your [Hoth] characters of ability > 1 to any [Dagobah] location where you have presence. If moving to a Dagobah site, this movement is free and you do not need presence.
front.lore: 'There you will learn from Yoda, the Jedi Master who instructed me.'

front.title: You Will Go To The Dagobah System (V)
front.gametext: Deploy a character, device, starship, vehicle, or weapon to a Dagobah site (regardless of Dagobah deployment restrictions) from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR During your control phase, relocate your character to a Dagobah site.
front.lore: 'There you will learn from Yoda, the Jedi Master who instructed me.'

front.title: •You Will Take Me To Jabba Now
front.gametext: If Jabba is at a Jabba's Palace site, relocate one of your characters to that location from a related site. OR During your deploy phase, deploy one alien (at normal use of the Force) from Reserve Deck to the Audience Chamber; reshuffle.
front.lore: 'Et tu taka bu Jabba now.'

front.title: •You Will Take Me To Jabba Now (V)
front.gametext: When you play this Interrupt, may place a Rep stacked on your Objective in Used Pile. May deploy Seeking An Audience or an alien to Audience Chamber (for -1 Force) from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Reveal up to 3 Aliens stacked on I Know That Laugh or from hand (X = number of aliens revealed); activate X Force.
front.lore: 'Et tu taka bu Jabba now.'

front.title: •You'll Find I'm Full Of Surprises
front.gametext: If Luke and Vader present at same site, use 1 Force to initiate a duel between them. Either is power +2 if armed with a lightsaber. Draw destiny. Opponent draws two destiny. Both players add power. Loser is placed out of play.
front.lore: Even though he wasn't fully prepared to face the Dark Lord of the Sith, Luke rushed to save his friends.

front.title: •Young Skywalker
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. If drawn for weapon or battle destiny, may take into hand to cancel and redraw that destiny. Power +1 for each Dark Jedi here. During your control phase, unless a Dark Jedi at a battleground, may retrieve 1 Force. Immune to attrition < 6.
front.lore: 'I've taken care of everything.'

front.title: •Your Insight Serves You Well
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Opponent's Dark Jedi are defense value -1. Scanning Crew and 3,720 To 1 are canceled. You may place Effect in Lost Pile to take one [Endor] or [Death Star II] Effect that deploys for free into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Luke knew that while the dark side was quicker and more seductive, eventually evil would turn on itself.

pulls: One (Endor icon) or (Death Star II icon) Effect that deploys for free

You may place Effect in Lost Pile to take one [Endor] or [Death Star II] Effect that deploys for free into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)

front.title: •Your Insight Serves You Well (Death Star II) (V)
front.gametext: Plays on table. Scanning Crew is canceled. If an 'insert' card was just inserted or revealed, it is canceled. You lose no Force to Boonta Eve Podrace, and opponent's retrieval from Boonta Eve Podrace may not be canceled. While you occupy three battlegrounds, Watto's Box is suspended.
front.lore: Luke knew that while the dark side was quicker and more seductive, eventually evil would turn on itself.

front.title: •Your Ship?
front.gametext: Plays on table. Cancels A Dangerous Time. Each player may play only one card with 'sabacc' in title each turn. You may cancel an opponent's card with 'sabacc' in title by losing 1 Force from hand.
front.lore: Han was not sure if Lando had forgiven him for winning the Millennium Falcon. As the old gamblers' saying about sabacc goes: 'Win the game, lose a friend.'

front.title: •You're All Clear Kid!
front.gametext: Cancel I'm On The Leader. (Immune to Sense.)  OR  Use 1 Force during an Attack Run.  Move one TIE in Death Star: Trench (your choice) to Death Star system for free.  Add 1 to total of Attack Run if lead starfighter has matching pilot aboard.
front.lore: 'Now let's blow this thing and go home!'

front.title: •You've Got A Lot Of Guts Coming Here
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Unique (•) Rebels of ability = 3 are power and forfeit +1 (or power and forfeit +2 if at a Cloud City or Jabba's Palace site). While Han at a battleground, opponent retrieves no Force from Scum And Villainy. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Empire, Lando Calrissian, Jabba the Hutt. For Han Solo, it can be very hard to tell when your past is going to catch up with you.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
cancels: Force retrieval of Scum And Villainy while Han at a battleground

front.title: •Yoxgit
front.gametext: Deploys free to a Cloud City or Jabba's Palace site. Power + 2 on Cloud City. During your control phase, may use 3 Force to search your Lost Pile and take one weapon or device into hand.
front.lore: Male Ugnaught. Left Cloud City after the Empire took control. Works for Hermi Odle, helping to supply him with various weaponry. Hopes to someday return to Cloud City.

front.title: •Yoxgit (V)
front.gametext: Deploys free to (and power +2 at) a Cloud City, Jabba's Palace, or Maz's Palace location. Once per turn, if you just drew an alien (or [Independent] starship) for destiny, may take that card into hand to cancel and redraw that destiny.
front.lore: Male Ugnaught. Left Cloud City after the Empire took control. Works for Hermi Odle, helping to supply him with various weaponry. Hopes to someday return to Cloud City.

front.title: YT-1300 Transport
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot, 2 passengers and 1 vehicle. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Quad Laser Cannon and Surface Defense Cannon may deploy (and fire free) aboard.
front.lore: Reliable and durable. Widely used freighter made by Corellian Engineering Corporation. Sales have dramatically increased in proportion to the fame of Han Solo's ship.

front.title: YT-1300 Transport (V)
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 4 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. While all your ability is provided by aliens, Jedi, and [Independent Starship] starship pilots, this starship is forfeit +1, maneuver +1, and immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Reliable and durable. Widely used freighter made by Corellian Engineering Corporation. Sales have dramatically increased in proportion to the fame of Han Solo's ship.

front.title: •Yub Yub!
front.gametext: USED: Add 1 to forfeit of each of your Ewoks for remainder of turn.  LOST: Retrieve one card with 'Ewok' in the title. OR Cancel Dead Ewok, Imperial Tyranny or Empire's New Order."
front.lore: 'You're a jittery little thing, aren't you?'

front.title: •Yub Yub, Commander
front.gametext: USED: Deploy a Rogue Squadron pilot to a location you occupy with a Rogue Squadron pilot from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  LOST: Cancel an attempt by opponent to target a Rogue Squadron pilot to be captured or excluded from battle. Or if two Rogue Squadron pilots are in battle together, add one battle destiny."

front.title: •••Z-95 Bespin Defense Fighter
front.gametext: Permanent pilot provides ability of 1 and adds 1 to power. May add one alien pilot (suspends permanent pilot). Power +2 at Bespin locations. May be carried aboard starships like a vehicle.
front.lore: Used to combat pirate activity in and around Cloud City. Top speed in atmosphere 1,150 kph. Hyperdrive installed by Bespin Motors.

front.title: Z-95 Headhunter
front.gametext: Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1. Power and Maneuver +2 at non-unique cloud sectors. May be carried aboard starships like a vehicle.
front.lore: Developed by Incom/Subpro. Atmospheric fighter adapted for space travel. AF-4 version refitted with Incom 2a fission engines and two Taim & Bak KX5 laser cannons.

combo: Z-95 + Corellian Corvette Carry a starfighter on a Light Side capital ship.
- Z-95 + Out of Nowhere Maneuver of 4 is all that is needed.

front.title: •Zeb Orrelios
front.gametext: Adds 1 to power of anything he pilots. During battle with an opponent's combat vehicle (or with two Rebels), attrition against opponent is +2. Rebels here are immune to Trample.
front.lore: Lasat.

front.title: •Zev Senesca
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Rogue 2, also adds 3 to maneuver and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: Born on Kestic Station near the Bestine system. Daring pilot who can fly anything. Found Luke and Han in the Hoth wasteland. Piloted Rogue 2 at the Battle of Hoth.

front.title: •Zutton
front.gametext: Where present, just before opponent draws battle destiny, you may use 1 Force to reduce opponent's total battle destiny by 1.
front.lore: Snivvian also known as 'Snaggletooth.' A tortured artist who, like most Snivvians, is driven to live out the stories he creates.

combo: Zutton + Jeroen Webb + any Rebel leader

front.title: •Your Ship? (V)
front.gametext: Plays on table. Cancels A Dangerous Time. Each player may play only one card with 'sabacc' in title each turn. You may cancel an opponent's card with 'sabacc' in title by losing 1 Force from hand.
front.lore: Han was not sure if Lando had forgiven him for winning the Millennium Falcon. As the old gamblers' saying about sabacc goes: 'Win the game, lose a friend.'

front.title: Quite A Mercenary (V)
front.gametext: USED: Cancel Elis Helrot. (Immune to Sense) OR Cancel a smuggler's game text for remainder of turn. OR Take [Reflections II] Chewie or Mercenary Armor into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  LOST: During your move phase, 'break cover' of an Undercover spy."
front.lore: Smugglers and other rogues frequent spaceports along trade routes. 'Your friend is quite a mercenary. I wonder if he really cares about anything, or anybody.'.
